original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore the self definitely exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las bdag gi ngo bo nyid nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad du bdag spyir dam 'cha' na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul las bdag gi ngo bo nyid nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad du bdag spyir dam 'cha' na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you do not specify the nature of the self in accordance with your philosophical tenets, but instead assert the self in general, then your argument is pointless.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lung las kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi lung las kyang /
translated: Because even in our scriptures it is said:

original: bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi sgra rnam par shes pa la ni don ji lta ba bzhin yin la /
translated: The term “self” is used in accordance with its meaning in relation to consciousness.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dag la ni nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: But in relation to birth and so on, it is a metaphorical designation.

original: dper na shing rta'i yan lag la brten nas shing rtar gdags par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na shing rta'i yan lag la brten nas shing rtar gdags par 'dod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as it is asserted that a chariot is imputed in dependence on its parts,

original: phung po la brten nas sems can du gdags par 'dod la /
analyzed: phung po la brten nas sems can du gdags par 'dod la /
translated: so it is asserted that a sentient being is imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: rnam par shes pa ni yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because consciousness is said to be the self because it appropriates the existence of rebirth.

original: ci ste sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang / bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul la dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang / bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i spyod yul la dngos ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: But if you think that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and that the mind is not the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self,”

original: byas pa'i phyir dper na lus bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dper na lus bzhin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not so because it is a product, like the body.

original: de la 'dir gal te pha rol po dag don dam par sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te
analyzed: de la 'dir gal te pha rol po dag don dam par sems pa ni bdag gi sgra'i spyod yul dngos dang bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo'i don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te
translated: In response to this, if the opponent is demonstrating that ultimately the mind is not the actual referent of the term “self” and that the mind is not the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self,” then this is establishing what is already established for us,

original: / bdag tu lta ba rnam pa thams cad kyang thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / bdag tu lta ba rnam pa thams cad kyang thams cad du spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we also assert that the view of self is to be completely abandoned in all ways.

original: 'on te tha snyad du na ni /
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad du na ni /
translated: But if you are speaking conventionally,

original: de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then this is not correct.🔽Because we also assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,

original: sgra dang blo'i btags pa dang / dngos kyi nges pa rang gi grub pa'i mthar yang sgrub pa tha snyad @182a * //
analyzed: sgra dang blo'i btags pa dang / dngos kyi nges pa rang gi grub pa'i mthar yang sgrub pa tha snyad @182a * //
translated: since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,🔽since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,🔽since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,🔽since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,🔽since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,🔽since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,🔽since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,🔽since we assert that the mind is the actual referent of the term “self” and the mind is the actual referent of the cognition that knows “self” in terms of the conventional,

original: du 'dod pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du 'dod pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since we assert that the mind is the

original: don dam par ni bdag ni sgra yang bdag la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni bdag ni sgra yang bdag la dngos su yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: But in reality, the word “self” does not establish the self as a real entity.

original: seng ge'i sgra brjod pa'i don kyang btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra brjod pa'i don kyang btags par yod pa'i phyir yul de la seng ge'i sgra yang don ji lta ba bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the word “lion” is also a nominal existent, and the word “lion” is not a real entity with respect to its referent.

original: yang na sgra 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste /
analyzed: yang na sgra 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa de ni 'dus pa la yod par mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, the nominal designation of some word is seen to exist in the collection.

original: spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin pas /
analyzed: spyi la nye bar btags pa'i phyir seng ge la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin pas /
translated: Because it is nominally designated in the universal, like the word “lion” and so on.

original: des bdag gi sgra 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod pa nyid sel bar byed pas des na dam bcas pa la /
analyzed: des bdag gi sgra 'dus pa ma yin pa la dngos su yod pa nyid sel bar byed pas des na dam bcas pa la /
translated: Therefore, the word “self” eliminates the real existence of a noncomposite entity.

original: chos kyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Thus, the fault of the thesis being contradicted by a particular fact is present.

original: des blo'i phyogs la yang skyon gyi lan btab bo //
analyzed: des blo'i phyogs la yang skyon gyi lan btab bo //
translated: This also answers the fault in the case of the mind.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some Sāṃkhyas say:

original: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The existence of consciousness is the nature of the person.

original: de yang smra ba thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin pas /🔽kho bo cag gis de yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de yang smra ba thams cad kyis khas blang bar bya ba yin pas / kho bo cag gis de yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: Moreover, since it is accepted by all who speak,🔽we do not offer a syllogism to prove that it exists.

original: 'di ltar de'i khyad par za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i khyad par za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: For, in that case, we would have to teach its special attributes, such as being the experiencer.

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces shes pa yod pa nyid ni shes pa dang / don gcig la shes pa ni blo yin pas /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad ces shes pa yod pa nyid ni shes pa dang / don gcig la shes pa ni blo yin pas /
translated: If others say, “The existence of consciousness is the same as consciousness, and consciousness is the mind.

original: de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes zer na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ni skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes zer na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the existence of consciousness is not the nature of the person,” that is illogical.

original: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not the existence of consciousness.

original: skye ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: It arises, like a pot, for example.

original: de bzhin nyid du dag par bya ba nyid dang / spag par bya ba nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du dag par bya ba nyid dang / spag par bya ba nyid dang / phan gdags par bya ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is to be purified, to be cleansed, to be benefited, and so on.

original: dper na hvags la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na hvags la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is like a stick and so on. Therefore, the mind does not exist as consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid de ni longs spyad par bya ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pas de ni za ba po nyid yin par grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid de ni longs spyad par bya ba'i khongs su ma gtogs pas de ni za ba po nyid yin par grub ste /
translated: Therefore, since the existence of consciousness is not included among the objects of experience, it is established that it is the experiencer.

original: bdag dang zhing shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: bdag dang zhing shes pa zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: It is a synonym for the self, the field, and consciousness.

original: de'i khyad par ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba nyid dang / yal bar 'dor ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba nyid dang / yal bar 'dor ba nyid la sogs pa dag yin no //
translated: Its distinctions are permanence, omnipresence, indifference, and so on.

original: de la 'dir bdag gi shes pa yod pa nyid dang / thams cad du song ba nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa smras zin pas de dag ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir bdag gi shes pa yod pa nyid dang / thams cad du song ba nyid dang / za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag dgag pa smras zin pas de dag ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Here, since the existence of the self, its omnipresence, its being the experiencer, and so on have already been refuted, they are not good.

original: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i don gang yin /
analyzed: blo ni shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the thesis, “The mind does not exist as consciousness”?

original: sems med pa 'am shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yin no zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
analyzed: sems med pa 'am shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yin no zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do //
translated: If it is the power of the nonexistence of mind or the existence of consciousness, then the opponent is harmed.

original: gal te sems @182b pa las gzhan zhig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems @182b pa las gzhan zhig yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is different from mind,

original: yang gang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de gang yin te de yang med do //
analyzed: yang gang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de gang yin te de yang med do //
translated: then what is it that is different from what? But that is not possible.

original: de ltar de ma grub pa'i phyir dam bcas pa la brten pa ma grub pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: de ltar de ma grub pa'i phyir dam bcas pa la brten pa ma grub pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: Thus, since that is not established, the error of non-establishment of the proposition remains.

original: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don kyang gang yin /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don kyang gang yin /
translated: Moreover, what is the meaning of the reason “because it arises”?

original: gal te ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni rang la gtan tshigs ma grub bo //
analyzed: gal te ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni rang la gtan tshigs ma grub bo //
translated: If you say that it is because it arises from what did not previously exist, then the reason is not established for you.

original: gal te rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
analyzed: gal te rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
translated: If you say that even though the reason is not established for you, it does indicate the meaning of the proposition,

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhe na /
translated: just as a reason acknowledged by both parties in a debate can indicate the meaning of the proposition,

original: gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub mi nus par nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub mi nus par nges par gzung ste /
translated: then you should definitely accept that a reason acknowledged by the other party alone cannot prove the meaning of the proposition.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa bzhin pas blo shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa bzhin pas blo shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do //
translated: Since it is not established for either one, it is like the nonestablishment for the opponent. Therefore, since the inference that demonstrates the nonexistence of the cognition of the mind is contradicted, there is no fault of the nonestablishment of the meaning of the reason.

original: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal ba nyid yin par rtog na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe la bsgrub pa'i chos med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don gsal ba nyid yin par rtog na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / dpe la bsgrub pa'i chos med pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If the meaning of the reason “because of arising” is taken to be manifestation, then there is the fault that the meaning of the reason is not established and the example lacks the property being proven.

original: gsal ba dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the refutation of manifestation has already been explained.

original: rigs pa la mi mkhas pa kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: rigs pa la mi mkhas pa kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Someone who is unskilled in reasoning says,

original: phung po lnga dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag khas ma blangs par de'i khyad par dgag pa'i sgrub pa smra bar mi rigs pas /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus 'di bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag khas ma blangs par de'i khyad par dgag pa'i sgrub pa smra bar mi rigs pas /
translated: The body with its five aggregates and its sense organs is not even the uncommon cause of the self’s observation.

original: bdag la sdang ba khyed kyis khas blangs ba la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la sdang ba khyed kyis khas blangs ba la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not logical to posit a refutation of its attributes without accepting the self, you who are hostile to the self are undermined.

original: de la 'dir tha snyad kyi dbang gis bdag spyir khas blangs nas /
analyzed: de la 'dir tha snyad kyi dbang gis bdag spyir khas blangs nas /
translated: Here, having accepted the self in general by the power of convention,

original: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gi chos rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / byed pa po dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bsal bas tha snyad du gzhan gyis brtags pa'i bdag stong pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gi chos rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / byed pa po dang za ba po nyid la sogs pa dag bsal bas tha snyad du gzhan gyis brtags pa'i bdag stong pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir dang /
translated: the attributes of the self imagined by others, such as permanence, omnipresence, and being an agent and a consumer, are refuted. Thus, the self imagined by others is shown to be empty by convention.

original: don dam par ni thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du ston pas tha snyad du de'i khyad par tsam bsal du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni thams cad kyang stong pa nyid du ston pas tha snyad du de'i khyad par tsam bsal du med pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since ultimately everything is emptiness, it is not the case that the mere attributes of the self cannot be refuted by convention.

original: khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la gnod par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Since it is not harmed by the assertion of the existence of the self,

original: de'i phyir de ni nam mkha' ldang du zad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni nam mkha' ldang du zad do //
translated: it is just a flight into the sky.

original: phyir rgol ba dag na re /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba dag na re /
translated: Opponents say:

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The self definitely exists.

original: kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir 'di ni khron pa na chu med do zhes khron par bdag pa'i phyir gzhan du na chu yod pa nyid shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kha cig tu de bkag pa'i phyir 'di ni khron pa na chu med do zhes khron par bdag pa'i phyir gzhan du na chu yod pa nyid shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is refuted in some places, it is like the knowledge that water exists elsewhere, since it is said that there is no water in this well.

original: de bzhin du lus dang / @183a * //🔽dbang po dang / blo dag la bdag bkag pa'i phyir /🔽dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la bdag med do zhes lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la bdag bkag pa yod pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang / @183a * // dbang po dang / blo dag la bdag bkag pa'i phyir / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la bdag med do zhes lus dang dbang po dang blo dag la bdag bkag pa yod pas /
translated: Similarly, the self is refuted in the body,🔽the faculties, and the mind.🔽Since the self is refuted in the body,

original: gzhan la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzhan la bdag yod pa nyid du 'gyur bas /
translated: the faculties, and the mind, the self exists elsewhere.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the self definitely exists.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams la byed pa po dbang phyug dang / byed pa po gtso bo dang / byed pa po dus dang / byed pa po sred med kyi bu dag med do zhes bkag kyang /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams la byed pa po dbang phyug dang / byed pa po gtso bo dang / byed pa po dus dang / byed pa po sred med kyi bu dag med do zhes bkag kyang /
translated: Although the internal sense bases are refuted as being the creator, the almighty, the primary creator, the creator time, and the creator Nārāyaṇa,

original: gzhan gang la yang byed pa po de dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gang la yang byed pa po de dag gi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: since the effects of those creators do not exist in any other, it is not definite.

original: don dam par ni chu la sogs pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni chu la sogs pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: In the ultimate, since water and so on are not established,

original: dpe med pas /
analyzed: dpe med pas /
translated: there is no example.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this is not logical.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig yang bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan pa dag la skyon 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig yang bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa sngar bstan pa dag la skyon 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Some Sāṃkhyas raise objections to the previous refutations of the self that were presented through inference.

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can bum pa la sogs pa lta bu dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas dpe med pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i dngos por gyur pa dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dpe med do zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos can bum pa la sogs pa lta bu dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas dpe med pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i dngos por gyur pa dag kyang dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dpe med do zhe na /
translated: Also, such things as a vase that are subject to destruction are not similar to the self, because they are not examples, since they are not the uncommon cause of observation, and also because such things as a vase that are objects of the sense faculties are not examples, since they are not the uncommon cause of observation.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni de kho na rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin par mi rigs te /
translated: because it is not logical that such things as a vase are the uncommon cause of observation for those who possess knowledge of reality.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i rna ba la sogs pa dag gi blo'i yul bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang / bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ngo bo nyid du ma gyur pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i blo dag gi yul yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i rna ba la sogs pa dag gi blo'i yul bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir dang / bum pa la sogs pa dbang po'i ngo bo nyid du ma gyur pa dag dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because you accept such things as pots, which are not of the nature of the sense faculties, as examples, the fault you charge us with does not apply to us.

original: nus pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir de yod pas bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe med par yang mi 'gyur bas de ni snying po ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir de yod pas bum pa la sogs pa'i dpe med par yang mi 'gyur bas de ni snying po ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no inference to prove that the self has the capacity to act, and since the example of pots and so on is not invalidated by the nonexistence of the self, your argument is pointless.

original: bdag tu smra ba dag na re bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag na re bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The proponents of the self say that the self exists because

original: bdag gi yod pa'i phyir dper na nor yod pa'i phyir nor bdag yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gi yod pa'i phyir dper na nor yod pa'i phyir nor bdag yod pa bzhin no //
translated: the “mine” exists, just as the owner of the wealth exists because the wealth exists.

original: 'di la bdag gi khang khyim dang gnas mal dang / gos zas dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa la sogs pa de dag yod pas /
analyzed: 'di la bdag gi khang khyim dang gnas mal dang / gos zas dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa la sogs pa de dag yod pas /
translated: In this case, the “mine” refers to such things as the house, bed, clothes, food, views, and so on that the self possesses.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the self surely exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: 'di ltar bdag yod na ni de'i 'di yin no zhes bdag gi yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag yod na ni de'i 'di yin no zhes bdag gi yang 'grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the self existed, then “this is mine” would be established.

original: bdag de ni med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag de ni med par bstan zin pas de'i phyir //
translated: But since the self has been shown to be nonexistent,

original: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the self does not exist,

original: bdag @183b gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag @183b gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could “mine” exist?

original: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: dpe yang med de /
analyzed: dpe yang med de /
translated: Nor is there an example.

original: don dam par nor dang nor bdag yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par nor dang nor bdag yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because neither wealth nor the owner of wealth is ultimately established as existing.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: There is also contradiction with the meaning.

original: bdag tha snyad pa yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tha snyad pa yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches that the self is conventional.

original: 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i yon tan yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i yon tan yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This also replies to the faults in the reasons “because its effect exists,” “because its quality exists,” and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnal 'byor pa yang dag pa nyid so sor rtog pa la brtson pa la /🔽bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnal 'byor pa yang dag pa nyid so sor rtog pa la brtson pa la / bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, the yogi who is intent on discerning reality🔽will have no more grasping at “I” and “mine”

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med 'gyur //
translated: because of the pacification of “I” and “mine.”

original: zhes bya bas ni ji skad bstan pa'i tshul bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni ji skad bstan pa'i tshul bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the result of the cultivation of the method that was taught.

original: bdag tu smra ba dag kyang phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag kyang phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: The proponents of a self may object, saying,

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: “The self surely exists,

original: lus dang dbang po dang / blo la sogs pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa rnams la de kho na shes pa yang dag par skyes pa la /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang / blo la sogs pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa rnams la de kho na shes pa yang dag par skyes pa la /
translated: because when the body, the faculties, and the mind are not the self or belonging to the self, and when the knowledge of reality arises,

original: ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med do snyam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med do snyam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no more grasping at ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: mo gsham gyi bu lta bu med pa la ni de lta bu med do //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu lta bu med pa la ni de lta bu med do //
translated: But this is not the case for something that does not exist, like the son of a barren woman.”

original: thar pa'i gnas skabs gang la 'ang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa de la ni de ltar shes pa de yod pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: thar pa'i gnas skabs gang la 'ang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa de la ni de ltar shes pa de yod pas de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: And in any state of liberation, there is no grasping “I” and no grasping “mine.” Since that is known, therefore the self surely exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽'phags pa nyan thos 'du byed kyi tshogs gzhan dang gzhan du skyes pa skad rig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can bdag dang / bdag gi med pa la nges par lta ba la yang bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir skye ba dang /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / 'phags pa nyan thos 'du byed kyi tshogs gzhan dang gzhan du skyes pa skad rig ma re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can bdag dang / bdag gi med pa la nges par lta ba la yang bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir skye ba dang /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'chi ba 'di dag ni chos tsam du zad do zhes bya bar lta ba skye ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba 'di dag ni chos tsam du zad do zhes bya bar lta ba skye ste /
translated: Even for noble śrāvakas, who see the aggregates as arising and passing away, who know the languages of all beings, and who definitely see that the self and being mine do not exist, because the thing called self does not exist, the view arises that birth and death are mere phenomena.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yin pas med na de yang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni ngar 'dzin pa'i yul yin pas med na de yang mi 'byung la /
translated: Because the self is the object of grasping “I,” if it does not exist, that also does not occur.

original: de med pa kho na'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang la yang nga yir 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med cing nga yir 'dzin pa med pa tha snyad kyi brdar bya ba ma rtogs par nga zhes bya ba rang gi ngo
analyzed: de med pa kho na'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po gang la yang nga yir 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med cing nga yir 'dzin pa med pa tha snyad kyi brdar bya ba ma rtogs par nga zhes bya ba rang gi ngo
translated: Because that does not exist, it is untenable to grasp any inner or outer thing as “I” or “mine.” Therefore, there is no grasping “I” and no grasping “mine.”🔽

original: bo nyid nges par skye bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: bo nyid nges par skye bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: Because it does not exist, it is untenable to grasp any internal or external thing as “I” or “mine.” Therefore, since there is no grasping “I” and no grasping “mine,” without understanding the conventional designation, the so-called “I” will not arise by its own intrinsic reality.🔽Since this is so, what need is there to mention the bodhisattvas who abide in the practice of nonconceptual wisdom, who see conditioned things as nonarisen?

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'du byed skye ba med par lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyad pa la gnas pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'du byed skye ba med par lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyad pa la gnas pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang //
translated: That which is free of grasping “I” and grasping “mine”

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽bdag la sogs pa dag btags par yod pa'i phyir dang / gang zag gi nye @184a * //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te / zhes bya ba gsungs te / bdag la sogs pa dag btags par yod pa'i phyir dang / gang zag gi nye @184a * //
translated: Also does not exist.

original: bar len pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bar len pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that since the self and so on are imputedly existent, and since the appropriation of the person is nonarisen.

original: de nyid yod pa ma yin pas rab rib can dbang po nyams pas skra shad dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba ltar /🔽ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
analyzed: de nyid yod pa ma yin pas rab rib can dbang po nyams pas skra shad dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba ltar / ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
translated: Since that does not exist, like a person with cataracts who has a defective faculty, seeing what is not real, such as falling hairs, flies, and so on,🔽One who sees without grasping “I” and “mine”

original: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
translated: Does not see.

original: yod pa dang med par mthong ba ni log par lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod pa dang med par mthong ba ni log par lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that seeing existence and nonexistence is the extreme of holding wrong views to be supreme.

original: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bdag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self that is the cause of grasping “I” and grasping “mine” exists.

original: don rang la ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: don rang la ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The meaning is not established for you.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med do zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo nyid du des pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med do zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo nyid du des pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the statement “Grasping ‘I’ and grasping ‘mine’ do not exist” is not established for you.

original: gal te nang gi byed pa bdag med par lta bas ngar 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir dang / yid bdag ma yin pa yang gzhan gyi don lus dang dbang po'i yul dag la nga yir 'dzin pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /🔽bdag la bdag tu lta ba la ngar 'dzin pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i don byed pa dang / rten sgra la sogs pa dag la nga yir 'dzin pa 'jug pa mi ldog pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gal te nang gi byed pa bdag med par lta bas ngar 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir dang / yid bdag ma yin pa yang gzhan gyi don lus dang dbang po'i yul dag la nga yir 'dzin pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na / bdag la bdag tu lta ba la ngar 'dzin pa don ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i don byed pa dang / rten sgra la sogs pa dag la nga yir 'dzin pa 'jug pa mi ldog pa'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang /
translated: Someone might say, “There is no error because the view of the nonexistence of an internal agent stops the conception of ‘I,’ and the conception of ‘mine’ does not engage in the body and sense faculties, which are not the self.”

original: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ma grub pas de ni lan ma yin te /
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ma grub pas de ni lan ma yin te /
translated: The conception of “I” exists in the view of the self as a self, and the conception of “mine” engages in the objects of the self, such as sound, and so on, which are the basis of its activity. Since it is not the case that the conception of “I” and the conception of “mine” do not exist, this is not a response.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba yod //
translated: If what is called “self” exists,

original: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya de mi rigs //
translated: it is not tenable to say “selflessness.”

original: yang na de nyid rtogs pa'am //
analyzed: yang na de nyid rtogs pa'am //
translated: Or, that itself would be understood,

original: mya ngan 'das pa des brdzun 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa des brdzun 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and nirvana would be false.

original: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig ni rang bzhin thar par smra la /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig ni rang bzhin thar par smra la /
translated: Here, some Sāṃkhyas say that natural liberation exists.

original: kha cig ni skyes bu thar par smra ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni skyes bu thar par smra ste /
translated: Some say that the self is liberated.

original: de la re zhig gang dag / rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can ni //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag / rang bzhin sna tshogs rten can ni //
translated: First, those who say that the self is the support of the variety of natures

original: 'khor dang 'ching dang thar par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor dang 'ching dang thar par 'gyur //
translated: are bound by the cycle of existence and are liberated.

original: zhes zer ba de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyom pa'i blo ni log par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyom pa'i blo ni log par lta ba yin te /
translated: The thought that the self is one thing and its nature another is a wrong view,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽thar par gyur pa yang skyes bu du ma dag gi thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro // thar par gyur pa yang skyes bu du ma dag gi thun mong yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not different from that.🔽Liberation is also not tenable, because liberation is common to many persons,

original: don dam par ma byas pa'i skyes bu dag gi phyir 'jug pas thar pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par ma byas pa'i skyes bu dag gi phyir 'jug pas thar pa med do //
translated: and because it is engaged for the sake of persons who are not ultimately existent.

original: gang dag skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i 'ching bas /
analyzed: gang dag skyes bu'i dbang du byas pa'i 'ching bas /
translated: Those who say that the self is bound by the bonds that are dependent on the person

original: sngar bcings pa thar bar 'gyur bar smra ba /
analyzed: sngar bcings pa thar bar 'gyur bar smra ba /
translated: and is liberated from what previously bound it,

original: de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du blos nges par byas pa yang skyes bu snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa la gang gis bcings pa dang thar pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par @184b med do //
analyzed: de dag gi bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du blos nges par byas pa yang skyes bu snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa la gang gis bcings pa dang thar pa zhes bya bar brjod pa'i khyad par @184b med do //
translated: And if you think that the self is different from the other and also different from its nature, then there is no difference between the former and latter persons, in terms of which one is said to be bound and the other liberated.

original: gal te yongs su 'gyur na yang //
analyzed: gal te yongs su 'gyur na yang //
translated: If it transforms,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the error arises that consciousness does not exist because it transforms.

original: ji ste yod pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis nang gi byed pa snying stobs shes che bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: ji ste yod pa tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis nang gi byed pa snying stobs shes che bar gyur pa na /
translated: But if you think that the self is different from the other and also different from its nature, because the internal agent is helpful by its mere existence, and when sattva predominates,

original: gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bdag kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis bdag kyang gzhan la /
translated: then the self is the cause of the arising of the reflection,

original: rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par 'gyur na yang de lta na yang nang gi byed pa la bye brag yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du nges par 'gyur na yang de lta na yang nang gi byed pa la bye brag yod par zad kyi /
translated: and the nature is different, then in that case, the internal agent would be different, but

original: skyes bu la bye brag med pas thar pa med do //
analyzed: skyes bu la bye brag med pas thar pa med do //
translated: the person would not be different, so liberation would be impossible.

original: bye brag yod na yang skyon snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag yod na yang skyon snga ma bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is a difference, then the previous error would apply.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa zlog pa yod kyang skyes bu la shes pa zlog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang gzhan la rang bzhin yang gzhan no snyam du shes pa zlog pa yod kyang skyes bu la shes pa zlog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: even though the cognition “the self is one thing and the intrinsic nature is another” is reversed, the cognition of the person is not reversed.

original: khyed rgyu'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul gyis thar par 'dod pa de la yang skyes bu la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa la phyis kyang shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid de /
analyzed: khyed rgyu'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i tshul gyis thar par 'dod pa de la yang skyes bu la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir snga nas ma bzlog pa yin pa la phyis kyang shes pa ma nor ba skye mi srid de /
translated: Also, in your system, liberation is asserted to be the arising of a reflection of the cause, but since the person is immutable, it is not reversed earlier, and later on, a nonerroneous cognition is impossible.

original: ma bzlog pa'i phyir dper na phyi ma bzhin pas thar pa med do /
analyzed: ma bzlog pa'i phyir dper na phyi ma bzhin pas thar pa med do /
translated: Since it is not reversed, like the later, liberation does not exist.

original: shes pa skyes na yang 'byung ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa skyes na yang 'byung ba'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if cognition arises, it follows that it would arise from the elements, and the errors of the existence of cognition and so on would ensue.

original: byed pa'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag ni rje dpon rgyal ba bzhin du skyes bu la nye bar btags pa'i phyir thar pa nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i chos 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag ni rje dpon rgyal ba bzhin du skyes bu la nye bar btags pa'i phyir thar pa nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: The phenomena of action, such as grasping, are imputed to the person, just as the king is imputed to his domain.

original: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pas chog gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
translated: This is sufficient for a digression; we should now analyze the present topic.

original: de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtog par byed pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa des de dag stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir /🔽nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtog par byed pa la brtson pa'i rnal 'byor pa des de dag stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir / nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
translated: Thus, the yogi who strives to understand the reality of the inner and outer sense bases realizes them to be emptiness.🔽The self and “mine” are extinguished

original: bdag dang bdag gir zad gyur na //🔽nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir zad gyur na // nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
translated: With regard to the inner and outer,🔽And through their cessation,

original: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
analyzed: de zad pas na skye ba zad //
translated: The appropriated ceases, and through its cessation, birth ceases.

original: de ltar nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar de dag log par 'dzin pa zad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la de'i bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi zhes bya bar de dag log par 'dzin pa zad par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, the self and “mine” are extinguished with regard to the inner and outer sense bases, and the mistaken apprehension of them as the self and “mine” is extinguished.

original: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba zhes bya ba nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba zhes bya ba nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: desire, view, morality and asceticism, and assertion of self.

original: de la re zhig bdag med pa nyid du mthong bas ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag med pa nyid du mthong bas ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Among them, by seeing selflessness, the appropriation of the assertion of self is abandoned.

original: de spangs pas nye bar len pa lhag ma rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de spangs pas nye bar len pa lhag ma rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By abandoning that, the remaining appropriations are also abandoned,

original: de dag ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i skye gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'i skye gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the basis of the appropriation of the assertion of self.

original: nye bar len pa 'gags pa'i phyir de'i skye gnas las byung ba'i srid pa zad par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gags pa'i phyir de'i skye gnas las byung ba'i srid pa zad par 'gyur bas /
translated: Because appropriation ceases, the existence that arises from that basis ceases.

original: @185a * // de zad pa na skye ba zad de de ni thar pa zhes pa'o //🔽thar pa de yang gang zag bdag med pas mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @185a * // de zad pa na skye ba zad de de ni thar pa zhes pa'o // thar pa de yang gang zag bdag med pas mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: When that ceases, birth ceases. That is liberation.🔽That liberation is for the noble listeners and solitary realizers,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi yin no //
translated: because they see the selflessness of persons.

original: sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'gro ba rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas 'thob ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'gro ba rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas 'thob ste /
translated: Those who proceed by the vehicle of the Buddhas attain it by abandoning the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i thabs ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no //
translated: The methods for abandoning the afflictive obstructions are as taught above.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ni 'di bshad de /🔽las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir ni 'di bshad de / las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: This is taught for the sake of abandoning the obstructions to omniscience.🔽Liberation is by the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Karma and afflictions are the causes of birth.

original: de dag zad pas sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ba ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: de dag zad pas sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ba ni thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation from suffering is by their exhaustion.

original: skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa /
translated: The causes of birth are karma and afflictions.

original: de dag ni yul rnams las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni yul rnams las mi 'byung ste /
translated: They do not arise from objects,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yul rnams yod kyang de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la yul rnams yod kyang de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though objects exist for those free from attachment, they do not arise.

original: 'o na ci las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci las 'byung zhe na /
translated: Well then, from what do they arise?

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from discrimination.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The root text says,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug par kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dag las 'byung ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug par kun du rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa dag las 'byung ste /
translated: Karma and the afflictions arise from the conceptualizations that have the characteristic of conceiving the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: de dag yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise when those exist.

original: 'di na gang yod na gang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod na gang 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It is known that when something exists, something else arises from it as its cause.

original: dper na sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba de bzhin du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod na las dang nyon mongs pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba de bzhin du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod na las dang nyon mongs pa dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when a seed exists, a sprout arises from it. In the same way, when the conceptualization called “non-noble, incorrect attention” exists, karma and the afflictions arise.

original: gang la rnam par rtog pa med pa de la de dag kyang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang la rnam par rtog pa med pa de la de dag kyang mi 'byung ste /
translated: When there is no conceptualization, they do not arise.

original: dper na 'phags pa'i rgyud bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa'i rgyud bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the continuum of an ārya.

original: de la las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la las ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems dang ldan pa'i yid kyi mngon par 'du byed pa dang / des kun nas bslang ba lus dang ngag gi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Karma is the formative activity of the mind that is associated with an afflicted mind and the engagement of body and speech that is motivated by that.

original: nyon mongs par byed pa ni sems can gyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs par byed pa ni sems can gyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa dag ste /
translated: Afflictions are those that afflict the mindstreams of sentient beings,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dag go //
translated: such as attachment.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni spros pa las byung bas de dag spros las zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dag ni spros pa las byung bas de dag spros las zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since those conceptualizations that are the causes of karma and afflictions arise from mental fabrication, he states that they arise from mental fabrication.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: They arise from mental fabrication that has the nature of strong adherence to conventional reality.

original: spros pa de yang gang gis 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: spros pa de yang gang gis 'gag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what is that mental fabrication stopped?

original: spros pa ni /
analyzed: spros pa ni /
translated: Mental fabrication

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: is stopped by emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rtogs pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rtogs pas zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “realization” is left out.

original: chos bdag @185b med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas 'gag par 'gyur ro //🔽yang na stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: chos bdag @185b med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas 'gag par 'gyur ro // yang na stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: It is stopped by the realization that has the nature of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Alternatively, mental fabrication is stopped by emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid ces pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid ces pa ste /
translated: Here, emptiness is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid shes pa skyes na 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pa skyes na 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement “When the knowledge of emptiness arises, it ceases” is that it is stopped.

original: gal te gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong ba kho nas sdug pa dang / mi sdug par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dag nye bar zhi ba 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te gang zag bdag med pa nyid mthong ba kho nas sdug pa dang / mi sdug par rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pa dag nye bar zhi ba 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: If the mere seeing of the selflessness of persons were to accomplish the pacification of karma and afflictions that arise from the conception of the attractive and unattractive,

original: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then the seeing of the selflessness of phenomena would be pointless.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dra ba bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs dbyung bar 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dra ba bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs dbyung bar 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is illogical because it is asserted that the entire network of afflictions, along with their imprints, must be uprooted.

original: de'i chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba med pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gnyen po rang byung gi ye shes chos thams cad kyi yul phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa can yang des spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba med pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gnyen po rang byung gi ye shes chos thams cad kyi yul phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa can yang des spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is impossible for the seeing of the selflessness of phenomena not to exist in that and because the antidote that is the nonafflicted nonknowledge, which is the self-arisen gnosis that is the unmistaken understanding of the object of all phenomena, is what is to be eliminated by that.

original: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid mthong ba don med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The vision of the selflessness of phenomena would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir de ltar spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni thar pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar spros pa ma lus pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni thar pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, emptiness, which is characterized by the complete pacification of all fabrication, is liberation.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
analyzed: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
translated: In brief, the Dharma is nonviolence.

original: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid //
translated: Nirvana is emptiness.

original: 'di la de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces //
analyzed: 'di la de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces //
translated: In this regard, these two alone

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: are taught by the Tathagatas.

original: mu stegs can kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: mu stegs can kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some non-Buddhist philosophers say:

original: 'di la khyed kyi ston pas mdo sde las //
analyzed: 'di la khyed kyi ston pas mdo sde las //
translated: In this regard, your teacher said in the sutras:

original: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
translated: One’s own self is one’s own protector.

original: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
translated: Who else could be one’s protector?

original: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas //
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas //
translated: The wise who are well trained in themselves

original: mtho ris dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtho ris dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: attain the higher realms.

original: zhes gsungs shing de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes gsungs shing de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: sems can 'khor bar zhugs pa ni //
analyzed: sems can 'khor bar zhugs pa ni //
translated: Sentient beings who enter cyclic existence

original: sdug bsngal las ni rnam mi 'grol /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ni rnam mi 'grol /
translated: are not liberated from suffering.

original: zhes kyang gsungs pas khyed bdag med do zhes smra ba la khas blangs pa snga mas gnod par 'gyur bas //
analyzed: zhes kyang gsungs pas khyed bdag med do zhes smra ba la khas blangs pa snga mas gnod par 'gyur bas //
translated: So, since your statement “the self does not exist” is undermined by your own assertion,

original: de'i phyir bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dgag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma grub bo //
translated: therefore your inference refuting the self is not established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sems can gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta bas blo gros nyams pa 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta bas blo gros nyams pa 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: There are sentient beings whose minds are impaired by the view that denies cause and effect. They say, “This world does not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: The world beyond does not exist.

original: legs pa byas pa dang / nyes pa byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: legs pa byas pa dang / nyes pa byas pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There is no result or effect of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba la mngon par zhen pa rtag tu mi dge ba mngon par 'du bya ba la gzhol ba'i yid dang ldan pa ngan song gi g-yang sa chen po'i 'gram na gnas @186a * //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do zhes bya ba la mngon par zhen pa rtag tu mi dge ba mngon par 'du bya ba la gzhol ba'i yid dang ldan pa ngan song gi g-yang sa chen po'i 'gram na gnas @186a * //
translated: There are no sentient beings who are born supernaturally.” They are always intent on engaging in nonvirtue. They are like those who stand on the edge of a great abyss leading to the lower realms.

original: pa dag yod pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la /
analyzed: pa dag yod pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la /
translated: Therefore, for their sake, the blessed buddhas

original: phan gdags par bzhed pa gzhan la phan pa skyed pa'i thugs dam mnga' ba /
analyzed: phan gdags par bzhed pa gzhan la phan pa skyed pa'i thugs dam mnga' ba /
translated: They are compassionate, wishing to benefit others, and they have the vow to generate benefit for others.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun la brten nas /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun la brten nas /
translated: They see that in the future, on the basis of the continuum of mind and mental factors,🔽that continuum will not be interrupted.

original: phyi ma la de dag gi rgyun mi 'chad par gzigs pa rnams kyis tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang gis bdag yod do zhes kyang gdags par mdzad pas de'i phyir /🔽bdag go zhes kyang brtags gyur cing //
analyzed: phyi ma la de dag gi rgyun mi 'chad par gzigs pa rnams kyis tha snyad kyi bden pa'i dbang gis bdag yod do zhes kyang gdags par mdzad pas de'i phyir / bdag go zhes kyang brtags gyur cing //
translated: Therefore, they also impute the existence of a self by the power of conventional truth.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽The self is also imputed.

original: sems can gang dag bdag rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bya ba la rang dbang can dang / za ba po yin no snyam du mngon par zhen bdag yod de /
analyzed: sems can gang dag bdag rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bya ba la rang dbang can dang / za ba po yin no snyam du mngon par zhen bdag yod de /
translated: Sentient beings are attached to the notion that the self is permanent, all-pervading, the master of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, and the experiencer.

original: de dag bdag tu log par lta ba'i thag pas sems bcings shing /
analyzed: de dag bdag tu log par lta ba'i thag pas sems bcings shing /
translated: They are bound by the rope of the wrong view of self.

original: lus dang dbang po dang / blo'i yul la bdag med pa'i lta ba ma skyes pas /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang / blo'i yul la bdag med pa'i lta ba ma skyes pas /
translated: Since the view of selflessness has not arisen in relation to the body, the senses, and the objects of the intellect,

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis shin tu ring du song yang bya rkang pa bshal thag gis bcings pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis shin tu ring du song yang bya rkang pa bshal thag gis bcings pa /
translated: By the power of concentration, meditative stabilization, and meditative absorption, one goes very far, but like a bird whose feet are bound by a rope,

original: thag ring por song yang phyir lhung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: thag ring por song yang phyir lhung ba bzhin du /
translated: even though one goes far, one falls back.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag las rnam par mi 'grol bar thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dag las rnam par mi 'grol bar thugs su chud nas /
translated: Thus, having understood that one is not liberated from the sufferings of birth and so forth,

original: de ltar bdag tu lta ba'i thag pa bcad pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir phung po lnga la bdag med de zhes kyang bstan par mdzad pas de'i phyir /🔽bdag med ces kyang bsnyen par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu lta ba'i thag pa bcad pas sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir phung po lnga la bdag med de zhes kyang bstan par mdzad pas de'i phyir / bdag med ces kyang bsnyen par 'gyur //
translated: in order to completely pacify suffering by cutting the rope of the view of self, he also taught, “The five aggregates are selfless.”

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “He also taught ‘selfless.’”

original: gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po shin tu nye bar bsags pa /
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po shin tu nye bar bsags pa /
translated: Those who have accumulated the roots of virtue on a vast scale,

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa /
translated: whose faculties are ripe,

original: zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba la mos pa /
translated: who are devoted to the profound and vast,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa'i bshad pa bdud rtsi'i snod du gyur pa de dag la ni 'dus byas ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / chu zla lta bur thugs su chud nas don dam par bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir /🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa'i bshad pa bdud rtsi'i snod du gyur pa de dag la ni 'dus byas ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / chu zla lta bur thugs su chud nas don dam par bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir / sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: For those who are vessels for the nectar-like explanation that realizes omniscience, the Buddhas, having understood that compounded phenomena are empty of their own essence, like a dream, an illusion, and the reflection of the moon in water, teach that ultimately there is neither a self nor selflessness.🔽Therefore, the Buddhas teach that🔽

original: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //
analyzed: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //
translated: For those who are vessels of nectar, who understand the emptiness of the entity of the conditioned, who understand that the self and entities connected to the self are like a dream, an illusion, and the moon in water, the buddhas teach that ultimately neither a self nor selflessness exists at all.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽The buddhas have taught that🔽neither a self nor selflessness exists.

original: bdag dang bdag med par rnam par brtag pa'i gzhi'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med par rnam par brtag pa'i gzhi'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is because the basis of the conception of a self and selflessness does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tha snyad du bdag khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la mi gnod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tha snyad du bdag khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la mi gnod do //
translated: Therefore, since we conventionally accept a self, our position is not undermined.

original: gal te de ni don dam par bstan pa'i phyir lan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni don dam par bstan pa'i phyir lan ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is not an answer because it teaches the ultimate,

original: lan ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lan ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not that it is not an answer.

original: lung las / 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
analyzed: lung las / 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
translated: Herein there is no self or sentient being.

original: chos 'di @186b dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
analyzed: chos 'di @186b dag ni rgyu dang bcas //
translated: These phenomena are with causes.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma smras pa'i phyir dang / bdag dgag par nus pa'i bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / de yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma smras pa'i phyir dang / bdag dgag par nus pa'i bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because he has not stated an inference that would demonstrate the existence of a self, and because he has taught a proof that is capable of refuting a self.

original: yang gzhan du brtag ste /🔽mu stegs byed kha cig 'du byed bdag med pa /
analyzed: yang gzhan du brtag ste / mu stegs byed kha cig 'du byed bdag med pa /
translated: Again, there are others who imagine a self.

original: skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can nam dus gzhan du nges par gnas pa rnams la bdag med na /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can nam dus gzhan du nges par gnas pa rnams la bdag med na /
translated: Some tīrthikas imagine that if there is no self in the aggregates, which are momentary and disintegrate every instant, or if there is no self in those that definitely endure for a while,

original: las dang 'bras bu med par brtags nas /🔽'jig par 'gyur ba dag gis bdag yod do zhes kyang brtags pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu med par brtags nas / 'jig par 'gyur ba dag gis bdag yod do zhes kyang brtags pas de'i phyir /
translated: then karma and its effects would not exist.

original: bdag go zhes kyang brtags gyur cing //
analyzed: bdag go zhes kyang brtags gyur cing //
translated: And because they imagine that the world would be annihilated, they imagine that a self exists.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽They imagine a self.

original: gzhan gang dag 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag 'di ni /
translated: Others imagine that

original: lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs tsam du zad de /
analyzed: lus dang / dbang po dang / blo'i tshogs tsam du zad de /
translated: the mere collection of body, faculties, and mind

original: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gang ma gtogs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ni ngo bo nyid kyis zad de /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gang ma gtogs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ni ngo bo nyid kyis zad de /
translated: Apart from cause and effect, the self does not exist by its own nature.

original: sems can du bgrang ba'i 'du byed bdag med pa /
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba'i 'du byed bdag med pa /
translated: The self is not included among the aggregates that are the constituents of sentient beings.🔽It is not a permanent entity, nor is it a non-entity.

original: nges par mi gnas pa gnas su ma byas pa 'di dag la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes bya bar rigs nas /
analyzed: nges par mi gnas pa gnas su ma byas pa 'di dag la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes bya bar rigs nas /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that cyclic existence is untenable in the absence of a self.

original: rgyu dang 'brel pa la rmongs pa //🔽ji tsam dbang po'i spyod yul ba //🔽skyes bu de tsam nyid du zad //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pa la rmongs pa // ji tsam dbang po'i spyod yul ba // skyes bu de tsam nyid du zad //
translated: Deluded about the connection with causes,

original: sngo bsangs mang thos gang smra ba //🔽de dag spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra //
analyzed: sngo bsangs mang thos gang smra ba // de dag spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra //
translated: One thinks, “I see,” “I hear,”🔽“I smell,” “I taste,” “I touch,”

original: mdzes ma legs par spyod cing zo //
analyzed: mdzes ma legs par spyod cing zo //
translated: “I think,” and “I remember.”

original: lus mchog khyod 'das gang de med //🔽'jigs rung song ba phyir mi ldog / lus 'di 'dus btsam du zad //
analyzed: lus mchog khyod 'das gang de med // 'jigs rung song ba phyir mi ldog / lus 'di 'dus btsam du zad //
translated: The self is not the aggregates, nor is it different from them.🔽The self is not the sense faculties, nor is it different from them.🔽The self is not the elements, nor is it different from them.🔽The self is not the mind, nor is it different from the mind.🔽The self is not the body, nor is it different from the body.🔽The self is not the aggregates, elements, and sense faculties, nor is it different from them.🔽The self is not the enjoyer, nor is it different from the enjoyer.🔽The self is not the body, nor is it different from the body.🔽The self is not the elements, nor is it different from the elements.🔽The self is not the mind, nor is it different from the mind.🔽The self is not the aggregates, elements, and sense faculties, nor is it different from them.🔽The self is not the enjoyer, nor is it different from the enjoyer.🔽The self is not the body, nor is it different from the body.🔽The self is not the elements, nor is it different from the elements.🔽The self is not the mind, nor is it different from the mind.

original: ces zer bdag gis lus dang / dbang po la bdag med do zhes gang bstan pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ces zer bdag gis lus dang / dbang po la bdag med do zhes gang bstan pas de'i phyir /
translated: The self is not the aggregates, elements, and sense faculties, nor is it different from them.🔽The self is not the enjoyer, nor is it different from the enjoyer.🔽The self is not the body, nor is it different from the body.🔽The self is not the elements, nor is it different from the elements.

original: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The self is not the mind, nor is it different from the mind.🔽The self is not the aggregates, elements, and sense faculties, nor is it different from them.🔽The self is not the enjoyer, nor is it different from the enjoyer.🔽The self is not the body, nor is it different from the body.🔽The self is not

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mkhyen pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mkhyen pa /
translated: The Lord Buddha is omniscient with regard to all phenomena.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa 'jug pa rnams kyis ni bdag dang / bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa 'jug pa rnams kyis ni bdag dang / bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan pa mdzad pas de'i phyir //
translated: He has taught that neither a self nor selflessness exists in any way, because

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: The Buddhas have taught that neither a self nor

original: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan /🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan / zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: selflessness exists in any way.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na spros pa med pa nyid legs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par 'dzin pa nyid spangs pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na spros pa med pa nyid legs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par 'dzin pa nyid spangs pa'i phyir dang / bdag dang bdag med par rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: This is because he has fully understood the reality of all phenomena, which is free from conceptual elaboration, because he has abandoned the grasping of self and selflessness, and because he knows that the cause of the engagement of the conceptualization of self and selflessness does not exist.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pas /
translated: Because of the superimposition of self and selflessness,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag la kun du mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag la kun du mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no non-conceptualization of form, etc.

original: de ltar yang ji skad du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam @187a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang ji skad du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam @187a * //
translated: Thus, as it is said in the Subāhupariprcchāsūtra,

original: par gnon pa /
analyzed: par gnon pa /
translated: Subhūti,

original: gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Form is not a self or not having a self.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not a self or not having a self.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa nyid ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
