translated: That form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are not a self or not having a self is the perfection of wisdom.

original: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur zhes sngar gang smras pa de ji ltar stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur zhes sngar gang smras pa de ji ltar stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: As for what was said earlier, “Elaboration ceases through emptiness,” it should be explained here how elaboration ceases through emptiness.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ba la rtogs pas sgro btags pa las ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa dpag tu med pa 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ba la rtogs pas sgro btags pa las ni brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa dpag tu med pa 'byung la /
translated: In this regard, from the superimposition of conceptualization on what is to be expressed, an infinite elaboration of the nature of expression arises.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu mngon sum du byar med pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du byas shing /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu mngon sum du byar med pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du byas shing /
translated: The emptiness of all things, which is the characteristic of their utter isolation, is like space, and it is realized by way of non-realization.

original: dngos po thams cad brjod du med par mthong ba'i ;🔽brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad brjod du med par mthong ba'i ; brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
translated: All things are seen as inexpressible.🔽The expressible is stopped.

original: brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the cause of the engagement of expression is absent.

original: brjod par bya ba de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the expressible is stopped?

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa'o //
translated: The sphere of mind is stopped.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi yul te /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi yul te /
translated: The sphere of mind is the object of mind.

original: gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means form and so on.

original: de yang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is also stopped because it is not ultimately established.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni dngos por brjod de /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni dngos por brjod de /
translated: The sphere of mind is called a thing

original: rang gi ngo bo dang / spyi'i ngo bo ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang / spyi'i ngo bo ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it shows its own nature and its general nature.

original: ldog pa ni ldog pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ldog pa ni ldog pa lta bu ste /
translated: The reversal is like the reversal.

original: lta ba po'i de kho na shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa na yang dngos po'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba po'i de kho na shes pa skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa na yang dngos po'i de kho na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when the knowledge of reality of the seer has arisen or not arisen, the reality of things is not abandoned as the intrinsic reality which is the domain of the nondiscriminative knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de ldog pa'i brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa ldog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ldog pa'i brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi spros pa ldog go //
translated: Therefore, the verbal self of the reversal is reversed.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang gang gis kyang mi byed do /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang gang gis kyang mi byed do /
translated: And that reversal of the domain of mind is not done by anything.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well, then, how is it?

original: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: The domain of mind, forms, etc., are unborn and unceasing.

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: Reality is like nirvana.

original: chos nyid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: chos nyid dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Reality, the intrinsic reality of things, and the nature of things are synonyms.

original: yang na gzhan gyis spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la rigs pa gang yin zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la rigs pa gang yin zhes smras pa na /
translated: Or, what is the reasoning behind the statement, “The elaborations of others cease through emptiness?”🔽The master says:

original: slob dpon gyis @187b rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis @187b rnal 'byor pa stong pa nyid la gnas shing /
translated: The yogi/nī who abides in emptiness

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas /🔽de'i phyir / brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i brjod par bya ba ldog pas / de'i phyir / brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
translated: and abides in the absence of characteristics stops the object of expression.

original: zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽“The object of expression stops.”

original: brjod par 'jug pa ldog pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod par 'jug pa ldog pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that engagement in expression stops.🔽Therefore,

original: des na / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: des na / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: “The domain of mind stops.”

original: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ni sems kyi rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The domain of mind is a synonym for the movement of mind.

original: yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyis rnam par brtags pa yin par brjod de /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyis rnam par brtags pa yin par brjod de /
translated: The nature of the object is said to be imagined by the mind.

original: de yang dmigs su med pa la gnas pas ldog pa'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: de yang dmigs su med pa la gnas pas ldog pa'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: Moreover, since it stops by abiding in the absence of perception, the domain of mind stops.

original: ji ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the domain of mind stop?

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: “Unarisen and unceasing”

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: Reality is like nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi de kho na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi de kho na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is “the reality of mind.”

original: yang na / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba de kho na mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba de kho na mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the nonseeing of things and nonthings is called “seeing reality.”🔽But what is that like?

original: de yang ji lta bu zhig yin snyam du kha cig de ltar sems pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhig yin snyam du kha cig de ltar sems pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since the domain of mind is stopped,

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //🔽zhes bshad do /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pas te // zhes bshad do /
translated: the expressible is stopped.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The nonseeing of things and nonthings.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na / gang gi phyir /
translated: But how is that?

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: Since the domain of mind is stopped.

original: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: The domain of mind is the domain of mind and so on.

original: dngos po la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po la sogs par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is the nonapprehension of things and so on.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here the term and so on should be understood as implicit.

original: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ni sems kyi spyod yul lo /
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i spyod pa ni sems kyi spyod yul lo /
translated: The domain of mind and so on is the domain of mind.

original: de kho na mthong ba med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one does not see reality,

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams ma mthong ba gang kho na yin pa de nyid de kho na mthong pa'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams ma mthong ba gang kho na yin pa de nyid de kho na mthong pa'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: because the very non-seeing of objects such as form is called “seeing reality,”

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽ji skad du mthong ba med pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro // ji skad du mthong ba med pa ni /
translated: because one realizes the reality-nature of things without distortion.

original: de kho na mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, “Non-seeing is seeing reality.”

original: de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod par bya ba ldog pa ste / ji skad du /
translated: Therefore, the domain of expression is eliminated.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it is said in the Akṣayamatisūtra:

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is ultimate truth?🔽Where the mind does not move, what need is there to speak of letters?”

original: gang la sems kyang mi rgyu na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan nas kyang /
analyzed: gang la sems kyang mi rgyu na yi ge rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan nas kyang /
translated: And similarly, in another sūtra it is said:

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “It is free from mind, mentality, and consciousness.”

original: de'i phyir re zhig de kho na la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig de kho na la ni /
translated: Therefore, first of all, with respect to reality,

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Unarisen and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: The nature of phenomena is the same as nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba de tsam dag smra bar nus te /🔽chos thams @188a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de tsam dag smra bar nus te / chos thams @188a * //
translated: One can speak only to this extent.

original: cad dben pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad dben pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are characterized by emptiness.

original: yang na stong pa nyid shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la kun du lta zhing /
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis snang bar byas pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la kun du lta zhing /
translated: Or else, having seen the nature of all things illuminated by the light of the sun of the knowledge of emptiness,

original: dmigs su med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i ngag dang yid kyi brjod pa ldog pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ldog pas te ;
analyzed: dmigs su med pa la rab tu gnas pa'i ngag dang yid kyi brjod pa ldog pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ldog pas te ;
translated: one abides in the absence of perception, and so the expression of speech and mind is stopped, and so too is the object of expression.

original: de nyid kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyang /
translated: And that is also said:

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: “The domain of mind is stopped.”

original: spyod yul ni mthu nyid do //
analyzed: spyod yul ni mthu nyid do //
translated: The domain is the power itself.

original: ji ltar sems kyi mthu nyid ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi mthu nyid ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the power of mind stopped?

original: 'di la yul gyi stobs kyis rnam par shes pa skyes shing dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul tha dad pa la rtogs pa'i rgyun thag gis rnam pa tha dad pa du mar rtog pa na dar gyi srin bu bzhin du bdag nyid kyi mthu nyid kun nas dkris par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la yul gyi stobs kyis rnam par shes pa skyes shing dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul tha dad pa la rtogs pa'i rgyun thag gis rnam pa tha dad pa du mar rtog pa na dar gyi srin bu bzhin du bdag nyid kyi mthu nyid kun nas dkris par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, consciousness arises by the power of the object, and when it conceives many different aspects of the object, the nature of the thing and its distinctions, then it is completely entangled in its own power, like a silkworm.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par mthong bas ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par mthong bas ni /
translated: But when one sees all phenomena as selfless,

original: de mi 'jug pa'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog go //
analyzed: de mi 'jug pa'i phyir sems kyi spyod yul ldog go //
translated: then the range of the mind is stopped, because that [self] does not operate.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa yang de kho na shes pa'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa yang de kho na shes pa'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: And the stopping of the range of the mind is not due to the activity of knowing reality,

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na ;
translated: but rather how?

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: It is unborn and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: like nirvāṇa, the nature of phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir sems dang sems las gzhan pa'i chos rnams kyi de ni gang gis kyang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dang sems las gzhan pa'i chos rnams kyi de ni gang gis kyang bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that [reality] is not an object of activity for any phenomenon, whether mind or something other than mind.

original: da ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las /🔽stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: da ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las / stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed kyi /
translated: it says,🔽“Emptiness does not empty phenomena.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams stong pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams stong pa'o //
translated: Rather, phenomena are empty.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: 'on kyang de dag gi rang bzhin ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste /🔽ji skad du 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin shin tu skye ba med pa'i nog bo nyid kun
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gi rang bzhin ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste / ji skad du 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas kun nas bslang ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin shin tu skye ba med pa'i nog bo nyid kun
translated: However, one should understand that their nature is the same as nirvana.

original: du mkhyen par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: du mkhyen par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, “Thus, the Tathagata, having sat down at the site of awakening, came to know the nature of the aggregates, which are the mass of suffering, to be utterly unborn, the nature of the afflictions, which are produced by unreal imagination, to be nonexistent by nature, and so on.”🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
analyzed: de'i phyir / srid pa'i sa bon rnam shes te //
translated: consciousness is the seed of existence,

original: yul rnams de yi spyod yul bo //
analyzed: yul rnams de yi spyod yul bo //
translated: and objects are its domain.

original: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
analyzed: yul la bdag med mthong na ni //
translated: When one sees the absence of self in objects,

original: srid pa'i sa bon dgag par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa'i sa bon dgag par 'gyur //
translated: The seed of cyclic existence is stopped.

original: zhes bya ba de yang 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de yang 'thad pa yin no //
translated: This is also tenable.

original: de'i phyir de ltar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa skye ba med par mthong bas ni sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa skye ba med par mthong bas ni sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, in this way, by seeing all phenomena as equal, as being like nirvana, as being unproduced, the domain of mind is stopped.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog cing /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas ni brjod par bya ba ldog cing /
translated: By stopping the domain of mind, the domain of expression is stopped.

original: de log pas ni tha snyad @188b kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log pas ni tha snyad @188b kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By stopping that, the elaborations characterized by the adherence to the conventional truth are completely pacified.

original: rang gi sde pa dang / gzhan gyi sde pa kha cig na re /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang / gzhan gyi sde pa kha cig na re /
translated: Some of our own schools and some of the other schools say:🔽The proponents of the middle way are no different from nihilists because they deprecate all things.

original: dbu ma smra ba ni dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir med pa bdag dang khyad pa ni med do zhes zer ba de dag la kha cig gis /
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba ni dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa'i phyir med pa bdag dang khyad pa ni med do zhes zer ba de dag la kha cig gis /
translated: To those who say this, some respond:

original: dngos po sel ba nyid du mtshungs su zin kyang /
analyzed: dngos po sel ba nyid du mtshungs su zin kyang /
translated: Although they are similar in that they eliminate things,

original: so so'i skye bo dang / dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms pa dag bzhin nam /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / dgra bcom pa so sor ma brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms pa dag bzhin nam /
translated: It is like the case of ordinary beings, arhats who are indifferent through non-investigation, and arhats who are indifferent through investigation.🔽Even though the positions of the blind and the sighted are the same in that they are both certain that it is impossible to see forms in the dark, there is a difference between them.

original: dmus long dang mig can gyi phyogs mi bde'o snyam du nges par sems pa dag mtshungs su zin kyang khyad par yod pa bzhin du med pa dang / dbu ma pa dag la yang khyad par yod do zhes lan 'debs par byed pas ni /
analyzed: dmus long dang mig can gyi phyogs mi bde'o snyam du nges par sems pa dag mtshungs su zin kyang khyad par yod pa bzhin du med pa dang / dbu ma pa dag la yang khyad par yod do zhes lan 'debs par byed pas ni /
translated: In the same way, there is a difference between the Madhyamikas and the nihilists.

original: pha rol pos dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa la khyad par med do zhes bstan pa la khyad par yod par ma brjod pas lan ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol pos dngos po'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa la khyad par med do zhes bstan pa la khyad par yod par ma brjod pas lan ma yin no //
translated: But this is not a proper response, for it does not address the point that the Madhyamikas are making when they say that there is no difference between the nihilists and the Madhyamikas in their understanding of the way things really are.

original: 'di skad brjod na mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod na mi rigs te /
translated: It is not right to say this.

original: med pa pa dag dang / dbu ma smra ba dag gang gi tshe mtshungs par rtog / tha snyad kyi dus su 'am /
analyzed: med pa pa dag dang / dbu ma smra ba dag gang gi tshe mtshungs par rtog / tha snyad kyi dus su 'am /
translated: When do the nihilists and the Madhyamikas come to be considered the same?

original: 'o na te de kho na la lta ba'i dus su de la re zhig tha snyad kyi dus su ni de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa la mngon par zhen pas dge ba'i phyogs drungs phyung zhing mi dge ba'i las thams cad la zhugs
analyzed: 'o na te de kho na la lta ba'i dus su de la re zhig tha snyad kyi dus su ni de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa la mngon par zhen pas dge ba'i phyogs drungs phyung zhing mi dge ba'i las thams cad la zhugs
translated: However, when one is not seeing suchness, at the time of the conventional, one will uproot all that is virtuous and engage in all sorts of nonvirtuous actions, for one will be fixated on the view that deprecates causes and effects.

original: pa dang / tha snyad kyi bden pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa de ltar /
analyzed: pa dang / tha snyad kyi bden pa nyid la gnod pa byed pa de ltar /
translated: In this way, one will undermine the truth of the conventional.

original: dbu ma smra ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag la skur pa mi 'debs shing mi dge ba'i las kyi lam la ma zhugs pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rgyun las yang 'byung ba'i srid pa'i phung po 'byung zhing /
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag la skur pa mi 'debs shing mi dge ba'i las kyi lam la ma zhugs pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i rgyun las yang 'byung ba'i srid pa'i phung po 'byung zhing /
translated: However, the proponents of the Middle Way do not deprecate the illusionlike and miragelike relationships of cause and effect. They do not engage in the paths of nonvirtue. They teach that the aggregates of future existence will arise from the continuum of contaminated aggregates,

original: phung po'i rgyun 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa rmi lam lta bu dag 'byung bar ston pas tha snyad kyi bden pa nyid la gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po'i rgyun 'gag pa sngon du 'gro ba las da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa rmi lam lta bu dag 'byung bar ston pas tha snyad kyi bden pa nyid la gnod par mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: and that the present and future are like dreams, arising in dependence upon the cessation of the continuum of the aggregates. Therefore, they do not undermine the truth of the conventional.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su yang med pa pa dang / dbu ma smra ba dag mtshungs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su yang med pa pa dang / dbu ma smra ba dag mtshungs pa ma yin la /
translated: But they are not the same as the Madhyamaka proponents.

original: de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they the same when it comes to viewing reality.

original: 'di ltar med pa pa dag la ni rnam par shes pa med do zhes med pa'i yul can dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa 'byung zhing de yang log par shes pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa pa dag la ni rnam par shes pa med do zhes med pa'i yul can dngos po thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa 'byung zhing de yang log par shes pa yin pas /
translated: For the nihilists, the subject that is the object of negation, “consciousness does not exist,” is all things, and they deprecate them. Since that is a wrong consciousness,

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri mas nye bar sbags pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal nye bar zhig bar mi 'gyur gyi /🔽dbu ma smra ba dag la ni de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po dag @189a * //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri mas nye bar sbags pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal nye bar zhig bar mi 'gyur gyi / dbu ma smra ba dag la ni de kho na la lta ba'i dus su yang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po dag @189a * //
translated: they are sullied by the stain of immorality and do not pacify suffering.🔽For the Madhyamaka proponents, when it comes to viewing reality, the cognition that previously arose with regard to things such as form

original: la yod pa'i blo sngar byung bar gyur ba gang yin pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid du rtogs pas /
analyzed: la yod pa'i blo sngar byung bar gyur ba gang yin pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po stong pa nyid du rtogs pas /
translated: is the cognition that things such as form are empty.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pas rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin no snyam pas rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The thought “These things, form and so on, do not exist” will stop conceptualization.

original: don gyi go bas med pa'i blo skyes so snyam pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyi go bas med pa'i blo skyes so snyam pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The thought “The cognition of nonexistence has arisen through the understanding of the object” will not arise.

original: don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa de yang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that thinks “ultimately, objects such as form do not exist” is not in accordance with fact.

original: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na yod pa'i blo bzhin pas /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na yod pa'i blo bzhin pas /
translated: Because it is a cognition, like the cognition of existence.

original: blo de sun dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo de sun dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the refutation of that cognition.

original: yang na gang la dngos por snang ba'i blo skye ba de la ni /🔽de bsal bas med pa'i blo skye ba'i skabs yod kyi /
analyzed: yang na gang la dngos por snang ba'i blo skye ba de la ni / de bsal bas med pa'i blo skye ba'i skabs yod kyi /
translated: Moreover, when a cognition arises that perceives an object,🔽there is an opportunity for the cognition of nonexistence to arise through the elimination of that.

original: sel ba med pa la ni med par rtog pa'i sgo nas med pa'i blo yang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sel ba med pa la ni med par rtog pa'i sgo nas med pa'i blo yang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: But when there is no elimination, the cognition of nonexistence will cease through the elimination of the conception of nonexistence.

original: spyod pa med par spyod pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa rab tu dben par gyur pa rnams la med do snyam pa'i blo mi skye ba'i phyir med pa bdag dang / dbu ma smra ba dag la sgra mtshungs pa tsam yang med do //
analyzed: spyod pa med par spyod pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas pa rab tu dben par gyur pa rnams la med do snyam pa'i blo mi skye ba'i phyir med pa bdag dang / dbu ma smra ba dag la sgra mtshungs pa tsam yang med do //
translated: The Madhyamikas do not have the idea that the non-existence of the self and so on is non-existent, because they do not abide in the practice of wisdom that is practiced without practice, which is completely isolated.

original: ston pa'i dus na yang yod pa nyid dgag pa tsam byed pa'i phyir med pa nyid du ston par mi byed pas /
analyzed: ston pa'i dus na yang yod pa nyid dgag pa tsam byed pa'i phyir med pa nyid du ston par mi byed pas /
translated: Even when they teach, they do not teach non-existence, because they only refute existence.

original: yungs 'bru dang / ri rab bzhin du khyad par shin tu che'o //
analyzed: yungs 'bru dang / ri rab bzhin du khyad par shin tu che'o //
translated: The difference between the Madhyamikas and the non-Madhyamikas is extremely great, like the difference between a mustard seed and Mount Meru.

original: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs su zin kyang don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshogs mang po nye bar blang ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang de ltar bden pa'i phyir ji ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs su zin kyang don dam par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshogs mang po nye bar blang ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang de ltar bden pa'i phyir ji ltar nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'jig rten la yang dag pa nyid du grags pa dang /
translated: Although all phenomena are the same as nirvana, they accumulate many collections of merit and wisdom in order to realize the ultimate, because they are in accord with that, and because it is true in conventional terms.

original: yang dag pa nyid du ma yin par grags pa gang yin pa de dag tha snyad du /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du ma yin par grags pa gang yin pa de dag tha snyad du /
translated: Those that are renowned as not being real are

original: thams cad yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag yang dag min //
translated: all conventional.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Bhagavān also said:

original: gang 'jig rten la yod par grags pa de nga yang yod par smra'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten la yod par grags pa de nga yang yod par smra'o //
translated: “Whatever is renowned as existing in the world, I also say exists.

original: gang 'jig rten la med par grags pa de nga yang med par smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten la med par grags pa de nga yang med par smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Whatever is renowned as not existing in the world, I also say does not exist.”

original: yang na mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams tha snyad kyi bden pa dang mi 'gal bar yod pas /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams tha snyad kyi bden pa dang mi 'gal bar yod pas /
translated: Or, the sense bases such as the eyes and the objects such as form exist without contradicting conventional truth.

original: thams cad la yang dag ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad la yang dag ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he said that they are real.

original: don dam par ni brten nas 'byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni brten nas 'byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: But ultimately, because dependent arising is like an illusion and is not established by way of its own entity,

original: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas yang dag min zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas yang dag min zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is not as it appears. Therefore, he said that it is not real.

original: bden pa gnyi ga'i rnam pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: bden pa gnyi ga'i rnam pa la ltos nas /
translated: In dependence on the two kinds of reality,

original: yang dag yang dag ma @189b yin nyid //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag yang dag ma @189b yin nyid // ces gsungs so //
translated: Real and unreal.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: At the time of realization, the yogi/nī does not conceptualize the reality of any phenomenon in any way.

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: Therefore, it is neither real nor unreal.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang / bdag gi dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa shes byar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad yang dag ces gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang / bdag gi dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa shes byar bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad yang dag ces gsungs so //
translated: Or else, the Blessed One taught the objects of knowledge, the inner and outer sense-spheres, which are devoid of self and “mine” and are characterized by non-movement, in order to abandon the afflictive obstructions. All of those he called “real.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gis bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi yin pa'i phyir byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom par byed pa dag yang dag min zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gis bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi yin pa'i phyir byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom par byed pa dag yang dag min zhes gsungs so //
translated: The self, which is characterized by consciousness, is called “the agent” because it possesses a self and is “mine.” Therefore, the hearer, the thinker, and the meditator are called “unreal.”

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos kyi tha snyad la ltos pa'i dbang gis /🔽yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos kyi tha snyad la ltos pa'i dbang gis / yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: In dependence on mundane and philosophical conventions,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: it is said:🔽Correct and incorrect.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang ; rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul nyid du 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i tshul gyis yang dag pa nyid la sogs par rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de lta bu med pas /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang ; rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul nyid du 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i tshul gyis yang dag pa nyid la sogs par rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de lta bu med pas /
translated: In the Mahayana system, because all phenomena are unarisen, there is no such imputation of correct reality and so on as the domain of conceptual and nonconceptual consciousnesses.

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: It is not incorrect and not correct.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi de kho na phyin ci ma log pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni chos kyi de kho na phyin ci ma log pa ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te /
translated: In this, a buddha is one who has fully realized the unerring nature of phenomena.

original: drang srong mchog rnams so //
analyzed: drang srong mchog rnams so //
translated: He is the supreme sage.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / mi'i mtho ris dang / byang grol gyi bde ba 'dod pa rnams la /
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang / mi'i mtho ris dang / byang grol gyi bde ba 'dod pa rnams la /
translated: The teaching is for those who desire the happiness of the higher realms of gods and humans and the bliss of liberation.

original: dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / dus kyi dbang gis mtho ris dang / byang grol gyi lam phyin ci ma log par rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / dus kyi dbang gis mtho ris dang / byang grol gyi lam phyin ci ma log par rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the unerring teaching of the path to the higher realms and to liberation, in accordance with the faculties, aspirations, latent propensities, and times of sentient beings.

original: yang na rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgra thams cad tshar gcod pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgra thams cad tshar gcod pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the teaching that conquers all the afflictions and their latent propensities that exist in one’s own and others’ mind-streams.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstan pa ste /
translated: “The teaching of the Buddha” is the teaching of the Buddhas.

original: tha snyad dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul mchog tu rmad du byung ba thogs pa med par smra ba gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul mchog tu rmad du byung ba thogs pa med par smra ba gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is the supreme and marvelous way of the conventional and ultimate truths, which is unhindered, and is not shared in common with others.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu thams cad dbyung ba'i phyir de la nan tan bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i zug rngu thams cad dbyung ba'i phyir de la nan tan bya'o //
translated: One should practice it in order to extract all the barbs of clinging.

original: rang gi sde pa dang / gzhan gyi sde pa dag las phal cher skyon 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang / gzhan gyi sde pa dag las phal cher skyon 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Most of the other schools and our own schools impute faults to it.

original: gal te khyed dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa ma lus par bsal @190a * //
analyzed: gal te khyed dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa ma lus par bsal @190a * //
translated: If you assert that one realizes reality by completely eliminating all the imagined natures of things,

original: bas de kho na rtogs par 'dod na 'o na des na de'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bas de kho na rtogs par 'dod na 'o na des na de'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya dgos so //
translated: then you must explain the characteristics of reality.

original: ci ste mi ston na ni rang gi phyogs nges par mi 'jog la /
analyzed: ci ste mi ston na ni rang gi phyogs nges par mi 'jog la /
translated: But if you do not explain it, you do not establish your own position,

original: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: and you refute the position of others.

original: khyed co 'dri ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyed co 'dri ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore you are just a debater.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gal te de kho na'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te de kho na'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba zhig yin na ni /
translated: Here we say:🔽If the characteristics of reality were something to be expressed,

original: bstan par bya dgos pa yang bden pa zhig na /
analyzed: bstan par bya dgos pa yang bden pa zhig na /
translated: then it would be true that it must be taught.

original: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not something to be expressed.

original: 'on kyang skye bo las dang po bdag yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang skye bo las dang po bdag yang dag par dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: Nevertheless, in order to comfort those who are beginners,

original: so sor rtog pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas de ltar rnam par nges pas 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas de ltar rnam par nges pas 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: we will explain it here with conceptualizing consciousnesses that have conceptual thoughts.

original: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: It is not known through another, is peace,🔽and is not fabricated by mental fabrications.

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: It is nonconceptual, and is not a different object.

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of reality.

original: de la gzhan las shes min zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan las shes pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan las shes min zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan las shes pa med pa ste /
translated: Here, “it is not known through another” means that it is not known through another,

original: lung med par bdag gi mngon sum du 'gyur zhing bdag nyid kyis rang rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung med par bdag gi mngon sum du 'gyur zhing bdag nyid kyis rang rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, it is not known through scripture, but is known through one’s own direct perception, and is to be known by oneself.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: “Peace” means that it is free from intrinsic reality,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of conceptualization, which has the nature of the intrinsic reality and the distinguishing marks of entities.

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: “It is not fabricated by mental fabrications”

original: zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that it is free from the fabrication that has the nature of verbal expressions.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba med pa nyid kyis 'di dang / 'di'o zhes rnam par ma brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba med pa nyid kyis 'di dang / 'di'o zhes rnam par ma brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “it is free from conceptualization” means that it is not conceptualized as this or that because it is non-apparent.

original: don tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid ro gcig pa'i phyir don dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid ro gcig pa'i phyir don dbyer med pa ste /
translated: The phrase “it is not a separate object” means that it is not a separate object because it is the single taste of reality.

original: de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: This is the characteristic of reality.

original: de la gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
translated: In this regard, it is free from elaboration because it is free from conceptualization.

original: gang gi phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa de'i phyir zhi ba'o //🔽gang gi phyir zhi ba de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo //🔽gang gi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa de'i phyir zhi ba'o // gang gi phyir zhi ba de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo // gang gi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: It is peace because it is free from elaboration.🔽It is the domain of nonconceptual intuition because it is peace.🔽It is not an object of knowledge for others because it is the domain of nonconceptual intuition.

original: gzhan la shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la shes pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not an object of knowledge for others because it is not an object of knowledge for others.

original: gang gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa de la tshig mi 'jug pas /
analyzed: gang gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa de la tshig mi 'jug pas /
translated: Since words do not apply to it, it is inexpressible.

original: de'i phyir de kho na'i ngo bo nyid ni tshig gis sgro btags pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na'i ngo bo nyid ni tshig gis sgro btags pa las yang dag par 'das pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of reality is utterly beyond verbal superimposition.

original: de ni brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
translated: Although it cannot be expressed,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par dgag pa ston pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par dgag pa ston pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: in order to demonstrate the negation of the nature and features of all things, it is explained:

original: de kho na'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par nus pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par nus pa /
translated: The nature of reality can be realized🔽through the arising of nonconceptual cognition, which arises in accordance with the unborn mode.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba med pa'i @190b tshul gyis skye ba dang rjes su mthun par yi ger sgro btags pa las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba med pa'i @190b tshul gyis skye ba dang rjes su mthun par yi ger sgro btags pa las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: It arises from the superimposition of syllables,

original: de ltar de kho na rang rig par bya ba thabs kyi sgo nas bstan pas /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na rang rig par bya ba thabs kyi sgo nas bstan pas /
translated: and in this way, the nature of reality is taught through the method of being known by oneself.

original: mtshan nyid ma bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the characteristics are not left unmentioned,

original: co 'dri ba nyid ma yin pas skyon gdags su med do //
analyzed: co 'dri ba nyid ma yin pas skyon gdags su med do //
translated: it is not mere jest, and therefore no fault can be ascribed.

original: de ltar re zhig don dam pa'i de kho na bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig don dam pa'i de kho na bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the ultimate nature of reality has been taught.

original: da ni kun rdzob bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the conventional will be explained.

original: gang la brten te gang byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang byung ba //
translated: That which arises in dependence on something

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: and it is not different from that.

original: rgyu gang la brten te 'bras bu gang byung ba de ni re zhig de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gang la brten te 'bras bu gang byung ba de ni re zhig de nyid ma yin te /
translated: That effect which arises in dependence on that cause is not the same as that cause.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the effect is not non-different from the cause.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes shes par byar nus te /
translated: It is not possible to understand that the effect is not different from the cause.

original: blo tha dad pas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo tha dad pas shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is understood by a different cognition.

original: dper na rtogs pa dang / rtogs par bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtogs pa dang / rtogs par bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the understood and the understanding.

original: yang na rgyu gang la brten te 'bras bu gang byung ba de ni re zhig de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu gang la brten te 'bras bu gang byung ba de ni re zhig de nyid ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that effect which arises in dependence on that cause is not the same as that cause.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid las mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid las mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that it would not arise from the nature of the cause.

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: And it is not different from that.

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: That which arises in dependence on what?

original: de ni de las gzhan pa 'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan pa 'ang ma yin te /
translated: That is not different from that.

original: zhes shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: zhes shes par byar nus te /
translated: It is not possible to understand that.

original: rgyu ma yin pa las mi skye ba bzhin du rgyu las kyang 'bras bu mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa las mi skye ba bzhin du rgyu las kyang 'bras bu mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as it does not arise from a noncause, so too it does not arise from a cause.

original: yang na rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Or else, the effect is not different from the cause.

original: zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel na brten te byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel na brten te byung ba'i phyir /
translated: If cause and effect are related, then because they are dependently arisen,

original: rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: like the intrinsic identity of the cause.

original: gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba khyad par dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba khyad par dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the application of the reason is qualified,

original: de las gzhan pa la brten te byung ba'i 'bras bu dag gis ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la brten te byung ba'i 'bras bu dag gis ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: it is not indeterminate with respect to effects that arise in dependence on something other than that.

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
translated: The word “because” indicates the meaning of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu las 'bras bu de nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu las 'bras bu de nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Because in this way the effect is not the same as the cause,

original: gzhan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and it is not different from the cause,

original: de phyir tshad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir tshad min rtag ma yin //
translated: therefore it is not a permanent nonentity.

original: 'di la gang gi phyir rgyu zhig kyang 'bras bu skye bas rgyun gyis nges par gnas shing rgyu zhig kyang 'bras bu de mi 'jig pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid ma yin pas chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di la gang gi phyir rgyu zhig kyang 'bras bu skye bas rgyun gyis nges par gnas shing rgyu zhig kyang 'bras bu de mi 'jig pa de'i phyir gzhan nyid ma yin pas chad pa ma yin la /
translated: Because the cause ceases and the effect arises, it definitely endures through a continuum. Because the cause ceases and the effect does not perish, therefore, it is not annihilated because it is not different.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu 'jig cing rgyu de zhig kyang 'bras bu nam yang mi 'jig pa de'i phyir de nyid ma yin pas rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu 'jig cing rgyu de zhig kyang 'bras bu nam yang mi 'jig pa de'i phyir de nyid ma yin pas rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Because the cause ceases at the time of the effect and the cause ceases and the effect never perishes, therefore, it is not permanent because it is not the same.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang phyir dngos po 'jig 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po 'jig 'gyur ba //
translated: Because things perish,

original: des na chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not annihilated.

original: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
translated: Because things cease,

original: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not permanent.

original: yang na @191a * //🔽kha cig na re chos nyid rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang na @191a * // kha cig na re chos nyid rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
translated: Or,🔽some say: It is not annihilated because it is pervaded by reality.

original: chos rnam par ldog pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos rnam par ldog pa'i phyir rtag pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is not permanent because phenomena cease.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore, it is like that.

original: don gcig min don tha dad min //
analyzed: don gcig min don tha dad min //
translated: It is not the same thing, nor is it a different thing.

original: chad pa ma yin rtag min pa //🔽de ni sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag min pa // de ni sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi //
translated: It is not annihilated, nor is it eternal.🔽This is the nectar-like teaching

original: mgon po'i bstan pa bdud rtsi yin //
analyzed: mgon po'i bstan pa bdud rtsi yin //
translated: of the protector buddhas of the world.

original: bdud rtsi zhes bya ba ni bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi zhes bya ba ni bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Nectar is so called because it is the cause for attaining the state of immortality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis de rtogs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis de rtogs nas /
translated: Bodhisattvas who possess the immeasurable accumulations of merit and wisdom realize this and,

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir rab tu brtson par byed pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma dag tu gyur nas gsung gi 'od zer dag gis sems can skal pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi blo gros kyi pad ma dag
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan pa bskyed pa'i phyir rab tu brtson par byed pa na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyi ma dag tu gyur nas gsung gi 'od zer dag gis sems can skal pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi blo gros kyi pad ma dag
translated: in order to bring about the benefit of all beings, they strive to become the sun-like perfect buddhas, whose rays of speech open the lotus flowers of the minds of fortunate beings🔽and cause the flowers of the minds of those who are less fortunate to at least hear the teachings.

original: kha 'byed par mdzad pa dang / nyon thos rnams kyis kyang thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa yongs su 'dris par byas pas /
analyzed: kha 'byed par mdzad pa dang / nyon thos rnams kyis kyang thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa yongs su 'dris par byas pas /
translated: The listeners, too, by becoming familiar with the knowledge that arises from listening, reflecting and meditating,

original: tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because nirvana is actualized in this very life,

original: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni bdud rtsi nyid yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni bdud rtsi nyid yin no //
translated: the complete pacification of all suffering is itself the nectar of immortality.

original: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig brgya la tshe 'di la tshogs ma bsags pa nyid kyis thar pa thob par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig brgya la tshe 'di la tshogs ma bsags pa nyid kyis thar pa thob par ma gyur na /
translated: If, in some cases, one does not attain liberation in this life because of not having accumulated the collections,

original: de lta na yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la de la nges par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshe rabs gzhan dag la de la nges par 'grub ste /
translated: then in other lives it will definitely be accomplished.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid shes pas 'di la ni //
analyzed: de nyid shes pas 'di la ni //
translated: By knowing reality,

original: 'dod chags bral ba ma thob pa //🔽tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad med par //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba ma thob pa // tshe rabs gzhan la 'bad med par //
translated: one does not attain freedom from attachment in this life,🔽but in other lives it is definitely attained without effort,

original: nges par 'thob ste las bzhin no //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nges par 'thob ste las bzhin no // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: just like karma.

original: ci ste yang brgya la /
analyzed: ci ste yang brgya la /
translated: But if, in some cases,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
translated: the perfect buddhas do not appear,

original: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
translated: and the śrāvakas have disappeared,🔽even though one does not have the conditions for the arising of the knowledge of reality,

original: de kho na shes pa skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan du zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de kho na shes pa skye ba'i rkyen dang mi ldan du zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
translated: still,

original: tshe rabs gzhan la rab tu dben pa'i shes pa goms par byas pa'i bag chags bsags pas blo gros sbyangs pa rnams la gzhan gyi rkyen med par /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan la rab tu dben pa'i shes pa goms par byas pa'i bag chags bsags pas blo gros sbyangs pa rnams la gzhan gyi rkyen med par /
translated: In other lives, they have cultivated the habit of being accustomed to the knowledge of solitude.🔽

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
translated: The wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas

original: bsten pa med las rab tu skye //
analyzed: bsten pa med las rab tu skye //
translated: arises from the absence of reliance.

original: bsten pa med pa ni lus dang sems rab tu dben pa ste /
analyzed: bsten pa med pa ni lus dang sems rab tu dben pa ste /
translated: The absence of reliance is the isolation of body and mind.

original: de'i phyir bsten pa med pa'i rgyu de las rab tu skye ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsten pa med pa'i rgyu de las rab tu skye ste /
translated: Therefore, it arises from the cause of the absence of reliance.

original: 'du 'dzi med pa'i rgyu las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pa'i rgyu las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It arises from the cause of solitude.

original: de'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni sgrub pa rnams la tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni sgrub pa rnams la tshe 'di dang / tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob par byed pa yin pas /
translated: Therefore, that nectar of the teaching is the attainment of the state of immortality for practitioners in this life and in future lives.

original: bdag la legs par 'dod pa rnams kyis @191b bsam pa thag pas de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la legs par 'dod pa rnams kyis @191b bsam pa thag pas de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who desire what is good for themselves should practice it with a firm resolve.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang / bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pas /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang / bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med par bstan pas /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is to refute the proofs stated by others and to teach one’s own proofs without fault.

original: 'du byed rnams bdag dang / bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bdag dang / bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it teaches that compounded phenomena are empty of self and being mine.

original: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa ;
translated: Therefore, Subhūti,

original: gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: form is neither a self nor not a self.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are neither a self nor not a self.🔽That form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are neither a self nor not a self is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bdag gam bdag med pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: And so on.

original: de bzhin du /🔽'di la bdag med sems can med //
analyzed: de bzhin du / 'di la bdag med sems can med //
translated: And similarly,🔽Here there is no self, no sentient being,

original: srog kyang yod min gang zag med //
analyzed: srog kyang yod min gang zag med //
translated: No life force, and no person.

original: lus 'di khams rnams 'dus tsam du //
analyzed: lus 'di khams rnams 'dus tsam du //
translated: This body is merely a composite of elements.

original: bdag la de ltar rab tu snang //
analyzed: bdag la de ltar rab tu snang //
translated: It appears to me in that way.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
analyzed: 'di la bdag dang sems can med //
translated: Here there is no self or sentient being.

original: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du sring mo gzhan yang /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du sring mo gzhan yang /
translated: These phenomena have causes.

original: khyod kyi lus 'di la bdag med /
analyzed: khyod kyi lus 'di la bdag med /
translated: And similarly, “Sister, furthermore, in this body of yours there is no self,

original: sems can med /🔽srog med / skyes bu med /🔽gang zag med /
analyzed: sems can med / srog med / skyes bu med / gang zag med /
translated: no sentient being,🔽no life-force, no person,🔽no human being,

original: shed bu med /
analyzed: shed bu med /
translated: no individual,

original: tshor ba po med /
analyzed: tshor ba po med /
translated: no feeler,🔽no agent.”

original: byed pa po med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: byed pa po med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: This is established.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: This is the commentary on the eighteenth chapter, having twenty-two verses, called

original: bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /🔽rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste / rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa'o /
translated: “the examination of the self and phenomena.”

original: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma ;
analyzed: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma ;
translated: Here is the root text of the commentary on the middle way called “The Lamp of Wisdom,”

original: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: the fourteenth chapter.

original: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in order to teach the lack of entityness of time by way of refuting the specific counter-positions to emptiness, the nineteenth chapter is begun.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say this:

original: don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, the entityness of things surely exists,

original: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of manifestation.

original: dper na mar me bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a lamp.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gsal ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni gsal ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which does not exist is not the cause of manifestation,

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no //
translated: for example, like the cloth of tortoise hair.

original: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir de ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni dus gsum gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir de ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since the entityness of things is the cause of the manifestation of the three times, therefore it surely exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i 'du byed @192a * //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i 'du byed @192a * //
translated: Those compounded phenomena that belong to the domain of convention

original: de dag gi skye ba gang yin pa de bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba gang yin pa de bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: whose arising is called “action”

original: de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid skye ba yin pas /
analyzed: de yang dngos po'i bdag nyid skye ba yin pas /
translated: and that are the entity of things, arise.

original: dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad pa dang / ma spyad pa las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus zhes brjod de /
analyzed: dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu spyad pa dang / ma spyad pa las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus zhes brjod de /
translated: Those things themselves are called the past, future, and present, in terms of the performance and nonperformance of functions as causes and effects.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du bya ba gzhan yongs su dpyod pa'i bya ba nyid la dus zhes khas len te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du bya ba gzhan yongs su dpyod pa'i bya ba nyid la dus zhes khas len te /
translated: Therefore, conventionally, we accept time to be the very activity of the analysis of other activities.

original: dper na ba 'jos tsam gyis 'ongs nas gzod be'u blags so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba 'jos tsam gyis 'ongs nas gzod be'u blags so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, “The calf came forth and then the milk was milked.”

original: don dam par ni ji ltar de mi 'thad pa de ltar dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni ji ltar de mi 'thad pa de ltar dpyad par bya ste /
translated: But ultimately, we will analyze how time is untenable.

original: 'di la dus yod par smra ba dag 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las dus gzhan pa dang / rtag par smra ste /
analyzed: 'di la dus yod par smra ba dag 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las dus gzhan pa dang / rtag par smra ste /
translated: Here, those who advocate the existence of time say that time is different from conditioned things and is permanent.

original: de la don dam par dus ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la don dam par dus ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams las don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: In response to that, ultimately, time should be apprehended as not being a different object from conditioned things.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas kyi dngos po'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a thing, it is like the nature of conditioned things.

original: de bzhin du don dam par dus ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par dus ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, ultimately time is not permanent,

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is the basis of characteristics, like a pot.

original: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that this reason is not established, it is not, because it is like space, etc.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If you think that this reason is not established, it is not, because they are refuted in the same way, and since there is no counterexample, it is not that the reason is not established.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo ni rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin te /
translated: The cognition that thinks of present form has as its object the meaning of the term that is related to a thing that is other than its own nature.

original: yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir dper na dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang
analyzed: yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir dper na dbyug pa can mang po dang nyung ngu dag la dbyug pa can dbyug pa can snyam du yid ches pa skye ba'i blo de la lhas byin la sogs pa'i rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dbyug pa dang
translated: Because it produces confidence, like the cognition that produces confidence when it thinks of many or few club bearers, “This is a club bearer, that is a club bearer,” and in that cognition the object of the term that is related to a thing that is other than the nature of Devadatta, etc.,

original: 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod par mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: the club, is seen to exist.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la da ltar da ltar ra snyam du yid ches pa skye ba yod pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la da ltar da ltar ra snyam du yid ches pa skye ba yod pas /
translated: So too, in the present context, the thought “form is present” arises.

original: de'i phyir da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo 'di la yang rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo 'di la yang rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul yod de /
translated: Therefore, the cognition that thinks “present form” has an object that is a referential object related to a thing that is different from itself.

original: gzugs las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa de ni dus yin pas de'i phyir de ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don gang yin pa de ni dus yin pas de'i phyir de ni gzhan yin no //
translated: Since the referential object that is different from form is time, therefore it is different.

original: de la 'dir yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don la dus ma yin pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don mthong ba'i phyir yid ches pa skye bar rjes su dpogs pas dus ma yin @192b pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de la 'dir yid ches pa skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don la dus ma yin pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don mthong ba'i phyir yid ches pa skye bar rjes su dpogs pas dus ma yin @192b pa nyid dang /
translated: Here, the reason “because the thought arises” implies that the thought arises because one sees the referential object that is related to a thing that is different from itself, the referential object that has the characteristics of nontime and impermanence.

original: rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de dag bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de dag bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Because they are not permanent, the fault of the proposition being contradicted by the nature of the subject and the distinction is not applicable.

original: dpe yang med do /
analyzed: dpe yang med do /
translated: Nor is there an example.

original: don dam par dbyug pa dang / dbyug pa can de 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par dbyug pa dang / dbyug pa can de 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the stick and the stick-bearer are not established as related ultimately.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not logical.

original: yang na gal te da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de khyad par gzhan gang yang rung 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa dang / rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gal te da ltar gyi gzugs so snyam pa'i blo de khyad par gzhan gang yang rung 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba'i tshig gi don gyi yul can yin par sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa dang / rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if you prove that the cognition “this is present form” has as its object a word-meaning that is related to some other distinction, then you would be proving what is already established and you would contradict your own tenets.

original: ci ste blo de gzugs dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel ba'i yul can yin par bsgrubs na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: ci ste blo de gzugs dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel ba'i yul can yin par bsgrubs na ni dpe med de /
translated: But if you prove that the cognition has as its object a word-meaning that is related to the characteristic of the time of form, then there is no example.

original: blo de gzugs dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel ba'i yul can yin par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo de gzugs dus kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi don dang 'brel ba'i yul can yin par bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it cannot be shown that the mind is a subject that is related to the object that is the referent of the word “form.”
