original: dpyad pa rgyas pa ni yod pa nyid bzhin no //🔽dus kyi dbye ba 'grub na yang ltos pa can nam /
analyzed: dpyad pa rgyas pa ni yod pa nyid bzhin no // dus kyi dbye ba 'grub na yang ltos pa can nam /
translated: The extensive analysis is like that of existence.

original: 'on te ma ltos pa bzhin du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'on te ma ltos pa bzhin du 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the divisions of time were to be established, they would be either in dependence or not in dependence.🔽If they are in dependence,

original: de la gal te ltos pa can du dam 'cha' na ;
analyzed: de la gal te ltos pa can du dam 'cha' na ;
translated: then if you assert that they are in dependence,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //🔽gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //🔽da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa // gal te 'das la ltos gyur na // da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: the present and the future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: would have to exist in the past.🔽If the present and the future were to exist in dependence on the past, then the present and the future would have to exist in the past.

original: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The point is that if time itself were to exist in dependence, then it would be like the past.🔽Moreover,

original: yang na / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: yang na / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: the present and the future

original: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na /
translated: would have to exist in the past.

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The present and the future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
translated: would have to exist in the past.

original: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lan 'ga' zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: “At one time” is supplied from the previous verse.

original: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa de dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la gang dag ltos pa dang bcas pa de dag ni dus gcig nyid du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Those that are related are simultaneous.

original: lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: lan 'ga' mi mthun pa nyid med na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: If they are not at one time, they are not related, like

original: pha dang bu dag bzhin no //
analyzed: pha dang bu dag bzhin no //
translated: father and son.

original: ci ste ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan kyang /
analyzed: ci ste ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan kyang /
translated: Even if you demonstrate the reason that they are related,

original: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par mi 'dod na /
translated: you do not accept that the present and future exist in the past.

original: de lta na skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na skyon gzhan 'dir yang 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then this other error would ensue:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The present and future

original: gal te de ni med gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de ni med gyur na //
translated: Would not exist.

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: If the present and future

original: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
translated: Do not exist, how could they be related?

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: If they are related,

original: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The present and future are established as present and future in reliance on the past.

original: kha cig na re /🔽de lta na don dam par da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo @193a * //
analyzed: kha cig na re / de lta na don dam par da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag la da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo @193a * //
translated: Some say:

original: nyid dag med de /
analyzed: nyid dag med de /
translated: In that case, ultimately the present and future do not exist as the entities of present and future,

original: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhe'o /
analyzed: dus nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'das pa'i dus bzhin no zhe'o /
translated: because if they are time, they would rely on another, like the past.

original: / gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The present and future

analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni /

original: dus mnyam pa rnams la ltos pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa rnams la ltos pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: dus tha dad pa yin yang spun dag la ltos pa yod pas ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /

analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni med pa'i phyir ltos pa med la /

translated: If the past and future did exist, all three times would be the present.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /

analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / da ltar gyi tsha bo la ltos nas mes po med pa la yang /

analyzed: sgra brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i phyir dang / dus dgag pa smra ba dag gis / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag da lta nyid du bstan pas /

original: phyogs snga ma la gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma la gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur //

analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus bzhin te /

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //

analyzed: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //

analyzed: ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / dus tha dad pa dag la yang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du ngang tshul can gzhan gnyis la yang brjod par bya'o // ci ste ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs bstan kyang /
translated: So too, the other two modes should be stated.

original: mchog dang / 'bring dag tha ma la yod par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: mchog dang / 'bring dag tha ma la yod par mi 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not accept that the best and the middling exist in the least,

original: de ltar na mchog dang / 'bring dag tha ma la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur /🔽ltos pa dang bcas pa @194a * //
analyzed: de ltar na mchog dang / 'bring dag tha ma la ji ltar ltos par 'gyur / ltos pa dang bcas pa @194a * //
translated: then how could the best and the middling be dependent on the least?

original: nyid yin na /
analyzed: nyid yin na /
translated: If they are dependent,

original: mchog dang 'bring dang / tha ma la ltos nas mchog dang 'bring nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog dang 'bring dang / tha ma la ltos nas mchog dang 'bring nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the best and the middling would be established in dependence on the least.

original: de bzhin du ngang tshul can gzhan gnyis bsnor ba la yar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngang tshul can gzhan gnyis bsnor ba la yar brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, the other two modes should be stated in reverse order.

original: de bzhin du gcig la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya ste /
translated: So too, one and so on should be understood.

original: gcig nyid dang / gnyis nyid dang / mang po nyid la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang / gnyis nyid dang / mang po nyid la sogs pa dag go //
translated: One, two, many, and so on.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, as before, it should be stated:

original: don dam par grangs gcig nyid la gcig nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par grangs gcig nyid la gcig nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: ultimately, one does not exist as the entity of one.

original: grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs nyid yin na ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is a number, it is dependent,

original: gnyis nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: like duality.🔽Those who do not accept number as different from the things numbered,

original: gang dag grangs dngos po las gzhan par mi 'dod pa de dag gnyis pa med pa ni gcig yin la /🔽de dang gzhan ni gnyis yin te /🔽gnyis dang gzhan ni gsum yin /
analyzed: gang dag grangs dngos po las gzhan par mi 'dod pa de dag gnyis pa med pa ni gcig yin la / de dang gzhan ni gnyis yin te / gnyis dang gzhan ni gsum yin /
translated: say that the absence of a second is one;🔽that which is different from that is two;

original: de phan chad ni mang po yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de phan chad ni mang po yin par 'dod do //
translated: that which is different from that is three;🔽and so on.

original: de dag la yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la yang snga ma bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: They should be refuted in the same way as above.

original: don dam par gcig la gcig gi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par gcig la gcig gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In reality, one does not have the nature of one,

original: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bgrang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is to be counted,

original: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: like that which is different from it.

original: de bzhin du gnyis la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis la gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, two does not have the nature of two, and so on.

original: dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don rnam par brtags nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Having analyzed the meaning of the thesis, it should be applied in the same way as above.

original: sogs pa'i sgra ni chung ngu dang / chen po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba dang / sngon dang / phyi ma dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra ni chung ngu dang / chen po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / thag nye ba dang / thag ring ba dang / sngon dang / phyi ma dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas la sogs pa dag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The words “and so on” should be understood as referring to small, large, long, short, distant, near, past, future, cause, effect, conditioned, unconditioned, and so on.

original: dus yod par smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: dus yod par smra ba dag na re /
translated: The proponents of the existence of time say:

original: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Time definitely exists ultimately,

original: tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is measured.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni tshad med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni tshad med de /
translated: That which does not exist is not measured,

original: dper na rta'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta'i rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of an ass.

original: dus la ni tshad skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag yod do //
analyzed: dus la ni tshad skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin mo dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / zla ba dang / dus tshigs dang / nur ba dang / lo la sogs pa dag yod do //
translated: Time is measured in terms of instants, moments, periods, nights, days, fortnights, months, seasons, transits, years, and so on.

original: gang tshad dang ldan pa de ni yod de /
analyzed: gang tshad dang ldan pa de ni yod de /
translated: That which is measured exists.

original: dper na 'bru la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na 'bru la sogs pa bzhin pas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, like grain, etc. Therefore, time surely exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
translated: It is not apprehended as time that does not endure.

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin @194b pas mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin @194b pas mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Since the collection of formations has the nature of arising and disintegrating, it does not endure.

original: de la ni khyed kyang tha snyad du yang dus dus zhes 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: de la ni khyed kyang tha snyad du yang dus dus zhes 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: You do not apprehend it as time even conventionally.

original: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus //🔽gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus // gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: What time is there to be apprehended🔽Since that which definitely endures

original: dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba nges par gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba nges par gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: as the nature of that does not exist as different from things?

original: ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
analyzed: ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
translated: How can time be designated when it is not apprehended?

original: gzung du yod na gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzung du yod na gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If it exists as apprehended, it is to be designated. This is the intended meaning.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni yud tsam la sogs pa'i tshad ni 'du byed nyi ma'i 'gros la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa nyid dag gi chos yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni yud tsam la sogs pa'i tshad ni 'du byed nyi ma'i 'gros la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan yongs su gcod pa nyid dag gi chos yin gyi /
translated: Thus, this passage teaches that the measure of a moment and so on is a quality of other actions, such as the movement of the sun, and so on, that are determined.

original: dus kyi ma yin par bstan pas /
analyzed: dus kyi ma yin par bstan pas /
translated: It is not a quality of time.

original: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi ma grub pa nyid dang dpe yang med do //
translated: Therefore the reason is not established and there is no example.

original: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
translated: The past and future do not exist.

original: ces bya ba 'di la gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di la gzhan dag na re /
translated: In response to this, some say:

original: 'di la dngos po nges par gnas pa rnams ni tshad las gzung du rung ste /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po nges par gnas pa rnams ni tshad las gzung du rung ste /
translated: Things that definitely endure can be measured,

original: dper na shing 'di ni mtho'o //
analyzed: dper na shing 'di ni mtho'o //
translated: for example, this tree is tall,

original: ba 'di ni chu ring ngo //
analyzed: ba 'di ni chu ring ngo //
translated: this cow is long,

original: mi 'di thung ngo //
analyzed: mi 'di thung ngo //
translated: this man is short,

original: glang po che 'di ni che'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin na /
analyzed: glang po che 'di ni che'o zhes bya ba lta bu yin na /
translated: and this elephant is big.

original: dus ni de ltar nges par gnas pa ma yin pas de la tshad mi 'grub bo zhes zer ro //🔽gzhan ma yin pa na re /
analyzed: dus ni de ltar nges par gnas pa ma yin pas de la tshad mi 'grub bo zhes zer ro // gzhan ma yin pa na re /
translated: But time does not definitely endure in that way, so its measure is not established.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: Others say: That is not good.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa nges par mi gnas pa la yang tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa nges par mi gnas pa la yang tshad gzung du rung ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because it is possible to measure the duration of non-material things that definitely do not endure.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: dus ni rtag pa yin te /🔽de la skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ni nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi khyad par las nor bu bzhin nam /
analyzed: dus ni rtag pa yin te / de la skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba la sogs pa dag yod pa ni nye bar gnas pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi khyad par las nor bu bzhin nam /
translated: Time is permanent,

original: smin pa'i khyad par las smin par bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: smin pa'i khyad par las smin par bya ba bzhin no //
translated: because the various specific states of the present, such as the instant, the minute, the hour, and so on, and the past and future exist like a jewel or like something to be ripened due to the specific ripening.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, we reply:

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngos po dngos po gzhan pa brten cing ltos pa'i dngos po la skad cig la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la dngos po dngos po gzhan pa brten cing ltos pa'i dngos po la skad cig la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod de /
translated: In our system, things and other things are expressed by the terms “instant” and so on in dependence on things that are related and reliant.

original: de la / gal te dus ni dngos brten na //
analyzed: de la / gal te dus ni dngos brten na //
translated: If time depends on things,

original: tha snyad du de dngos por brjod na ni de 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha snyad du de dngos por brjod na ni de 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: if it is said that time is a thing conventionally, then that is just what we accept.

original: ji ste don dam par na ni don dam dngos po nyid kyang ma grags pas /
analyzed: ji ste don dam par na ni don dam dngos po nyid kyang ma grags pas /
translated: But if it is ultimately, then since even things are not renowned ultimately,

original: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
translated: How can there be a time of non-existence?

original: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon nyams pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the fault stated does not apply to us.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: don dam par dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Time definitely exists as the intrinsic reality of substance,

original: rtags yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a reason.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni rtags med de /🔽dper na ri bong gi @195a * //
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni rtags med de / dper na ri bong gi @195a * //
translated: Here, that which does not exist has no reason.

original: rva bzhin no //
analyzed: rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horn of a donkey.

original: dus la ni rtags snga ma dang phyi ma dang / cig car dang / cig car ma yin pa dang / yun thun ring po dang / myur ba zhes bya ba dag yod pas de'i phyir dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dus la ni rtags snga ma dang phyi ma dang / cig car dang / cig car ma yin pa dang / yun thun ring po dang / myur ba zhes bya ba dag yod pas de'i phyir dus ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: But time has reasons such as prior, subsequent, simultaneous, non-simultaneous, long duration, and swift. Therefore, time definitely exists as the intrinsic reality of substance.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
translated: Since no thing exists at all,

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word “at all” has the meaning of exclusion.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: In our own system, however, no entity whatsoever exists ultimately.

original: tha snyad du ni 'du byed kyi rgyun tha dad pa la ltos nas snga ma dang / phyi ma zhes bya bar shes pa de skye zhing /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni 'du byed kyi rgyun tha dad pa la ltos nas snga ma dang / phyi ma zhes bya bar shes pa de skye zhing /
translated: Conventionally, however, the cognition of prior and subsequent is generated in dependence on the distinct continua of compounded phenomena.🔽The cognition of simultaneity is generated from the proximity of the nondistinct moments of compounded phenomena.🔽The cognition of nonsimultaneity is generated from the opposite of that.

original: 'du byed kyi skad cig tha mi dad pa nye bar gyur pa las cig car zhes bya ba dang ; de las bzlog pas las cig car ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed kyi rgyun mang po 'jug pa las yun ring po zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi skad cig tha mi dad pa nye bar gyur pa las cig car zhes bya ba dang ; de las bzlog pas las cig car ma yin pa zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed kyi rgyun mang po 'jug pa las yun ring po zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The cognition of a long period of time is generated from the engagement of many continua of compounded phenomena.

original: 'du byed kyi rgyun nyung ngu 'jug pa las myur ba zhes bya bar shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyun nyung ngu 'jug pa las myur ba zhes bya bar shes pa skye ste /
translated: The cognition of a short period of time is generated from the engagement of few continua of compounded phenomena.

original: de'i phyir snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma la sogs par shes pa ni 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs med pas /
translated: Therefore, since the cognition of prior and so on is a phenomenon that is a compounded phenomenon, it is not a reason.

original: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could time exist?

original: de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the reason proving it is not established.

original: ci ste snga ma la sogs par shes pa 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste snga ma la sogs par shes pa 'du byed kyi chos yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that consciousness is a conditioned phenomenon in the past, etc.,

original: dus kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ga las shes she na /
analyzed: dus kyi chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba de ga las shes she na /
translated: and not a time phenomenon, then how do you know that?

original: dus rtag pa dang / gcig pur ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa las te /
analyzed: dus rtag pa dang / gcig pur ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa las te /
translated: Because there is no inference that reveals time as permanent and unitary.

original: tha snyad du yang snga ma la sogs par yang shes pa ni dus rtag pa dang / gcig pu'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang snga ma la sogs par yang shes pa ni dus rtag pa dang / gcig pu'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Even conventionally, consciousness in the past, etc., is not the cause of a permanent and unitary time,

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs la sogs par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is consciousness, like consciousness of form, etc.

original: gal te dus ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te dus ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that time exists as a substance,

original: btags par yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: btags par yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it exists as a designation,

original: ji lta bu zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: then how is that?

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is like form, etc.,

original: don dam par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po grub pa med pas /
analyzed: don dam par ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po grub pa med pas /
translated: then since things such as form do not exist ultimately, as has been demonstrated,

original: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
analyzed: dngos med dus ni ga la yod //
translated: how can time, which is a nonthing, exist?

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe nyid du bzhag pa dag gi dngos po med na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dpe nyid du bzhag pa dag gi dngos po med na /
translated: Because form does not exist as an entity having the characteristic of form, the example itself is non-existent.

original: dus ga la yod de /
analyzed: dus ga la yod de /
translated: How can time exist?

original: dpe ma bstan pas dus mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe ma bstan pas dus mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that time is not established because the example is not demonstrated.

original: shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag la yang med kyang yod do zhes btags par yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: shing rta dang dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa dag la yang med kyang yod do zhes btags par yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: The reason is also inconclusive because even though such things as a chariot, an army, and a forest do not exist substantially, they are designated as existing, although they do not exist.

original: gal te shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rdzas @195b nyid du bstan pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shing rta la sogs pa yan lag can dag rdzas @195b nyid du bstan pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the error does not arise because the possessor of parts, such as a chariot, is taught to be substantial,

original: yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa'i dgag pa sngar bshad zin pas skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can dag rdzas nyid du bstan pa'i dgag pa sngar bshad zin pas skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: we reply that the error does arise because the refutation of the teaching that the possessor of parts is substantial has already been explained.

original: gang dag dus ni dngos po la brten nas gdags pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang dag dus ni dngos po la brten nas gdags pa kho na yin te /
translated: Some say that time is only nominally imputed in dependence on things.

original: yud tsam zhig 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: yud tsam zhig 'dug par gyur to //
translated: For example, a moment has passed.

original: nyin gcig 'dug go //
analyzed: nyin gcig 'dug go //
translated: A day has passed.

original: zla ba gcig 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
analyzed: zla ba gcig 'dug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba de dag la yang /
translated: But we reply:

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod min na //
translated: If no entity exists,

original: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur //🔽zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dus lta yod par ga la 'gyur // zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: how could time exist?

original: de las gzhan pa'i dus med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dus med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: For there is no time apart from entities.

original: dus yod par smra ba dag na re /🔽dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dus yod par smra ba dag na re / dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The proponents of the existence of time say:

original: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Time definitely exists because it is the cause of the engagement of special expressions.

original: 'di na gang med pa de ni brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de ni brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong ste /
translated: Here, we do not see that which does not exist to be the cause of the engagement of special expressions.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: dus ni sab ma byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mthong bas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dus ni sab ma byas so byed do byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mthong bas de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Time is seen to be the cause of the engagement of special expressions such as “Time has passed,” “Time is passing,” and “Time will pass.” Therefore time definitely exists.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good.

original: byas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: byas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa ni /
translated: The application of the special expression “is produced” and so on

original: 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the reason is not established.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also contradictory.

original: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni kun rdzob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni kun rdzob pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the application of the special expression is the superficial reality.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du dus ma grub pa'i phyir de gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du dus ma grub pa'i phyir de gsal ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since time is not established in any way, the meaning of the reason “because it is the cause of manifestation” is not established.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / rang gi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa dag gis stong pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pa dang / rang gi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa dag gis stong pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows: By stating the faults of the proof that the opponent presents at the beginning of the chapter and by demonstrating the irreproachability of our own proof, emptiness refutes the specific counterposition. Thus it demonstrates that time is essenceless.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said:🔽

original: 'phags pa lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said in the noble Subāhupariprcchāsūtra:

original: de dus gsum po 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dag rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de dus gsum po 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dag rab tu shes te /
translated: “He knows the three times—the past, the future, and the present.

original: de la 'du byed gang dag 'das shing 'gags pa de ni 'das pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed gang dag 'das shing 'gags pa de ni 'das pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, that which is past, conditioned, and ceased is called the past time.

original: gang dag ma 'ongs shing ma byung ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs shing ma byung ba de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is future and not yet arisen is called the future time.

original: gang dag da ltar byung zhing 'jug pa de ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya'o //🔽de la da ltar gyi dus kyi phung po dang / @196a * //
analyzed: gang dag da ltar byung zhing 'jug pa de ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya'o // de la da ltar gyi dus kyi phung po dang / @196a * //
translated: That which is present and engaged is called the present time.🔽Among them, he knows that the aggregates,

original: khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa de ni mi gnas pa dang nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes te /
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa de ni mi gnas pa dang nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes te /
translated: elements, and sense bases of the present time are impermanent and do not endure.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the world does not endure for more than an instant.

original: skad cig ma gang yin pa de la yang skye ba'i dus kyang gzhan la gnas pa'i dus kyang gzhan 'gag pa'i dus kyang gzhan no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gang yin pa de la yang skye ba'i dus kyang gzhan la gnas pa'i dus kyang gzhan 'gag pa'i dus kyang gzhan no //
translated: And for any moment, the time of arising is one, the time of enduring is another, and the time of ceasing is another.🔽And that moment is known to be nonenduring and definitely nonenduring.

original: skad cig ma de yang mi gnas pa dang / nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du chos nyid kyi yang chos nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma de yang mi gnas pa dang / nges par mi gnas par rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du chos nyid kyi yang chos nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
translated: And similarly, the reality of reality is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: it is not future,🔽it is not present.

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang ; de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang ; de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa ni / 'das pa ma yin /
translated: And similarly, the Tathāgata is not past,🔽he is not future,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: he is not present.

original: da ltar ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: da ltar ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: All such statements are established.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: The master Bhāviveka’s Lamp of Wisdom, commentary on Nāgārjuna’s Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: dus brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: dus brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: is the nineteenth chapter, the “Examination of Time.”

original: // / da ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
analyzed: // / da ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
translated: Now, in order to refute the specific counter-positions to the teaching of the essencelessness of time,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa brtsam mo //
translated: the twentieth chapter is begun in order to demonstrate the point of the teaching of the essencelessness of cause and effect.

original: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par dus ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon bstan pa'i phyir dus grub na skyon med pas /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par dus ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi skyon bstan pa'i phyir dus grub na skyon med pas /
translated: In the immediately preceding chapter, since time was not established, the fault of the reason was shown. Since there is no fault if time is established,

original: 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir 'dir smras pa /
translated: in order to demonstrate the establishment of the desired point, it is said here:

original: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: Ultimately, time must definitely be understood to exist,

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the establishment of the effect.

original: 'di na sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid yod kyang /
analyzed: 'di na sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid yod kyang /
translated: Here, even though the mere assembly of the seed and so on exists,

original: dus tshigs med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi yod na 'gyur la /
analyzed: dus tshigs med na myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi yod na 'gyur la /
translated: without the season, the sprout will not arise, but with it, it will.

original: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong bas /
analyzed: gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid yin par ma mthong bas /
translated: Since that which does not exist is not seen to be the cause of the establishment of the effect,

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, time exists ultimately by the power of the reason stated.

original: de la re zhig gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' la rgyu dang / rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' la rgyu dang / rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: Now, for those who maintain that the effect exists in the assembly of causes and conditions, this is explained:

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If the effect arose from the mere assembly of causes and conditions,

original: pha rol po'i tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: pha rol po'i tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: then the effect would exist in the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de yang de la yod na 'o na de ltar na /
analyzed: de yang de la yod na 'o na de ltar na /
translated: But if it exists there, then how could it arise from the mere assembly?

original: tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod na ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod na ni /
translated: If the effect existed in the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye /
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye /
translated: how could it arise from the mere assembly?

original: @196b skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: @196b skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: It would not arise,

original: dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault of the negation would be inconsistent.

original: gal te yod na ni ci'i phyir skye /
analyzed: gal te yod na ni ci'i phyir skye /
translated: If it existed, why would it arise?

original: 'on te skye na ni yod pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te skye na ni yod pa zhes bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But if it arises, it is not called existent.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba dang / skye'o zhes bya ba de dag mi mthun pas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba dang / skye'o zhes bya ba de dag mi mthun pas bkag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because the words “exists” and “arises” are mutually exclusive.

original: yang na gal te yod na de skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gal te yod na de skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if it exists, it does not arise.

original: yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis skye ba med pas de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
analyzed: yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis skye ba med pas de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod pas /
translated: Since it is inferred that it exists, it does not arise. Therefore, since the arising of that is refuted, the error of refuting the intrinsic reality of the thesis is committed.

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: If the effect exists in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: how could it arise from the assembly itself?

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: It would not arise.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang dag gis grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: gang dag gis grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu med par 'dod pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: This is explained for those who assert that the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions.🔽If it arises from the assembly

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: of causes and conditions,

original: pha rol po'i tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: pha rol po'i tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of the other’s system.

original: de yang khyod don dam par med par ston pas /
analyzed: de yang khyod don dam par med par ston pas /
translated: Moreover, since you demonstrate that it does not exist ultimately,

original: 'o na de ltar na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na /
translated: then in that case,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assemblage,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: how could it arise from the assemblage itself?

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: It would not arise,

original: med pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis skye ba med pas /
analyzed: med pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis skye ba med pas /
translated: because it is nonexistent. Since it is nonexistent, it does not arise.

original: de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid las zlog pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de'i skye ba bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid las zlog pa'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, since the thesis is contradicted by the nature of things, the error of contradiction arises.

original: gang dag gis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par dam bcas pa de dag gi phyir yang bshad pa /🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: gang dag gis rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu yod par dam bcas pa de dag gi phyir yang bshad pa / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: For those who maintain that the effect exists in the assemblage of causes and conditions, it is said:🔽If the effect exists in the assemblage

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
analyzed: tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
translated: it should be apprehended in that assemblage,

original: yod pa'i phyir skyes pa bzhin du'o ;
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir skyes pa bzhin du'o ;
translated: because it exists, like what has already arisen.

original: / tshogs pa 'di la gzung du med //
analyzed: / tshogs pa 'di la gzung du med //
translated: But it is not apprehended in that assemblage,

original: yid btud pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: yid btud pas kyang ngo //
translated: even with subtle scrutiny.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i chos gzung du med pa nyid yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu'i chos gzung du med pa nyid yin pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, this shows that the effect-entity is not apprehended in the assemblage itself.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the inference is that the effect, such as the sprout, does not exist in the assemblage itself of seed, etc.,

original: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not apprehended there.

original: gang la gang gzung du med pa de la de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la gang gzung du med pa de la de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not apprehended there does not exist there,

original: dper na bum pa las snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa las snam bu bzhin no //
translated: like a cloth in a pot.

original: tshogs pa nyid la myu gu yang de bzhin pas de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa na yin par gzung @197a * //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la myu gu yang de bzhin pas de'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa nyid la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yod pa na yin par gzung @197a * //
translated: Since the sprout is like that, therefore the effect, such as the sprout, does not exist in the assemblage itself of seed, etc.

original: bar bya'o // 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: bar bya'o // 'dir grangs can dag las kha cig phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Here, some Sāṃkhyas respond:

original: ha cang ring ba dang / ha cang nye ba dang / dbang po nyams pa dang / yid nges par mi gnas pa dang / cha phra ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / zil gyis non pa dang / 'dra ba 'dres pa zhes bya ba gzung ba'i gags  su gyur pa dag yod na /
analyzed: ha cang ring ba dang / ha cang nye ba dang / dbang po nyams pa dang / yid nges par mi gnas pa dang / cha phra ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / zil gyis non pa dang / 'dra ba 'dres pa zhes bya ba gzung ba'i gags  su gyur pa dag yod na /
translated: when they are too distant, too close, defective, not fixed in the mind, subtle, obscured, overwhelmed, similar and mixed.

original: dngos po yod pa rnams kyang gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa rnams kyang gzung du med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: Therefore, the reason is inconclusive because existent things are not apprehended.

original: grangs can dag las gzhan dag skyon gzhan 'di skad ces smra ste /
analyzed: grangs can dag las gzhan dag skyon gzhan 'di skad ces smra ste /
translated: Others, besides the Samkhyas, state another fault:

original: gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the reason, “because they are not apprehended”?

original: gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: If it means “because they are not apprehended by direct perception,” it is inconclusive,

original: dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i de kho na dag mngon sum gyis gzung du med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the principles of the sense faculties are not apprehended by direct perception, but they exist.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: If you say, “Because it is not apprehended by inference,” then the meaning is not established.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa las rgyu ni 'bras bus mi stong par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa las rgyu ni 'bras bus mi stong par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, a cause should be apprehended as not empty of an effect by inference,

original: tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a magnitude.

original: gang tshad yod pa de ni des mi stong ste /
analyzed: gang tshad yod pa de ni des mi stong ste /
translated: That which has a magnitude is not empty of it,

original: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the nature of an effect.

original: de bzhin du rgyu yang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gsum dang / sgra la sogs pa lnga dang / gcig la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshad kyi tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bus me stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu yang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gsum dang / sgra la sogs pa lnga dang / gcig la sogs pa'i rgyu'i tshad kyi tshad yod pas de'i phyir rgyu ni tshad yod pa'i phyir 'bras bus me stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, a cause is not empty of an effect because it has a magnitude, such as pleasure, pain, the three ignorances, the five such as sound, and the magnitude of a cause such as one.

original: mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: If you say, “Because it is not apprehended by direct perception,” then the meaning of the reason is not established, because it is not apprehended by direct perception alone.

original: mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gzung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yang rjes su dpag pas gzung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a thing that is not apprehended by direct perception is apprehended by inference.🔽because it is not apprehended in any way.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gtan tshigs kyi don rtogs na yang /
translated: If the meaning of the reason is understood in this way,

original: de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: de nyid don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: the fault of the nonestablishment of the object is present.

original: 'dir gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir /🔽tha snyad du yang ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzung du med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir / tha snyad du yang ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because of the specification “because it is not apprehended,”🔽it is not the case that it is not ascertained by those who are very far away, etc., even conventionally.

original: don dam par ni ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But ultimately, things that are very far away, etc., are not established.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin pa'i tshad dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin pa'i tshad dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: And because the valid cognitions that are the nature of pleasure, pain, delusion, etc., are not established,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: tshad kyi gtan tshigs @197b spyir brdzad na ni rjes su 'gro ba med de /
analyzed: tshad kyi gtan tshigs @197b spyir brdzad na ni rjes su 'gro ba med de /
translated: If you state a reason based on the evidence of things, then there is no pervasion.

original: 'bras bu yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect is empty of the effect itself.

original: tha snyad du yang gang zhig gang gis mi stong pa de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang gang zhig gang gis mi stong pa de las de 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even conventionally, that which is not empty of something does not arise from that,

original: des mi stong ba'i phyir dper na dbyu gu gsum las dbyu gu gsum gyi bdag nyid bzhin pas tha snyad du yang rgyu las 'bras bu snga na yod pa skye bar dam 'cha' na rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des mi stong ba'i phyir dper na dbyu gu gsum las dbyu gu gsum gyi bdag nyid bzhin pas tha snyad du yang rgyu las 'bras bu snga na yod pa skye bar dam 'cha' na rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is not empty of that. For example, like the three sticks in the bundle arising from the three sticks themselves. Therefore, if you assert that an effect that exists prior to its cause arises even conventionally, then that is undermined by inference.

original: mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de zhes gong du gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byas pa der
analyzed: mngon sum gyi gzung ba nyid ma yin pas mngon sum kho nas gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs kyi khyad par dang bcas pa brjod na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid de zhes gong du gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba byas pa der
translated: If you state the reason with a distinction, “because it is not apprehended by direct perception,” then the meaning of the reason is not ascertained.

original: yang / ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang / ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the reason is not ascertained.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las de yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu snga na yod pa'i skye ba dgag pa bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa las de yod pa nyid du bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu snga na yod pa'i skye ba dgag pa bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because it cannot be demonstrated that it exists by way of inference according to the method taught, and because of the method of demonstrating the refutation of the prior existence of the effect.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don khas blangs pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //🔽zil gyis ma non pa dang / rags pa nyid ni med pa ma byung ba las gdod 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don khas blangs pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no // zil gyis ma non pa dang / rags pa nyid ni med pa ma byung ba las gdod 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: And because the meaning of the reason “because it is not apprehended in any way” is accepted, it is not the case that the meaning is not established.🔽If you say that the effect is not overwhelmed and is gross,

original: 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that you are advocating that the effect is not prior to the cause, because it is not overwhelmed and is gross, arising from what did not exist before.🔽If you say that the effect exists in the cause, but it is not apprehended because it is overwhelmed and subtle,

original: rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin yang zil gyis non pa'i phyir dang / cha phra ba'i phyir gzung du med do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig kyang rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa zil gyis non pa dang / cha phra ba nyid yin par bstan dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu yod pa nyid yin yang zil gyis non pa'i phyir dang / cha phra ba'i phyir gzung du med do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig kyang rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa zil gyis non pa dang / cha phra ba nyid yin par bstan dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: then it is difficult to demonstrate that the effect exists in the cause, because it is overwhelmed and subtle.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That also is not logical.

original: grangs can dag las gang dag 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de'i don ni skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: grangs can dag las gang dag 'bras bu snga na yod pa zhes bya ba de'i don ni skye ba'i sngon rol na med pa ma yin la /
translated: As for the Sāṃkhyas who say that the effect exists prior to the cause, the meaning of that is not that it does not exist prior to arising.

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid gsal bar yod pa nyid ma yin pa nyid skye'o zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa yang snga ma bzhin du rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid gsal bar yod pa nyid ma yin pa nyid skye'o zhes zer ba de dag dgag pa yang snga ma bzhin du rgyas par bya'o //
translated: But they say that the effect itself is not manifest and that it arises. The refutation of that is to be done in detail as above.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyir yang bshad pa /🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyir yang bshad pa / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: Similarly, for those who say that the effect does not exist prior to the cause, it is also explained:🔽If the effect does not exist

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: In the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag kyang //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag kyang //
translated: Then causes and conditions

original: rgyu can ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu can ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: Would be equivalent to noncauses.

original: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty of the effect.

original: ji ste rgyu dang rkyen rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ste rgyu dang rkyen rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If you ask, “What is the difference between causes and conditions?”

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa dang / gcig phu dang rang gi don byed pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / cha mnyam pa bskyed pa la sogs pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //🔽rkyen rnams kyi @198a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa dang / gcig phu dang rang gi don byed pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / cha mnyam pa bskyed pa la sogs pa dag yin par rig par bya'o // rkyen rnams kyi @198a * //
translated: The characteristics of causes are the opposite of those of conditions.

original: mtshan nyid ni de las bzlog pa ste /🔽thun mong dang / du ma dang / gzhan gyi rgyud gso ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa dang / thag ring ba dang / cha mi mnyam pa skyed pa la sogs pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni de las bzlog pa ste / thun mong dang / du ma dang / gzhan gyi rgyud gso ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don byed pa dang / thag ring ba dang / cha mi mnyam pa skyed pa la sogs pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of conditions are the opposite of those of causes.🔽The characteristics of causes are the opposite of those of conditions.

original: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen ma yin mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: The characteristics of causes are the opposite of those of conditions.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi chos 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid dang / 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin par bstan pas 'dir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyogs la skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba 'di lta bu mngon te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi chos 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin pa nyid dang / 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin par bstan pas 'dir 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba dag gi phyogs la skabs kyi don la phan pa'i rjes su dpag pa bsal ba 'di lta bu mngon te /
translated: Here, the following syllogism is stated to refute the position of those who advocate that effects do not preexist:

original: don dam par sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par sa bon la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni 'bras bu bskyed pa ma yin pa nyid yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Ultimate reality, seeds and so on, causes and conditions, are not generative of effects because they are empty of effects.

original: 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: 'bras bus stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: For example,

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag bzhin no //🔽gal te 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis bskyed par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa dag bzhin no // gal te 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis bskyed par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: like that which is not a cause and condition.🔽If you say that effects are to be generated by causes and conditions,

original: rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen nges pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because effects arise from just the ascertainment of causes and conditions,

original: des kyang mi nus te /
analyzed: des kyang mi nus te /
translated: that is also not possible.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no concomitance, and because the same critique would apply to you.

original: gal te nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu skye bar mthong bas /
analyzed: gal te nas kyi sa bon las nas kyi myu gu skye bar mthong bas /
translated: If you say, “We see that a barley sprout arises from a barley seed,”

original: mthong ba la gtan tshigs kyi tshig don med do zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba la gtan tshigs kyi tshig don med do zhe na /
translated: then the statement “because it is seen” is meaningless.

original: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i blos myu gu skye ba dang / de bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dang 'bras bu skye ba mthong ba ni bden no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i blos myu gu skye ba dang / de bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen nges pa dang 'bras bu skye ba mthong ba ni bden no //
translated: It is true that the mind that belongs to the domain of conventional reality sees the arising of a sprout and sees that a specific cause and condition gives rise to a specific result.

original: don dam par ni ma mthong ste //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma mthong ste //
translated: But it does not see that ultimately.

original: don dam par de'i skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de'i skye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately the arising of that sprout is not established.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na 'bras bu 'grub pa mi 'thad pas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang ; rjes su 'gro ba yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na 'bras bu 'grub pa mi 'thad pas 'bras bu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang ; rjes su 'gro ba yang med do //
translated: Therefore, when you analyze in this way, since it is untenable that an effect is established, the meaning of the reason “because it is a cause of the establishment of an effect” is not established, and there is no concomitance.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyi rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba rnams kyi rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu byin nas 'gag par 'gyur ram /
translated: For those who advocate that the effect does not exist in the cause, does the cause cease having given rise to the effect?

original: 'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te ma byin par 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: Or does it cease without having given rise to the effect?

original: des cir 'gyur /🔽gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: What is the problem?🔽If the cause ceases

original: rgyu sbyin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na //
analyzed: rgyu sbyin nas ni 'gag 'gyur na //
translated: Having given rise to the effect,

original: gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa //
analyzed: gang byin pa dang gang 'gag pa //
translated: then that which has ceased

original: rgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu yi bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: and that which has not ceased would be the nature of the cause.

original: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu'i nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rgyus 'bras bu la rgyu'i nus pa phul nas 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: If the cause ceases having given rise to the effect,

original: gang byin pa dang / gang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang byin pa dang / gang 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: then that which has ceased and that which has not ceased would be the nature of the cause.

original: byin pa dang / 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin pa dang / 'gag pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of that which has ceased and that which has not ceased is different.

original: @198b de ni tha snyad du yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: @198b de ni tha snyad du yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is not accepted even conventionally.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'bru la sogs pa grogs byed pas phan btags na 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'bru la sogs pa grogs byed pas phan btags na 'bras bu skyed par nus pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, the cause of dependent origination is able to give rise to the effect when it is assisted by cooperating conditions.

original: de'i rkyen gyis 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu med pa gzhag pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi med pa la nus pa dbul du mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu med pa gzhag pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi med pa la nus pa dbul du mi rung ngo ;
translated: If the effect arises due to the condition of the cause, then the cause that is devoid of the effect is not suitable to be the basis of the distinction of the effect.

original: / de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la 'pho ba med de /
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'du byed rnams la 'pho ba med de /
translated: Therefore, formations do not transfer.

original: 'dra ba las /
analyzed: 'dra ba las /
translated: From a similar cause,

original: de ltar 'khrul to //
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul to //
translated: there is delusion in that way.

original: 'on te ma byin bar 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te ma byin bar 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: But if it ceases without giving,

original: de lta na /🔽gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: de lta na / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
translated: then in that case,🔽if the cause ceases

original: rgyu ma byin par 'gag 'gyur na //🔽rgyu 'gags pa na skyes pa yi //
analyzed: rgyu ma byin par 'gag 'gyur na // rgyu 'gags pa na skyes pa yi //
translated: without giving to the effect,🔽then the effect that arises

original: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: when the cause ceases would be causeless.

original: 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'dod pas /
translated: Since it is not accepted that the effect arises from a causeless cause,

original: de'i phyir yang rgyu 'gags pa ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rgyu 'gags pa ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
translated: therefore the cause that has ceased does not generate the effect,

original: 'gags pa'i phyir 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gags pa'i phyir 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no //
translated: because it has ceased, like something that has long since ceased.

original: 'di la 'gal ba bsgrub pa med pas don 'di gzhan la bstan par bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba bsgrub pa med pas don 'di gzhan la bstan par bya mi dgos so //
translated: Since there is no proof of contradiction here, it is not necessary to teach this meaning to others.

original: gal te tshogs pa nyid dang lhan cig skye bzhin pas 'bras bu skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa nyid dang lhan cig skye bzhin pas 'bras bu skyed par byed de /
translated: But if the effect is generated by the assemblage itself, which is co-originated,

original: dper na mar me dang 'od bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mar me dang 'od bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like the light and the flame, for example.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /🔽gal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / gal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:🔽If the effect arises

original: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na //
translated: Together with the assemblage,

original: skyed pa dang ni gang bskyed pa //
analyzed: skyed pa dang ni gang bskyed pa //
translated: Then the generator and

original: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: The generated would be simultaneous.

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa pha dang bu lta bu dag dus gcig tu 'byung ba nyid de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa pha dang bu lta bu dag dus gcig tu 'byung ba nyid de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: It is not maintained that the generator and the generated, like a father and son, occur at the same time.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: How is it maintained?

original: dus tha dad pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa nyid du'o //
translated: They are maintained to be different in time.

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa nyid dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag par nus te /🔽'bras bu tshogs pa nyid ni lhan cig mi skye ste /
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa nyid dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod pas de'i phyir rjes su dpag par nus te / 'bras bu tshogs pa nyid ni lhan cig mi skye ste /
translated: Since the generator and the generated exist as cause and effect, they can be inferred.

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na bu dang pha bzhin no ;
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na bu dang pha bzhin no ;
translated: The effect does not arise simultaneously with the assemblage because the generator and the generated are different in time, like a son and his father.

original: / tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis mar me 'od dang bcas pa tha snyad par 'byung ba'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis mar me 'od dang bcas pa tha snyad par 'byung ba'i phyir mar me dang 'od dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the conventional expression “the lamp and its light” occurs due to the power of the prior collection of causes, the lamp and its light do not exist as cause and effect.

original: dgag pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgag pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the extensive refutation of this has already been presented,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin no //🔽gang dag 'bras bu sngar skyes pa nyid tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin no // gang dag 'bras bu sngar skyes pa nyid tshogs pa nyid kyis gsal bar byed do zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: this is not good.

original: gal te tshogs pa'i snga rol du //
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa'i snga rol du //
translated: For those who say that the effect that arose earlier is made manifest by the collection of causes and conditions, this is explained:

original: 'bras bu skye bar gyur na ni //🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol du de dag med par de yod par gyur na ni de ltar na /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye bar gyur na ni // gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol du de dag med par de yod par gyur na ni de ltar na /
translated: If the effect arose🔽Prior to the collection of causes and conditions,

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa yis //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa yis //
translated: then if the effect existed without the collection of causes and conditions,

original: 'bras bu rgyu med 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽de @199a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med 'byung bar 'gyur // de @199a * //
translated: the effect would arise without a cause.

original: yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la 'bras bu yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i gsal ba yod pa nyid du ni rjes su dpag par mi bya ste /🔽gsal ba'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la 'bras bu yod pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i gsal ba yod pa nyid du ni rjes su dpag par mi bya ste / gsal ba'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, we do not infer the existence of the manifest effect in order to prove that the effect exists.

original: grangs can dag las /
analyzed: grangs can dag las /
translated: Because we have already responded to the argument about the manifest.🔽The Sāṃkhyas say:

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'gag pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so //
translated: The cause itself ceases and abides in the nature of the effect.

original: de dag gi yang gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa /
analyzed: de dag gi yang gal te rgyus rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa /
translated: If they say that the cause does not completely abandon its own nature,

original: 'gags pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'gags pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhe na ni /
translated: and that which has ceased abides in the nature of the effect,

original: gal te rgyu 'gags 'bras bu na //
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'gags 'bras bu na //
translated: then if the cause that has ceased

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod na'o //
translated: is asserted to be the nature of the effect,

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: then in that case,

original: rgyu ni kun du 'pho bar 'gyur //
