analyzed: rgyu ni kun du 'pho bar 'gyur //
translated: the cause would completely transfer.

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not completely abandon its own nature,

original: lhas byin khyim nas khyim du kun du 'pho ba bzhin no //🔽gzhan yang / sngon skyes pa yi rgyu yang ni //
analyzed: lhas byin khyim nas khyim du kun du 'pho ba bzhin no // gzhan yang / sngon skyes pa yi rgyu yang ni //
translated: it would be like Devadatta completely transferring from one house to another house.🔽Moreover,

original: yang skye bar ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yang skye bar ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it follows that the previously arisen cause would arise again.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni /
translated: That which exists in the nature of the cause

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid kho nar mi skye ste /
translated: does not arise in the nature of the cause,

original: ci yang ma dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci yang ma dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not necessary.🔽If you accept that the cause arises in the nature of the effect, there is no fault.

original: gal te rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu zhes brjod na ni ming tsam tha dad par zad pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu zhes brjod na ni ming tsam tha dad par zad pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon
translated: If you say that the cause is called the effect when it does not completely abandon its own nature as a cause, then the difference is merely nominal, and the fault stated above

original: ldog pa med do //
analyzed: ldog pa med do //
translated: cannot be averted.

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du nges par gnas par rtog na yang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba de legs par ma brtags par
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du nges par gnas par rtog na yang rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gnas so zhes bya ba de legs par ma brtags par
translated: If you imagine that the cause definitely endures in the nature of the effect after completely abandoning its own nature as a cause, then because that which completely abandons its own nature as a cause is not a cause, it is not tenable to say that the cause endures in the nature of the effect.

original: smras pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa yin no //
translated: This is a statement that is not well-conceived.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa nyid skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba dag rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa nyid skyed par byed dam /
translated: Moreover, if you maintain that the effect exists prior to the cause, does the cause that has ceased generate the effect that has arisen?

original: gnas pas skyed par byed par rtog grang na /
analyzed: gnas pas skyed par byed par rtog grang na /
translated: Or does the cause that endures generate the effect?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is illogical for the effect to be generated in either case.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽'gags pa nub par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'gags pa nub par gyur pa yis //
translated: Why is it illogical?

original: 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skye //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skye //
translated: How could an effect arise🔽from a cause that has ceased and vanished?

original: 'gags pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa yang bskyed mi dgos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gags pa ni rgyu nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / skyes pa yang bskyed mi dgos pa'i phyir /
translated: It is illogical for a cause that has ceased to be a cause and it is illogical for an effect that has arisen to arise again.

original: rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rgyu 'gags pas 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement “The cause that has ceased does not generate the effect that has arisen” is this.

original: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some Sāṃkhyas say:

original: rdzas nges par gnas pa'i chos gzhan ldog pa na /
analyzed: rdzas nges par gnas pa'i chos gzhan ldog pa na /
translated: When a different attribute of a substance that definitely endures is reversed,

original: chos gzhan skye ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gzhan skye ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: a different attribute arises, and that is called transformation.

original: rgyu 'gags nas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags nas 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore the effect does not arise from the cause that has ceased,

original: nus pa'i tshul du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa'i tshul du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: but because it exists in the manner of potency,

original: gsal ba khyad par can ma skyes par skyed @199b par bya mi dgos pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba khyad par can ma skyes par skyed @199b par bya mi dgos pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that a special clarity that has not arisen needs to be generated.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de lta na yang rdzas nges par gnas pa yang chos gzhan ldog pa'i dus na ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rdzas nges par gnas pa yang chos gzhan ldog pa'i dus na ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, a substance that definitely endures would cease when another attribute ceases,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na chos gzhan ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na chos gzhan ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not different from that, just like the cessation of another attribute.

original: de bzhin du chos can yang chos gzhan skye ba'i dus na skye bar 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos can yang chos gzhan skye ba'i dus na skye bar 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: In the same way, it must be accepted that the attribute-possessor also arises when another attribute arises,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not different from that,

original: dper na chos gzhan skyes ba bzhin pas tha snyad du yang bsgrub par ni 'gal bar snang ngo //
analyzed: dper na chos gzhan skyes ba bzhin pas tha snyad du yang bsgrub par ni 'gal bar snang ngo //
translated: like the arising of another attribute. Therefore, even conventionally, it appears to be contradictory to establish it.

original: don dam par ni ji ltar rdzas nges par gnas pa de'i chos gzhan snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ji ltar rdzas nges par gnas pa de'i chos gzhan snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, how could the substance that definitely endures be transformed by the appearance or nonappearance of another attribute?

original: dper na che ge mo bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na che ge mo bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is not logical to say, “It is like so and so,” because there is no example at all.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: chos gzhan ldog pa gang yin pa de /
translated: the cessation of another phenomenon

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid yin nam /
translated: is either the nature of a cause

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin /
translated: or it is not the nature of a cause.

original: de la gal te de rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te de rgyu'i bdag nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is the nature of a cause,

original: de 'gags pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pa yin pas /🔽'gag pa nub par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: de 'gags pa'i phyir rgyu 'gags pa yin pas / 'gag pa nub par gyur pa yis //
translated: then because it has ceased, the cause has ceased.🔽How could a cause that has ceased

original: 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skyed //
translated: and gone to rest generate an arisen effect?

original: rgyu 'gags pa la 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu nyid med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: rgyu 'gags pa la 'bras bu skyes pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu nyid med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that a cause that has ceased definitely lacks the power to generate an arisen effect.

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de lta na rgyu nges par gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de lta na rgyu nges par gnas pa'i phyir 'bras bu snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: But if it is not the nature of a cause, then in that case, because the cause definitely endures, it is logical that the effect would appear.

original: gal te de ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you do not accept that,

original: de mi gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: de mi gnod do zhe na /
translated: then it is not harmed.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain this, it is said:

original: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause is related to the effect.

original: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
translated: How can it generate the effect by enduring?

original: rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not different from itself.

original: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the cause itself.

original: de lta bas na rgyu nges par gnas pas de nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig gis dus mnyam pa nyid rjes su dpog pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu nges par gnas pas de nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed par byed do zhes smra ba dag gi tshig gis dus mnyam pa nyid rjes su dpog pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis /
translated: Therefore, those who say that the cause generates the effect by enduring, by the words of their own theory, the simultaneity of cause and effect is inferred.

original: de bskyed pa nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bskyed pa nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not a generator,

original: de rgyu nyid yin pa gsal bas /
analyzed: de rgyu nyid yin pa gsal bas /
translated: it is clear that it is not a cause.

original: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: Therefore, the proposition is faulty in that the nature of the subject is contradicted.

original: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gang dag / ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
analyzed: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang dag / ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
translated: “Related” means “assembled.”🔽Those who say that the cause is not related to the effect,

original: rgyu de 'bras bu dang ma 'brel bar smra ba de dag gi yang /
analyzed: rgyu de 'bras bu dang ma 'brel bar smra ba de dag gi yang /
translated: for them,

original: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //
translated: what effect does the cause generate?

original: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: It does not produce an effect.

original: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir @200a * //
analyzed: 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir @200a * //
translated: Because it is empty of effect.

original: dper na / de las gzhan zhig bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dper na / de las gzhan zhig bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: For example, it is like something else.

original: de ltar re zhig 'bras bu spyir dgag pa byas so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'bras bu spyir dgag pa byas so //
translated: Thus, first, the effect is refuted in general.

original: da ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i khyad par dag bsal ba'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i khyad par dag bsal ba'i phyir 'di bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to refute the specific effects such as visual consciousness, this is taught:

original: 'di la mig gi dbang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin na des gzugs mthong nas /
analyzed: 'di la mig gi dbang po ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin na des gzugs mthong nas /
translated: If the eye faculty is the cause of visual consciousness, does it see form and then generate visual consciousness?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed dam /🔽ma mthong bar skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed dam / ma mthong bar skyed par byed grang na /
translated: Or does it generate visual consciousness without seeing?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi srid de /🔽kha cig na re mthong na ni skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma mthong na yang rkyen med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi srid de / kha cig na re mthong na ni skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ma mthong na yang rkyen med pa'i phyir /
translated: Both are impossible.

original: rgyus ni mthong dang ma mthong bar //
analyzed: rgyus ni mthong dang ma mthong bar //
translated: Some say: If it sees, then it is meaningless to generate visual consciousness, and if it does not see, then there is no condition for generating visual consciousness.

original: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed do //
translated: The cause does not produce the effect

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Whether it sees or does not see.🔽Some say: If it sees, then it is meaningless to generate visual consciousness, and if it does not see, then there is no condition for generating visual consciousness.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong nas zhes bya ba ni phrad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong nas zhes bya ba ni phrad nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Others say: “Seeing” means “having met.”

original: 'di ltar yod na phrad par 'gyur bas yod pa la skye bas ci bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod na phrad par 'gyur bas yod pa la skye bas ci bya /
translated: If it exists, it would meet with it. What use is there for arising to that which exists?

original: med pa la yang phrad pa mi srid pas med pa la ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes zer ro //
analyzed: med pa la yang phrad pa mi srid pas med pa la ci zhig skye bar 'gyur zhes zer ro //
translated: Also, it is impossible for that which does not exist to meet with it. What use is there for arising to that which does not exist?

original: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa na re de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who are not others say: That is illogical.

original: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang ni 'brel pa'i rgyu //
translated: How could a cause related to an effect

original: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: gnas pas kyang ni ji ltar skyed //
translated: Generate it if it endures?

original: ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
analyzed: ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
translated: If it is not related to an effect,

original: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //🔽ces bstan pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed // ces bstan pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: What effect does it generate?🔽This is not different from the statement:

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If it arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu yod na ni //
translated: If the effect exists in the assembly,

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //🔽gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye // gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //
translated: How could it arise from the assembly?

original: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid las skye 'gyur na //
translated: If it arises from the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
analyzed: tshogs la 'bras bu med na ni //
translated: If the effect does not exist in the assembly,🔽How could it arise from the assembly?

original: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
analyzed: ji ltar tshogs pa nyid las skye //
translated: And also, “How could it arise from the assemblage itself?”

original: zhes bstan pa dag dang yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa dag dang yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: There is no difference between this and what we have said.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rgyu dag gis rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu dag skyed par mi byed pa nyid du yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa rgyu dag gis rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu dag skyed par mi byed pa nyid du yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be said that the ear consciousness and so on are not produced by the ear and so on as causes.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
translated: Ultimately, a cause does not produce an effect,

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of an effect.

original: 'di na gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not produce something is not its cause,

original: dper na / bum pa dang snam bu bzhin pas de lta na gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
analyzed: dper na / bum pa dang snam bu bzhin pas de lta na gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
translated: like a pot and a cloth. Thus, because the reason is established, the intended meaning is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:🔽An effect that has passed does not make contact🔽with a cause that has passed,

original: 'bras bu 'das pa rgyu 'das dang // ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa rgyu 'das dang // ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: that is not yet arisen, or that is arisen.

original: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This never exists.

original: 'bras bu @200b 'das pa ni rgyu 'das pa dang ma skyes pa dang / lhan cig phrad par gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu @200b 'das pa ni rgyu 'das pa dang ma skyes pa dang / lhan cig phrad par gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An arisen effect never makes contact with a past or future cause,

original: 'bras bu dang / rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because neither a cause nor an effect exists.

original: 'bras bu 'das pa dang / rgyu skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'das pa dang / rgyu skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An arisen effect never makes contact with a past cause,

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect does not exist.

original: 'bras bu ma skyes rgyu ma skyes //🔽'das pa dang ni skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //🔽nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes rgyu ma skyes // 'das pa dang ni skyes pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni // nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: An unarisen effect never makes contact with an unarisen cause,🔽nor does an arisen effect ever make contact with a past cause.

original: 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa dang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa dang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An unarisen effect never makes contact with an unarisen cause,

original: 'bras bu dang / rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rgyu gnyi ga med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because neither a cause nor an effect exists.

original: 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang / rgyu ma skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa dang / rgyu ma skyes pa yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An unarisen effect and an unarisen cause never make contact.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect does not exist.🔽An arisen effect and an arisen cause,

original: 'bras bu skyes pa rgyu skyes dang // ma skyes pa dang 'das pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa rgyu skyes dang // ma skyes pa dang 'das pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: An unarisen cause, and a past cause,

original: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Never make contact.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa ni rgyu skyes pa dang / lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa ni rgyu skyes pa dang / lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An arisen effect never makes contact with an arisen cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig tu 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has been refuted that cause and effect occur at the same time.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa dang / rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa dang / yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa dang / rgyu ma skyes pa dang / 'das pa dang / yang lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba nam yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An arisen effect never makes contact with an unarisen cause or a past cause.

original: rgyu gnyis ka med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis ka med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both causes do not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar yang phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, when analyzed in this way, cause and effect never make contact in any way.

original: phrad pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If there is no contact,

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar skyed //
translated: How could a cause generate an effect?

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: skyed par mi byed de /
translated: It does not generate it,

original: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tshig gi don mngon no //🔽'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i tshig gi don mngon no // 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
translated: because there is no contact. The meaning of the statement of the proposition and the proof is clear.

original: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na sa'i steng na 'dug pa'i sa bon dang / ri'i sgang na 'dug pa'i sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na sa'i steng na 'dug pa'i sa bon dang / ri'i sgang na 'dug pa'i sa bon bzhin no //
translated: Here the inference is: Ultimately a cause does not generate an effect, because there is no contact, just as, for example, a seed on the ground does not contact a seed on a mountain peak.

original: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang 'bras bu mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: For those who say that cause and effect do not differ,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par smra ba de dag la yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu phrad par smra ba de dag la yang rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na rgyu yin gyi /
translated: and that cause and effect contact each other, if a cause generates an effect, it is a cause.

original: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa ni rgyu ma yin pas /
translated: If it does not generate an effect, it is not a cause.

original: rgyu ma yin pa ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ji ltar rgyur 'gyur /
translated: How could a noncause become a cause?

original: rgyus 'bras bu bskyed zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid mi srid do //🔽byed do // byas so //
analyzed: rgyus 'bras bu bskyed zin pa la ni yang bskyed par bya ba ci yang med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid mi srid do // byed do // byas so //
translated: But when the cause has already generated the effect, it is impossible for it to be a cause, because there is nothing to be generated again.🔽“It makes,” “it made,”

original: byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas /
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas /
translated: “it will make” —

original: rgyu bye brag tu bshad pa byed na yang @201a * //
analyzed: rgyu bye brag tu bshad pa byed na yang @201a * //
translated: if one were to make a special explanation of the cause,

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa bsgrub par zad kyi /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa bsgrub par zad kyi /
translated: one would be establishing conventional truth.

original: don dam par de dang mthun pa cung zad kyang ston par mi nus so //
analyzed: don dam par de dang mthun pa cung zad kyang ston par mi nus so //
translated: But one cannot show even the slightest thing that is consistent with the ultimate.

original: ci ste / mi 'thad bzhin du rtog na yang //
analyzed: ci ste / mi 'thad bzhin du rtog na yang //
translated: But if you imagine that it is tenable,

original: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang //
translated: even though it is not,

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed //
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed //
translated: how could the cause generate the effect,🔽if contact exists?

original: 'bras bu yod na yang snga ma bzhin du skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na yang snga ma bzhin du skye ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If the effect exists, then, as before, its generation would be pointless.

original: yang na 'di ni sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, this is another path of refutation:🔽For those for whom the cause is empty of the effect,

original: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus stong pa de dag la gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus stong pa de dag la gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i rgyu /
translated: if the cause is empty of the effect,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
translated: How could it generate an effect?

original: cis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: cis brjod par bya ste /
translated: How could it be said to be an effect?

original: des stong pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des stong pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Because it is not empty of that, like something else, for example.

original: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus mi stong pa de dag la yang /
analyzed: gang dag gi grub pa'i mtha' las rgyu 'bras bus mi stong pa de dag la yang /
translated: Also, for those who maintain that causes are not empty of effects,

original: gal te 'bras bus mi stong rgyu //🔽ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bus mi stong rgyu // ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
translated: How could a cause that is not empty of the effect🔽Generate an effect?

original: ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: How could it be said to be an effect?

original: des mi stong pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: des mi stong pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because it is not empty of that, like

original: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so /
translated: the nature of the effect, for example.

original: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /
translated: The Lamp of Wisdom

original: bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: The Fifteenth Chapter

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra bas de dgag pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong par smra bas de dgag pa'i phyir sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bstan par bya ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas maintain that even prior to the arising of the effect, it is not empty of the nature of the effect. To refute that, another syllogism should be stated:

original: 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not empty would not cease.

original: 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni skye ba don med pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa la ni skye ba don med pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The effect that is not a dependent arising does not arise, because it is pointless for it to arise, since it exists by way of its own intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not arise.🔽And that which does not arise does not cease, because it is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: ma skyes pa la ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la ni ngo bo nyid 'gyur ba med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it does not cease.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: In that case,

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang ; / ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang ; / ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: That which is not empty would be Unceased and nonarisen.

original: de ltar ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable,

original: 'bras bu ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i chos can nyid du 'dod do //
translated: because the effect is asserted to have the attributes of arising and ceasing.

original: des na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skye ba med pa'i chos can dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin par mthong ste /🔽yod pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: des na gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni skye ba med pa'i chos can dang / 'gag pa med pa'i chos can yin par mthong ste / yod pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Therefore, whatever exists is seen to have the attribute of nonarising and the attribute of noncessation,

original: da ltar gyi skad cig ma bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar gyi skad cig ma bzhin no //
translated: because it exists, like, for example, the present moment.

original: de ltar yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis de dag bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis de dag bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since they are inferred to exist in that way, they are refuted by the fact that they are neither produced nor cease.

original: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Therefore, the fault of refuting the entity of the subject is present in the thesis.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag ni 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol na ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: The Lokayatas say that since the effect has a nonexistent nature prior to its production,

original: 'bras @201b bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'bras @201b bu stong pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: the effect has an empty nature.🔽And even when it is produced, it does not have the nature of another thing.

original: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes zer bas de dag la yang /🔽stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: skyes na yang dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes zer bas de dag la yang / stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: Therefore, it should be said to them:🔽How could the empty be produced?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur // zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: How could the empty cease?

original: don dam par stong pa ni skye bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: don dam par stong pa ni skye bar mi rigs te /
translated: Ultimate emptiness is not reasonable to be produced

original: med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not exist.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a sky flower.

original: don dam par 'bru'i ngo bo nyid de la 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'gag par mi rigs te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bru'i ngo bo nyid de la 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'gag par mi rigs te /
translated: Ultimate emptiness does not have the nature of a seed, and since a thing that is not a seed does not exist, it is not reasonable for it to cease.

original: 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dper na 'bru ma yin pa zhig nas med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bru ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dper na 'bru ma yin pa zhig nas med pa bzhin no //
translated: Because there is no thing that is not a seed, just as something that is not a seed does not exist.

original: yang na kho bo cag ni don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par ltos pas /
analyzed: yang na kho bo cag ni don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par ltos pas /
translated: Or, since we rely on ultimate truth,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong par brjod pas mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na de ni de las zlog par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong par brjod pas mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na de ni de las zlog par 'gyur bas /
translated: we say that dependent origination is empty of the nature of emptiness. If something existed that was not empty, it would be the opposite of that.

original: de lta bu de ni tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du ma grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu de ni tha snyad du yang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du ma grags pa'i phyir /
translated: But such a thing is not renowned in any way, even conventionally, like a sky flower.

original: 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And that which is not empty would not cease.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: If that were so,

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: then that which is not empty would be unceased and also unarisen.

original: 'dis ni mi stong pa nyid kyis skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas /
analyzed: 'dis ni mi stong pa nyid kyis skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pas /
translated: This shows that it follows that that which is not empty would be unarisen and unceasing.

original: stong pa nyid yin na 'bras bu skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos mngon pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid yin na 'bras bu skye ba dang / 'gag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa'i chos mngon pas /
translated: If it is emptiness, it would have the attributes of arising and ceasing, and so the attributes of the probandum and the proof would be the same.

original: don dam par 'bras bu ni stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don dam par 'bras bu ni stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the effect is emptiness.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because it arises and ceases,

original: sgyu ma bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: it is like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du gal te 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te 'bras bu med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if it is the nature of the effect to be nonexistent,

original: tha snyad du yang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not arise and would not cease even conventionally,

original: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin pas /
translated: because it would be nonexistent, like, for example, a sky flower.

original: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: How could emptiness arise?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: How could emptiness cease?

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not arise and does not cease,

original: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes pa yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes pa yang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: emptiness would be unceasing and unarisen.

original: de yang mi 'dod pas 'dis kyang gong du bstan pa bzhin du dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi don mngon pas /
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pas 'dis kyang gong du bstan pa bzhin du dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi don mngon pas /
translated: Since that is not accepted, this also, as was previously explained, is a contradiction of the thesis and the meaning of the reason.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi 'bras bu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi 'bras bu ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa la khyad par yod par zad kyi lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, the inference is that the ultimate internal effect is not a non-existent entity. The thesis is qualified, but the remainder is the same as before.

original: yang na med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis @202a * //
analyzed: yang na med pa'i ngo bo nyid du rjes su dpog pas skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyis @202a * //
translated: Or else, since it is inferred to be a non-existent entity, the thesis is qualified by the elimination of the arising and ceasing of the effect due to the non-arising and non-ceasing of the internal.

original: 'bras bu skye ba dang / 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa ni 'dir tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba dang / 'gag pa bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa ni 'dir tshig gi don yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is that the fault of qualifying the subject is taught.

original: gzhan yang skye ba nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /🔽de la / rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na / de la / rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
translated: Moreover, if arising itself were the cause and effect, it would be the same or different.🔽In that regard, it is said:

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause and effect are never tenable as the same.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: So too,🔽It is never tenable

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du //🔽nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du // nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That cause and effect are different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na go rims bzhin du skyon brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na go rims bzhin du skyon brjod par bya ste /
translated: Why? The errors will be stated in order.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid na //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid na //
translated: If cause and effect were the same,

original: skyed dang skyed pa gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: skyed dang skyed pa gcig tu 'gyur //
translated: The producer and the produced would be the same.

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa pha dang bu lta bu gang dag yin pa dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa pha dang bu lta bu gang dag yin pa dag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar mi 'dod pas /
translated: If the producer and the produced were the same, it would follow that father and son would be the same, but that is unacceptable.

original: 'dir glags yod pa'i sgyu thabs kyis chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir glags yod pa'i sgyu thabs kyis chos mthun pa'i dpe nye bar gzhag ste /
translated: Here, using a deceptive argument that exploits a weakness in the opponent’s position, we posit a concordant example.

original: gal te shing de me yin na //
analyzed: gal te shing de me yin na //
translated: If the fuel were fire,

original: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa po dang las gcig 'gyur //
translated: The agent and the object would be the same.

original: zhes bya ba der bstan pa'i tshul bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der bstan pa'i tshul bzhin no //
translated: This is just as it is stated in the following lines:

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe de las shes par byar nus te /🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten la grags pa'i dpe de las shes par byar nus te / rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gcig pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is possible to understand this point using an example that is familiar to the world.

original: skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin te /
analyzed: skyed pa dang bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir dper na pha dang bu dag bzhin te /
translated: Cause and effect are not the same because they are producer and produced, like, for example, a father and his son.

original: de ltar re zhig gcig pa nyid kyi phyogs la'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gcig pa nyid kyi phyogs la'o //
translated: Thus, first, in regard to the position of sameness.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la yang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la yang /
translated: In regard to the position of difference,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //
translated: if cause and effect were different,

original: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: cause and non-cause would be equivalent.

original: 'bras bu las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: Because the effect would be different from the cause, like something else, that also is unacceptable.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi chos ni rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid yin par 'dod pas 'dir yang shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi chos ni rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid yin par 'dod pas 'dir yang shes par byar nus te /
translated: Since the property of cause and effect is asserted to be non-difference of cause, it can be understood here as follows:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Cause and effect are not different.

original: rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are non-different from the cause,

original: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the nature of the cause itself.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na ther zug pa dag gis 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i tshul gyis yod par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed dam /
analyzed: rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na ther zug pa dag gis 'bras bu snga na yod par smra ba'i tshul gyis yod par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed dam /
translated: if the cause generates the effect, does it generate the existent effect in the manner of the Sāṃkhyas who assert the effect pre-exists?

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag gis 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba'i tshul gyis med par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag gis 'bras bu snga na med par smra ba'i tshul gyis med par gyur pa zhig skyed par byed grang na /
translated: If the Lokayatas say that a nonexistent effect is produced in the manner of the nonexistence of the effect prior to its production,🔽then,

original: de la / 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: de la / 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If the effect had its own intrinsic reality,

original: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur //
translated: what would its cause produce?

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod par gyur pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes @202b bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid yod par gyur pa ni tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes @202b bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Thus, if the effect had its own intrinsic reality, it would be difficult to teach even conventionally, and the faults of the thesis and so on would ensue, as they have been taught.

original: de ltar re zhig brtag pa dang po la'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig brtag pa dang po la'o //
translated: Thus, first, in the case of the first hypothesis,

original: brtag pa gnyis pa la yang /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa la yang /
translated: in the case of the second hypothesis as well,

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If the effect had no intrinsic reality,

original: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyus ni ci zhig skyed par 'gyur //
translated: what would its cause produce?

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med par gyur pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu skye ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med par gyur pa nam mkha'i me tog lta bu skye ba ni /
translated: The production of an effect that has no intrinsic reality, like a sky flower,

original: tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: tha snyad du yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir dang / snga ma bzhin du dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i skyon ji skad bstan pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Previously it was said:

original: sngar / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sngar / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not arise.

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: An effect that is not empty would not cease.🔽That which is not empty would be unceased

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and also unarisen.

original: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: How could an empty thing arise?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: How could an empty thing cease?🔽That which is empty would be unceased

original: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: and also unarisen.

original: zhes bya ba de dag gis ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas rgyu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de dag gis ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas rgyu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, by means of the effect, the non-entityness of cause is taught.

original: da ltar ni rgyu dngos las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: da ltar ni rgyu dngos las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Now, the non-entityness of the entity of cause is taught.

original: khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na don dam par rgyus 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na don dam par rgyus 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid mi 'thad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, when one examines in this way, since it is untenable that a cause generates an effect ultimately,

original: skye ba yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: skye ba yod pa ma yin na //
translated: then arising does not exist.

original: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs te /
translated: A cause is not tenable.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //🔽de la don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis so // de la don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, as it has been taught,🔽in that regard, someone says, “A cause generates an effect ultimately because it is the cause of an effect.”

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid do //🔽tha snyad pa'i gtan tshigs yin par brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de don dam par ni don ma grub pa nyid do // tha snyad pa'i gtan tshigs yin par brjod na ni don 'gal ba nyid de /
translated: The reason that is stated is not established ultimately.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it is a conventional reason, then the meaning is contradictory because it exists only in the discordant class.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skye par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / don dam par rgyus ni 'bras bu skye par byed pa nyid de /
translated: Here someone says,

original: 'di'i 'di'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i 'di'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “A cause generates an effect ultimately because it is said, ‘This is its effect.’

original: gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de la ni rgyu'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: gang gis gang skyed par mi byed pa de la ni rgyu'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes mi brjod de /
translated: But if something does not produce something, it is not called the cause of that.

original: dper na rnga mo'i rva 'di'i ru bzhi 'di'o zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga mo'i rva 'di'i ru bzhi 'di'o zhes mi brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not said that the horn of a rabbit is the horn of that.

original: 'di la ni mig 'di'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: 'di la ni mig 'di'i 'bras bu mig gi rnam par shes pa 'di'o zhe 'am /
translated: In this case, it is said that the eye is the cause of the eye consciousness,

original: sa bon 'di'i 'bras bu myu gu 'di'o zhes brjod pas /
analyzed: sa bon 'di'i 'bras bu myu gu 'di'o zhes brjod pas /
translated: or that the seed is the cause of the sprout.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the reason is established, the point to be proven is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te don dam par 'bras bu skye ba 'gag zhig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te don dam par 'bras bu skye ba 'gag zhig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If ultimately the arising of an effect and its cessation existed,

original: des na 'bras bu skye ba las /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu skye ba las /
translated: then the cause of the arising of an effect

original: rgyu yang rgyu nyid du 'thad pas rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes brjod du yang rung ba zhig na /
analyzed: rgyu yang rgyu nyid du 'thad pas rgyu 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes brjod du yang rung ba zhig na /
translated: would be tenable as a cause, and it would be tenable to say, “This is the cause of that effect.”

original: @203a * // de yang med pas /
analyzed: @203a * // de yang med pas /
translated: But that does not exist.

original: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad pa yod min na //
translated: If the cause itself is not tenable,

original: 'bras bu gang gis yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang gis yin par 'gyur //
translated: how could the effect exist?

original: de ltar de ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub ba nyid dam /
analyzed: de ltar de ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub ba nyid dam /
translated: Thus, since that is not established, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning is contradictory.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: tshogs pa nyid na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid na 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: The effect arises when the assembly itself arises.

original: dus kyang tshogs pa'i yan lag yin pas /
analyzed: dus kyang tshogs pa'i yan lag yin pas /
translated: And since time is a part of the assembly,

original: des na 'bras bu grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'bras bu grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the effect is the cause of its own establishment.

original: gtan tshigs sngar smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs sngar smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the previous argument is not unestablished.

original: kho bo cag rgyu 'ba' zhig las 'bras bu 'grub par yang mi 'dod pas /
analyzed: kho bo cag rgyu 'ba' zhig las 'bras bu 'grub par yang mi 'dod pas /
translated: We do not assert that an effect is established from a cause alone.

original: de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la /
translated: Therefore, it is not that a cause generates an effect,🔽nor is it that an effect is generated by a cause.

original: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: But what was said is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi tshogs pa de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, since the assembly of causes and conditions does not exist as a substance, it does not exist by its own intrinsic nature.

original: gal te des bdag nyid skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: gal te des bdag nyid skyed par byed cing /
translated: If it generates itself,

original: skyes na yang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: skyes na yang 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur grang na /
translated: and if it arises, then it generates an effect.

original: phyogs de yang 'khrul ba skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs de yang 'khrul ba skyed pa yin te /
translated: That direction also generates error.

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
translated: Whatever is the collection of causes and conditions,

original: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed na //
translated: that does not produce itself.

original: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu ji ltar skyed par byed //
translated: How will it produce a result?

original: des 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: des 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: It does not produce a result,

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because it does not exist substantially.

original: tshogs pa dgag pa 'di la kha cig na re tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa dgag pa 'di la kha cig na re tshogs pa gcig pu ma yin te /
translated: In this refutation of the collection, some say: Not only is the collection not a cause,

original: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po 'ga' yang med //
translated: but also no entity exists in any way.

original: gal te de yang de las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te de yang de las gzhan //
translated: If that is different from this,

original: de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod //
analyzed: de yang gcig pu 'ga' zhig yod //
translated: then that is also a single entity.

original: ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: As it is said.

original: kha cig na re de ni khungs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni khungs su mi rung ste /
translated: Some say: That is not a proper source,

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i don dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because it is not consistent with the meaning of the verse.

original: yang na tshogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang snga ma bzhin du nye bar sbyar nas /🔽rgyu bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu skyed pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang snga ma bzhin du nye bar sbyar nas / rgyu bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the conception that the assembly itself produces the effect is refuted just as before, by applying the same argument.

original: yang na tshogs pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: yang na tshogs pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa nyid yin na /
translated: Or else, if the assembly is the assembly of causes and conditions of the effects,

original: 'bras bu de yang don dam par dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du med par bstan zin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu de yang don dam par dngos su 'am brgyud pas 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du med par bstan zin pas /
translated: then the effect, whether directly or indirectly, does not exist as the entity of the effect in reality.

original: de'i phyir gang dag gi tshogs pa gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag gi tshogs pa gang zhig yin /
translated: Therefore, what is the assembly of what?

original: de dag gi de med pa nyid du nges par bzung nas /
analyzed: de dag gi de med pa nyid du nges par bzung nas /
translated: Having ascertained that they do not exist,🔽The assembly of causes and conditions

original: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
analyzed: rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen dag gi / tshogs pa gang yin de yis ni //
translated: Does not produce the effect.

original: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skye na //
analyzed: bdag gis bdag nyid mi skye na //
translated: If the self does not produce itself,

original: 'bras @203b bu ji ltar skyed par byed //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras @203b bu ji ltar skyed par byed // ces gsungs te /
translated: How could it produce the effect?

original: 'dir don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here the meaning is the same as before.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar tshogs pas 'bras bu bskyed par mi 'thad cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar tshogs pas 'bras bu bskyed par mi 'thad cing /
translated: When it is not tenable that the assembly produces the effect,

original: tshogs pa ma yin pa rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu des kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la /
analyzed: tshogs pa ma yin pa rgyu dang / rkyen tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i rgyu des kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed la /
translated: The cause that is not a collection and the cause that does not have the characteristic of a collection of conditions also do not produce an effect.

original: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa sngar bstan zin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rgyus bskyed par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa sngar bstan zin pas /
translated: And it has already been demonstrated that an effect is not produced by a cause.🔽Therefore, the conclusion is:

original: de phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang // tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med //
analyzed: de phyir tshogs pas byas pa dang // tshogs min byas pa'i 'bras bu med //
translated: There is no effect produced by a collection or not produced by a collection.

original: ces rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i nang du bstan pa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag pa'i nang du bstan pa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: This is the conclusion that is taught by the power of the immediately preceding chapter.

original: de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, time definitely exists,

original: 'bras bu grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid du nyams pa med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid du nyams pa med do //
translated: because it is the cause of the establishment of an effect. The meaning of this reason is not flawed by being unestablished.

original: grangs can dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: grangs can dag gis smras pa /
translated: The Sāṃkhya says:

original: tshogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa nyid de /🔽rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: tshogs pa ni rdzas su yod pa nyid de / rang gi yan lag dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: A collection definitely exists as a substance.🔽Because it is not different from its parts,

original: tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid bzhin pas /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i yan lag dag gi bdag nyid bzhin pas /
translated: like, for example, the nature of the parts of a collection.

original: tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshogs pas 'bras bu skyed par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: The collection does not produce the effect.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not substantially exist.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i tshogs pa yin grang na /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i tshogs pa yin grang na /
translated: If the collection of causes and conditions produces the effect,

original: 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang sngar bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang sngar bstan zin pas de'i phyir /
translated: then the effect does not arise and does not substantially exist. Since this has already been explained,

original: 'bras bu yong pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yong pa ma yin na //
translated: therefore the effect does not exist.

original: rkyen gyi tshogs pa ga la yod //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshogs pa ga la yod //
translated: How could there be a collection of conditions?

original: dpe ma grub pa'i phyir dang / btags bar yod pa yang de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa'i phyir dang / btags bar yod pa yang de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The example is not established, and because the meaning of the reason is not established, since that which exists as a designation cannot be said to be the same or different.🔽This is the intended meaning.

original: de ltar yang /🔽gang phyir 'jig rten ji snyed ming //
analyzed: de ltar yang / gang phyir 'jig rten ji snyed ming //
translated: As it is said:🔽Because the world appears

original: tshogs pa nyid la snang gyur pa //
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la snang gyur pa //
translated: in the collection of names,

original: de phyir dngos po yod min te //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po yod min te //
translated: therefore things do not exist,

original: dngos po tshogs pa'ang yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po tshogs pa'ang yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the collection of things also does not exist.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni dus ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is to refute the specific counter- positions to the teaching of the essencelessness of time.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //🔽de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no // de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa srid pa 'pho ba'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, it is the teaching of the essencelessness of cause and effect.

original: 'dren pas gang du tshogs nyid kyi //🔽lta ba rab tu bstan pa de //🔽blo can rnams kyi don dam gyi //
analyzed: 'dren pas gang du tshogs nyid kyi // lta ba rab tu bstan pa de // blo can rnams kyi don dam gyi //
translated: Therefore, the statement in the Bhagavān’s Ārya-saṃsāra-saṃparigraha-sūtra:🔽The guide taught the view of the assembly🔽In the stage of the ultimate

original: nye bar gdags pa'i sar ston to //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa'i sar ston to //
translated: Designation of the wise.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /🔽dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel @204a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang dag gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel @204a * //
translated: And so on, is established.🔽The root text composed by the master Bhāviveka🔽The Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the

original: pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Examination of Cause and Effect.

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu pa'o /
translated: This is the twentieth chapter.

original: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
translated: Now, in the same way, by the refutation of the distinctions of the counter-agent of emptiness,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa brtsam mo //
translated: the twenty-first chapter is begun for the sake of the meaning-purpose of teaching the realitylessness of origination and destruction.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say this:

original: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Time certainly exists in the ultimate,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of origination and destruction.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: For, that which does not exist is not the cause of origination and destruction,

original: dper na sbrul gyi rkang pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbrul gyi rkang pa bzhin no //
translated: like the horns of an ass.

original: dus ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: dus ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dag gi rgyu yin pas /
translated: Time is the cause of origination and destruction, which follow time.

original: de'i phyir don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin pas des na de gsal bar yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin pas des na de gsal bar yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs grub pas 'dod pa'i don grub po //
translated: Therefore, time certainly exists in the ultimate. Thus, since it is clearly existent, the reason is established and the desired conclusion is proven.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag gang yang rung ba med par ram /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag gang yang rung ba med par ram /
translated: Or else,🔽without either emergence or destruction.

original: lhan cig tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'grub par 'gyur grang na /
translated: and origination and destruction would be established either without or together.🔽But,

original: de la re zhig /'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram //
analyzed: de la re zhig /'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram //
translated: Destruction does not exist without origination,

original: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor does it exist together with it.

original: 'jig pa ni 'gag pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'gag pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “ Destruction” is a synonym for cessation.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: “ Origination” is a synonym for arising.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni rtsa ba bskang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ni rtsa ba bskang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “itself” is used to complete the verse.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ram //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ram //
translated: Origination does not exist without destruction,

original: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor does it exist together with it.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la'o //
translated: In our system,

original: de'i phyir de dag gi rgyu dus nyid yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan la ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi rgyu dus nyid yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan la ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since their cause does not exist at the time of their existence, the reason is not established as existing in the subject.

original: ci ste rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu ma grub par gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar mi nus so snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rab tu ma grub par gzhan gyi phyogs sun dbyung bar mi nus so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is not possible to refute the position of others without establishing your own system of tenets,

original: de bstan pa'i phyir re zhig rnam par brtags pa snga ma'i dbang du byas te bshad pa /🔽'jig pa 'byung ba med par ni //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir re zhig rnam par brtags pa snga ma'i dbang du byas te bshad pa / 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ni //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, first, from the perspective of the previous analysis, he explains:🔽How could destruction exist

original: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur //
translated: Without emergence?

original: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don te /
translated: This is the meaning of the words.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: ji ltar / 'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar / 'chi ba skye ba med pa ltar //
translated: Just as death does not exist without birth,

original: de ltar / 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med ;
analyzed: de ltar / 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med ;
translated: so too destruction does not exist without emergence.

original: / de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: / de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The reason is because it is the condition of that.

original: 'dir tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar dang / de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis khong nas drangs te /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i tshig gzhan 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar dang / de ltar zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis khong nas drangs te /
translated: Here, in order to clarify the meaning of the words, he states two other words, “just as” and “so too,” which are drawn from the root text.

original: bstan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bstan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen as the explanation.

original: don 'di yang rab tu grags pa yin pas /
analyzed: don 'di yang rab tu grags pa yin pas /
translated: This meaning is also well known,

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni @204b brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni @204b brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: so here inference should not be stated.

original: rab tu grags pa yin yang dpes dran par bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa yin yang dpes dran par bya ste /
translated: Even though it is well known, it should be recalled through an example.

original: de ltar re zhig 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first, destruction does not exist without arising.

original: 'jig pa ni 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nor does destruction exist simultaneously with arising,

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /🔽'jig pa 'byung dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / 'jig pa 'byung dang lhan cig tu //
translated: therefore it is said:🔽How could destruction exist

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽'chi ba skye dang dus gcig tu //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur // 'chi ba skye dang dus gcig tu //
translated: Simultaneously with arising?🔽Just as death does not exist

original: yod pa nyid ni ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ma yin bzhin //
translated: Simultaneously with birth.

original: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bzlog na don gsal ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: de la 'dir glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir bzlog na don gsal ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is clear because the words are reversible.

original: dper na sgra ji ltar rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na sgra ji ltar rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, it is like saying, “How could sound be permanent?

original: 'di ltar bum pa rtag par mi rigs so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa rtag par mi rigs so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: In that case, it is not reasonable for a pot to be permanent.”
