original: 'dir tshig gi don gsal ba'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni 'jig pa 'byung ba dang / lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don gsal ba'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni 'jig pa 'byung ba dang / lhan cig yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is clear because of the inference, “Destruction does not exist simultaneously with arising,

original: de'i rkyen can yin pa'i phyir dper na 'chi ba dang skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rkyen can yin pa'i phyir dper na 'chi ba dang skye ba bzhin no //
translated: because it has that as its condition, like death and birth.”

original: ci ste rnam par brtag pa phyi ma ltar na 'dir bshad pa /🔽'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: ci ste rnam par brtag pa phyi ma ltar na 'dir bshad pa / 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: If you assert the latter, then the following is explained here:🔽How could emergence exist

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: without destruction?

original: yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the statement “It would not exist” is that it would not exist as an existent.

original: de yang dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽dngos po rnams la mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos po rnams la mi rtag nyid //
translated: Why is that?🔽Impermanence does not

original: nam yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: ever not exist in things.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is its nature, just like the nature of a thing itself.

original: sde pa gzhan las gang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas des na dus thams cad du mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de yang /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan las gang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas des na dus thams cad du mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de yang /
translated: Other schools say: If something meets with the cause of destruction, impermanence causes it to disintegrate. Therefore impermanence does not exist at all times.

original: gal te de ltar na aa ru ra dang phrad nas lhas 'khru bar byed pa lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na aa ru ra dang phrad nas lhas 'khru bar byed pa lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would be like the god who bathes in the Ganges and becomes pure.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu yod na mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed na /
translated: If the cause of destruction exists, impermanence causes disintegration.

original: de lta na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig par byed kyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'jig par byed kyi /
translated: In that case, the cause of destruction itself causes destruction.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par mi byed de /
translated: Impermanence does not cause destruction,

original: de yod kyang 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang 'jig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it exists, it does not cause destruction.

original: de la 'di skad ces kyang dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kyang dri bar bya ste /
translated: In this regard, one should ask:

original: ci 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur ram /
translated: Does that which has the nature of destruction come to be destroyed in dependence on a cause of destruction?

original: 'on te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin pa zhig 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos nas 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: Or does that which does not have the nature of destruction come to be destroyed in dependence on a cause of destruction?

original: de la gal te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can zhig yin na ni de'i 'jig pa de skyes ma thag tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this regard, if it has the nature of destruction, then its destruction would occur immediately upon its arising,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas do ni rigs pa ma yin no //🔽'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin na yang 'jig @205a * //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas do ni rigs pa ma yin no // 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can ma yin na yang 'jig @205a * //
translated: because it would have that nature, just like its own nature. This is not logical.

original: par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not have the nature of destruction, it would not come to be destroyed,🔽because it would not have the nature of destruction, just like space.

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not of the nature of that, like nirvana.🔽And that is not logical.

original: gang zhig gang gis 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de yang de'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: And that which is asserted to be the cause of the destruction of something is not the cause of that,

original: de la khyad par yod kyang de khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: de la khyad par yod kyang de khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because even though there is a difference in that, there is no difference in that, like something else.

original: yang na 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, destruction is not caused,

original: 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dus ma byas bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na 'dus ma byas bzhin no //
translated: because it does not possess destruction, like the unconditioned.

original: de ltar 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu dang ldan pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyu dang ldan pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Thus, because it is inferred that it does not possess destruction, the assertion that it possesses a cause is refuted by the fact that it does not possess a cause. Therefore, there is the fault that the nature of the property is refuted in the thesis.

original: gal te 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: If destruction is not caused,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is a characteristic of the conditioned,🔽like arising.

original: dper na skye ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na skye ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, like arising itself.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag gis ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma dag gis ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: The last moment of mind and mental factors, and the last moment of cognition and sound, are not ascertained.

original: dpe yang med de /
analyzed: dpe yang med de /
translated: There is no example.

original: dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa nyid skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po ma byung ba las 'byung bas dngos po'i bdag nyid thob pa nyid skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since a thing arises from a nonarisen state, the attainment of the nature of a thing is called arising.

original: tha snyad du yang /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang /
translated: Even conventionally,

original: dngos po nyid na byung ba las 'byung bas skye ba rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid na byung ba las 'byung bas skye ba rdzas su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since arising arises from a thing, arising is not substantially established.

original: gzigs zan pa gang dag blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gzigs zan pa gang dag blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas say that the last moment of cognition and sound has a cause but is not seen to be destroyed.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /🔽zhig nas med pa la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te / zhig nas med pa la ni rgyu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.🔽For that which is destroyed and does not exist, a cause does not exist,

original: med pa'i phyir dper na gtan med pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na gtan med pa bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist, like something that is utterly nonexistent.

original: blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo dang sgra'i skad cig ma tha ma 'jig pa ni ma mthong ba'i byed pa po dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The last moment of the cognition and the sound is not endowed with an agent of destruction, because it is destroyed, like the first moment of the cognition and the sound.

original: 'jig pa'i phyir dper na blo dang sgra dang / me lce dag gi dang po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir dper na blo dang sgra dang / me lce dag gi dang po bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The last moment of the cognition and the sound is not endowed with an agent of destruction, because it is destroyed, like the first moment of the cognition and the sound.

original: kha ba dang / tshva dang / me dang / tho ba dag gis phog pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan mi 'dra bar byed pa yin gyi 'jig par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha ba dang / tshva dang / me dang / tho ba dag gis phog pa yang tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan mi 'dra bar byed pa yin gyi 'jig par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The contact with snow, salt, fire, and a hammer makes a difference in the reason for the conventional truth, but it does not cause destruction.

original: ci ste tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste tho bas phog pa la sogs pa dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: If you say that the contact with a hammer, etc. is the cause of destruction,

original: de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because when they exist, the thing to be destroyed is not apprehended,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical,

original: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi gzhi mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reason is not similar to the example and because there is no concomitance.

original: ci ste yang bum pa med par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni tho bas phog pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang bum pa med par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni tho bas phog pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the cause of the nonexistence of the pot is the contact with the hammer,

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung bas gzugs dmigs pa'i @205b rgyu ni mig yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dper na mig yod na gzugs dmigs pa 'byung bas gzugs dmigs pa'i @205b rgyu ni mig yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Because if it exists, it arises. For example, if the eye exists, the form that is its object exists, and the cause of the apprehension of form is the eye.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also illogical.

original: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las bum pa la tho bas phog pa yod pa na bum pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi grub pa'i mtha' las bum pa la tho bas phog pa yod pa na bum pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: In our system, when a hammer strikes a pot, the characteristics of the pot’s cause arise,

original: 'jig pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but it does not disintegrate. Therefore, the reason is not established in any way, and there is no example.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la yang gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la yang gyo mo la sogs pa tho bas phog pa la sogs pa'i rgyu can dag ni /
translated: Also, in the opponent’s system, shards and so on that are caused by the striking of a hammer

original: byed pa po phog ba dang ldan pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po phog ba dang ldan pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are asserted to be the agent that is the striker.

original: tho bas phog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bum pa yang 'jig par byed la /
analyzed: tho bas phog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis bum pa yang 'jig par byed la /
translated: The very thing that is struck by the hammer causes the disintegration of the pot.

original: gyo mo yang skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ni gcig gis dus gcig tu bya ba ni mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gyo mo yang skyed par byed do zhes bya ba ni gcig gis dus gcig tu bya ba ni mi mthun pa gnyis byed par mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical for one thing to perform two incompatible actions at one time.

original: 'o na me gcig gis dus gcig tu mun pa yang sel bar byed la /
analyzed: 'o na me gcig gis dus gcig tu mun pa yang sel bar byed la /
translated: But don’t you see that one fire at one time both clears away darkness

original: btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur ba skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur ba skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: and produces the transformation of cooking?

original: btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur ba skyed pa ni mthong gi / mun pa sel ba ni ma mthong ste /
analyzed: btso ba'i rnam pa 'gyur ba skyed pa ni mthong gi / mun pa sel ba ni ma mthong ste /
translated: We see that it produces the transformation of cooking, but we do not see that it clears away darkness,

original: mun pa ni snang ba med pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mun pa ni snang ba med pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because darkness is merely the absence of light.

original: / mdzad pa'i mtha' dang yang 'gal te /
analyzed: / mdzad pa'i mtha' dang yang 'gal te /
translated: It also contradicts the conclusion of the performance.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la mun pa zhes brjod pa'i gzugs kyi gnyen por snang ba shar na skad cig ma phyi ma ni rkyen med pas mi skye la /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la mun pa zhes brjod pa'i gzugs kyi gnyen por snang ba shar na skad cig ma phyi ma ni rkyen med pas mi skye la /
translated: In our system, when light arises as the antidote to the form called darkness, the subsequent moment does not arise because there are no conditions.

original: skad cig ma snga mas ni rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'gags bas /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga mas ni rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa nyid kyis 'gags bas /
translated: The previous moment ceases by itself.

original: de 'gag pa'i byed pa po ni me ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gag pa'i byed pa po ni me ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore fire is not the agent of its cessation.

original: gzhan yang de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de yang gzung du med pa ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun skye ba la grub kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag yod na gzhig par bya ba gzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de yang gzung du med pa ni mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i rgyun skye ba la grub kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is also said that if they existed, the object of destruction would not be apprehended. But that which is not apprehended is established as the arising of a continuum that is a different characteristic.

original: kha ba dang / tshva dang / me dang / tho ba la sogs pa dag yod na /
analyzed: kha ba dang / tshva dang / me dang / tho ba la sogs pa dag yod na /
translated: If snow, salt, fire, a hammer, etc.

original: me tog dang 'bras bu dang / shing dang / bum pa pa sogs pa'i gzugs gzung du med pa ni /
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu dang / shing dang / bum pa pa sogs pa'i gzugs gzung du med pa ni /
translated: exist, the nonapprehension of the form of a flower, fruit, tree, pot, etc.

original: de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyu nyid yin par mi 'grub po //
translated: is not established as the cause of their destruction.

original: gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de ni de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa de ni de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: That which is asserted to be the cause of the destruction of something is not the cause of its destruction,

original: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it has a cause, like the intrinsic nature of fire.

original: yi ge mang por 'gyur ba yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'phro bar mi bya bar skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge mang por 'gyur ba yongs su spang bar 'dod pas 'phro bar mi bya bar skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Because I wish to avoid an excessive number of words, I will not elaborate further. The matter should be investigated in detail.

original: de ltar re zhig 'byung ba 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'byung ba 'jig pa med par yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first, an element does not exist without destruction.

original: 'byung ba ni 'jig pa dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'jig pa dang lhan cig tu yang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Emergence does not exist simultaneously with destruction.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /🔽'byung ba 'jig dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / 'byung ba 'jig dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽How could emergence exist

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽skye ba 'chi dang dus gcig tu //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur // skye ba 'chi dang dus gcig tu //
translated: Simultaneously with destruction?🔽Just as it is illogical for birth

original: @206a * // yod pa nyid du mi rigs bzhin //
analyzed: @206a * // yod pa nyid du mi rigs bzhin //
translated: To exist simultaneously with death.

original: 'dir don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here the meaning is as before.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na /🔽gang dag phan tshun lhan cig gam //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yongs su brtags na / gang dag phan tshun lhan cig gam //
translated: Thus, when this is fully investigated,🔽Emergence and destruction🔽Do not exist as established

original: phan tshun lhan cig ma yin par //🔽'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig ma yin par // 'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: Either as different or non-different.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag go //🔽de dag grub pa rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag go // de dag grub pa rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Here, emergence and destruction do not exist as established either as different or non-different.

original: de dag 'grub pa'i rnam pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag 'grub pa'i rnam pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since their establishment does not exist in any other way, in order to demonstrate that the mode of their establishment is impossible, it is said:

original: de dag 'grub pa ji ltar yod ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag 'grub pa ji ltar yod ces gsungs te /
translated: How could their establishment exist?

original: de dag 'grub pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de dag 'grub pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that their establishment does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason “because it is the cause of emergence and destruction” is not established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin yang /
analyzed: dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid yin yang /
translated: Although things have the nature of destruction,

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: they do not disintegrate as soon as they arise.

original: 'di ltar skyes ma thag tu gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes ma thag tu gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this way, immediately after arising, endurance arises,

original: de'i 'og tu 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: and after that, destruction occurs.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
translated: Destruction does not occur in what is not exhausted.

original: chos mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na skye ba dang 'ching dag bzhin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa gnyis dus gcig tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na skye ba dang 'ching dag bzhin no //
translated: Two incompatible properties do not occur at the same time, just as birth and death do not.

original: ci ste skyes ma thag tu zad par mi 'gyur na ni 'o na de ltar na zad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: ci ste skyes ma thag tu zad par mi 'gyur na ni 'o na de ltar na zad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas /
translated: If it did not cease immediately after arising, then it would not have the nature of cessation.

original: des na kun rdzob tu yang ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir /🔽ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med //
analyzed: des na kun rdzob tu yang ji skad smras pa'i rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir / ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba med //
translated: Therefore, as the opponent describes it, the property to be proven is not established even conventionally.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Also, destruction does not occur in what is not exhausted.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Also,

original: zad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: zad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: Destruction does not exist for that which is perishable.

original: zad par gyur pa'i ngang tshul can //🔽'jig pa dang ldan pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zad par gyur pa'i ngang tshul can // 'jig pa dang ldan pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which has the character of destruction🔽Does not have destruction.

original: der rtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: der rtag pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: That which has the character of destruction does not have destruction, because it would be pointless for it to have destruction again.

original: 'chi ba'i dang tshul can bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dang tshul can bzhin no //
translated: It would be like a dead person.

original: ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med //
analyzed: ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med //
translated: That which is imperishable also does not have destruction.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not have the nature of that.

original: dper na thar pa bzhin pas de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: dper na thar pa bzhin pas de ni gyi na'o //
translated: For example, it is like liberation. Therefore this is incoherent.

original: 'dir smras pa 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here someone might say, emergence and destruction exist,

original: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are properties of things.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de ni dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which does not exist is not a property of a thing,

original: dper na sbal pa'i ze ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbal pa'i ze ba bzhin no //
translated: for example, like the mane of a frog.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni dngos po'i chos yin pas /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni dngos po'i chos yin pas /
translated: But emergence and destruction are properties of things.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore they exist.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te don dam par 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na ni de dngos po zhes brjod par yang rigs par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na ni de dngos po zhes brjod par yang rigs par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If in reality, arising and destruction existed for something, then it would be reasonable to call that a thing.

original: de dag med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag med pas de'i phyir /
translated: But since they do not exist,🔽therefore,

original: 'byung dang 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: without arising and destruction,

original: dngos po yod pa ma @206b yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma @206b yin no //
translated: a thing does not exist.

original: dngos po dang ni 'byung ba dang // 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po dang ni 'byung ba dang // 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning of the reason is that a thing has the nature of arising and destruction.

original: de yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since that does not exist,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
translated: without a thing existing,

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: arising and destruction do not exist.

original: rten med pa kho na'i phyir brten pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rten med pa kho na'i phyir brten pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning of the reason is that without a basis, the dependent is not established.

original: yang na dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: yang na dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: Or, this is another path of refuting the reason, “because it is a quality of a thing.”

original: de la re zhig smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de la re zhig smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: First, this is explained for those who assert that emergence and destruction exist for empty, non-existent, and intrinsically empty things.🔽Emergence and destruction

original: stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: are not tenable for the empty.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are undermined by inference.

original: smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur pa ngo bo nyid mi stong pa la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: smra ba gang dag dngos po yod par gyur pa ngo bo nyid mi stong pa la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod par ston pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: This is explained for those who assert that emergence and destruction exist for existent things that are not empty of intrinsic reality.🔽Emergence and destruction

original: mi stong la yang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi stong la yang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: are not tenable for the non-empty.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba med pa ni de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ba med pa ni de dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they would not possess those and because they are undermined by inference.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, the error of the meaning of the reason not being established and the error of the meaning being contradictory would ensue.

original: / yang na sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: / yang na sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de /
translated: Or, there is another way to refute this:

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gcig pa nyid dam /
translated: Would emergence and destruction be the same or

original: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: different?

original: de la gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Both are untenable.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽Emergence and destruction

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Are not tenable as the same.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na shes pa dang mi shes pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na shes pa dang mi shes pa dag bzhin no //
translated: Because they are incompatible, like, for example, knowledge and ignorance.🔽Emergence and destruction

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Are not tenable as different.

original: dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir gang yang rung ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because they depend on the same thing, like, for example, the two selves of an individual.

original: des kyang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the error of the meaning of the reason not being established and the error of the meaning being contradictory would ensue.

original: ci ste brgya la /
analyzed: ci ste brgya la /
translated: But if, on the other hand,

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
translated: You think, “I see becoming and destruction.”

original: byis pa phal pa'i blos mthong ba ni bden gyi /
analyzed: byis pa phal pa'i blos mthong ba ni bden gyi /
translated: The view of ordinary, foolish beings is true.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: But not ultimately,

original: don dam par 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba la 'jig pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par 'byung ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba la 'jig pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately becoming is refuted and destruction is impossible in becoming.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag /
translated: Becoming and destruction

original: @207a * // gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin //🔽ci ste de dag gti mug gis mthong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: @207a * // gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin // ci ste de dag gti mug gis mthong ba yin gyi /
translated: Are seen due to delusion.🔽If you think, “They are seen due to delusion, but not ultimately,”

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji ltar nges par shes she na /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de ji ltar nges par shes she na /
translated: how do you know that?

original: bshad pa / de yi lan btab zin mod kyi //
analyzed: bshad pa / de yi lan btab zin mod kyi //
translated: We have already responded to this.

original: gal te de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na yang bshad par bya ste /🔽'di ltar don dam par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dngos po la brten pa zhig yod na mthong bar yang 'gyur grang ste /
analyzed: gal te de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na yang bshad par bya ste / 'di ltar don dam par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dngos po la brten pa zhig yod na mthong bar yang 'gyur grang ste /
translated: But if you are not satisfied with just that, we will explain further.🔽Thus, if becoming and destruction ultimately existed in dependence on things, they would be seen.

original: de la dngos po dngos po las skye ba'am /
analyzed: de la dngos po dngos po las skye ba'am /
translated: But they are not seen.

original: dngos po med pa dngos po las skye ba'am /🔽dngos po dngos po med pa las skye ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos po las skye ba'am / dngos po dngos po med pa las skye ba'am /
translated: An entity does not arise from an entity.🔽An entity does not arise from a nonentity.

original: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: A nonentity does not arise from a nonentity.

original: de la re zhig don dam par /
analyzed: de la re zhig don dam par /
translated: First, in reality,

original: dngos po dngos po las mi skye //
analyzed: dngos po dngos po las mi skye //
translated: An entity does not arise from an entity.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an entity, like a sprout, for example.

original: ci ste skye ba'i snga rol na ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste skye ba'i snga rol na ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if it does not exist prior to arising,

original: phyis 'byung ba'i ming gis dngos po zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i ming gis dngos po zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: then it is called an entity because it arises later.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even so,

original: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
translated: A nonentity does not arise from an entity.

original: myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las mi skye ste /🔽skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: myu gu zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa 'bru'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las mi skye ste / skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: A nonentity called a sprout does not arise from an entity that has the characteristic of a seed,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because it does not exist prior to arising, or because it is inexpressible, like something else, for example.🔽Or,

original: yang na / dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na / dngos med dngos las mi skye'o // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A nonentity does not arise from an entity.

original: med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: ci ste bum pa med bzhin du //
analyzed: ci ste bum pa med bzhin du //
translated: If, on the other hand, the pot is not present,

original: tho bas snun pa las byung bar 'gyur ba des ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: tho bas snun pa las byung bar 'gyur ba des ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: and it arises from the hammer striking it, then it is not ascertained.

original: ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is not ascertained,

original: bum pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyang phyogs su byas pas /
analyzed: bum pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa bkag pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyang phyogs su byas pas /
translated: because the arising and ceasing of the pot is refuted, and that itself is taken as the subject,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no counter-position.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
translated: A non-entity does not arise from an entity,

original: skyon bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faults have been explained.

original: yang na dngos po med pa ni dngos po'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na dngos po med pa ni dngos po'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, an entity does not arise from a non-entity,

original: ma nges pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not ascertained, for example, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In that way,

original: dngos med dngos med mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos med dngos med mi skye'o //
translated: A non-entity does not arise from a non-entity,

original: rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is undermined by inference and by what is renowned.

original: gzhan yang / bdag las sam gzhan las sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang / bdag las sam gzhan las sam /
translated: Moreover, does it arise from itself, from another,

original: gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gnyi ga las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: If you say that things arise from both self and other,

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: then in response to that,

original: dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
translated: Things do not arise from self,

original: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor do they arise from other.

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
translated: Arising from both self and other

original: yod min ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yod min ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Does not exist. Why is that?

original: de ltar dang po nyid du rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar dang po nyid du rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: This has been extensively explained already.

original: 'o na de ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba ni smros shig / skye bar mi @207b 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba ni smros shig / skye bar mi @207b 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: Now tell us, how could they arise? The meaning of the statement “They could not arise” is this:

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since arising and destruction do not exist in reality,

original: gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi rtsa ba'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: the root of your argument is not established.

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: In reality,

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //🔽rtag dang chad par lta ba ni //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs na // rtag dang chad par lta ba ni //
translated: If you assert that things exist,

original: thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: You will incur the views of eternalism and nihilism.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dngos de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos de ni /
translated: Because those things

original: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: Would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: de la rtag pa ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la rtag pa ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it is permanent, then it follows that it is the view of permanence because it does not disintegrate.

original: mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is impermanent, then it follows that it is the view of annihilation because it disintegrates.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
translated: Even though you accept that things exist,

original: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
translated: it is not annihilation and it is not permanence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar /
translated: Why is that? Because

original: 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
translated: the continuum of the arising and disintegration of effects and causes is existence.

original: de la rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir chad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir chad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that regard, because the effect arises from the cause that is ceasing, it is not annihilation.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa na rgyu 'gags pa'i phyir rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa na rgyu 'gags pa'i phyir rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the effect arises when the cause ceases, it is not permanence.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi //
translated: Here we say:🔽If the continuum of the arising and disintegration of effects and causes

original: rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //🔽'jig la'ang skye ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na // 'jig la'ang skye ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: were existence,

original: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then it follows that the cause would be annihilated🔽because there is no arising in disintegration.

original: zad pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir sa bon tshig pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zad pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir sa bon tshig pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because there is no arising from destruction, like a burned seed.

original: ji ste sngar /
analyzed: ji ste sngar /
translated: Previously, you accepted:

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on something🔽Is not that,

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //🔽de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //🔽de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min // de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir // de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Nor is it different.

original: zhes khas blangs la /
analyzed: zhes khas blangs la /
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: da ni rtag pa dang chad par thal bar skyon 'dogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: da ni rtag pa dang chad par thal bar skyon 'dogs pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Now, you say that the fault of the consequence of eternalism and nihilism is not correct.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: der ni tha snyad pa'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni chad pa yang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin par bstan la /
analyzed: der ni tha snyad pa'i de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni chad pa yang ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin par bstan la /
translated: because there, the definition of conventional reality is taught to be neither annihilation nor eternalism.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni skye ba med pa kho na'i phyir rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni skye ba med pa kho na'i phyir rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Ultimate reality is only non-arisen, and therefore it is not subject to the faults of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de ni snying po ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni snying po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is not the essence.

original: grangs can dag na re rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas /
analyzed: grangs can dag na re rgyu nyid 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas /
translated: The Sāṃkhyas say: Since the cause itself transforms into the nature of the effect,

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang /
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang /
translated: although we accept that things exist,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: the faults of eternalism and nihilism do not arise.

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That also is not good,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / de dgag pa rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / de dgag pa rgyas par bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no inference to demonstrate the existence of transformation, and because the refutation of that has already been extensively demonstrated.

original: yongs su ma gyur pa yongs su gyur par rtog na yang /
analyzed: yongs su ma gyur pa yongs su gyur par rtog na yang /
translated: If you imagine that what is not transformed is transformed,

original: yongs su ma gyur pa ni yongs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su ma gyur pa ni yongs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: that which is not transformed is not transformed,

original: yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir @208a * //
analyzed: yongs su ma gyur pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir @208a * //
translated: because it is not transformed, like the horn of an ass.

original: ro ; / bag la zha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan ldog pa ni bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro ; / bag la zha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan ldog pa ni bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cessation of a phenomenon that has the characteristic of being latent is not possible to demonstrate, and the refutation of transformation has already been demonstrated.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na /
translated: if the intrinsic reality of things existed,🔽then,

original: de la / dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: de la / dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If things had intrinsic reality,

original: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: It would not be tenable that they become nonexistent.

original: skyes pa ni dngos po yod pa yin la /
analyzed: skyes pa ni dngos po yod pa yin la /
translated: That which is born is an existent thing.

original: zhig pa ni dngos po med pa yin pa de yang mthong bas /
analyzed: zhig pa ni dngos po med pa yin pa de yang mthong bas /
translated: And since that disintegration is seen to be a non-thing,

original: de'i phyir dngos po ngo bo nyid med par grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ngo bo nyid med par grub ste /
translated: it is established that things lack entityness.

original: de skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This is because they are phenomena that arise and cease.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
translated: at the time of nirvana, there is annihilation,

original: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
analyzed: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
translated: because the continuum of existence is completely pacified.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tham rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i lan gdab dka'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tham rkyen phyi ma med pas mi skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i lan gdab dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to respond to the argument that just as the mind and mental factors of an arhat do not arise due to the absence of future conditions, so too the continuum of existence would not arise due to the absence of future conditions.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang bla ste /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang bla ste /
translated: If you think, “Even if there were annihilation at the time of nirvana, that would be fine,

original: srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pas skyon med par sems na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun gyi dus na chad pa de med pas skyon med par sems na /
translated: but since there is no annihilation at the time of the continuum of existence, there is no fault,”

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good.

original: sngar srid pa'i rgyun nyid la chad pa'i skyon bstan zin pas chad par lta ba'i phyir dang / phyis chad pa yang thar pa'i 'gags yin pas /
analyzed: sngar srid pa'i rgyun nyid la chad pa'i skyon bstan zin pas chad par lta ba'i phyir dang / phyis chad pa yang thar pa'i 'gags yin pas /
translated: Previously, the error of annihilation was already explained in relation to the continuum of existence itself, and because you would have the view of annihilation, later annihilation would be the cessation of liberation.

original: skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not without fault.

original: ci ste de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na gzhan yang nyon cig /'di la da ltar gyi srid pa'i mjug gi srid pa ni srid pa tham zhes bya la /
analyzed: ci ste de tsam gyis kyang yongs su mi mgu na gzhan yang nyon cig /'di la da ltar gyi srid pa'i mjug gi srid pa ni srid pa tham zhes bya la /
translated: But if you are not satisfied even with that much, listen to something else. Here, the existence at the end of the present existence is called the final existence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i sems pa skye ba'i dang po ni srid pa dang po yin pas /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i sems pa skye ba'i dang po ni srid pa dang po yin pas /
translated: The first intention of the future existence is the first existence.

original: de la / tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: de la / tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the thesis is stated:🔽The final existence that has ceased

original: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //🔽'gags pa'i chos ni 'gags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o // 'gags pa'i chos ni 'gags pa nyid yin no //
translated: Does not link with the first existence.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /🔽'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de / 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The final existence that has ceased does not link with the first existence of the future,🔽because it has ceased,

original: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: or because it is the final existence,

original: dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no //
translated: like the final existence of an arhat that has ceased.

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar dam bcas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because you assert that the final state of existence that has ceased links with the first moment of the next life,🔽then that is illogical.

original: ma 'gags pa yang rgyu srid pa tha ma ma nyams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yang rgyu srid pa tha ma ma nyams pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that there is no error because you assert that the final state of existence that has ceased links with the first moment of existence in the future,

original: skyon 'og nas 'byung ba lta bur 'gyur bas skyon med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon 'og nas 'byung ba lta bur 'gyur bas skyon med pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so, because the error that will be explained below would ensue.

original: 'di ltar / tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
translated: The final state of existence that has not ceased

original: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dang por sbyor mi 'gyur //
translated: would not link with the first moment of existence.

original: 'dir yang de ni dam bca' pa @208b nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de ni dam bca' pa @208b nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Here, that is posited as the thesis.

original: ma 'gags pa'i chos ni ma 'gags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa'i chos ni ma 'gags pa nyid yin no //
translated: A nonceased phenomenon is just nonceased.

original: de'i phyir 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir yang rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par srid pa tha ma ma 'gags pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: Therefore, here also the inference is: The final state of existence that has not ceased ultimately does not link with the first moment of existence in the future,

original: ma 'gags pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi srid pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar gyi srid pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not nonceased, like the present state of existence.

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags bzhin pa ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the present state of existence of the dying person links with the first moment of the next existence,

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /🔽gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te / gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
translated: that is not good.🔽If the last moment of existence

original: dang po skye bar gyur na ni //
analyzed: dang po skye bar gyur na ni //
translated: were to link with the first moment of existence,

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
translated: then the dying would be one,

original: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur //🔽'gag bzhin pa dang ; skye bzhin pa dag ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur // 'gag bzhin pa dang ; skye bzhin pa dag ni tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the one being born would be another.🔽Because the dying and the one being born are different.

original: rgyud tha dad pa'i srid pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa'i srid pa bzhin no //
translated: It would be like two existences that are not causally connected.

original: gal te de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you accept that, then there is no error.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: lhas byin gyi srid pa tha ma ni lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi srid pa tha ma ni lhas byin gyi srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: The last moment of existence of Devadatta does not link with the first moment of existence of Devadatta,

original: de las gzhan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi srid pa tha ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi srid pa tha ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is not Devadatta, just as the last moment of existence of Yajñadatta is not.

original: gzhan yang 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dag ni 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gags pa dang / ma 'gags pa dag ni 'gag bzhin pa nyid yin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is illogical that that which has ceased and that which has not ceased would be in the process of ceasing.

original: gal te 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that that which is in the process of ceasing is that which is about to cease,

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: that is illogical.

original: de'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we have already responded to this.

original: de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang skye bzhin pa nyid yin par mi rigs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye bzhin pa yang skye bzhin pa nyid yin par mi rigs pas /
translated: In the same way, it is illogical that that which is in the process of arising is in the process of arising.🔽Therefore:

original: de'i phyir / gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin pa //
translated: If that which is in the process of ceasing

original: lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
analyzed: lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
translated: and that which is in the process of arising do not make mutual contact,

original: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽phung po gang la'ang 'chi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / phung po gang la'ang 'chi 'gyur ba //
translated: how could they be connected?🔽In that case,🔽it would follow that one would die in one place

original: der mi skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der mi skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: and be born in another.

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: gcig la dus gcig tu mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig tu mi mthun pa'i bdag nyid gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for a single thing to have two incompatible natures at one time.

original: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces srid pa tha ma srid pa dang po dang / 'di ltar nyid mtshams sbyor ro zhes brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: yang na gang dag 'di skad ces srid pa tha ma srid pa dang po dang / 'di ltar nyid mtshams sbyor ro zhes brjod par mi nus mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, you may say, “One cannot say that the final existence connects with the first existence.

original: 'on kyang re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba mthong pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig srid pa dang po'i skye ba mthong pas /
translated: But since the first birth of existence is seen,🔽it will arise from that from which it is logical.

original: de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de yang gang las rigs par 'gyur ba de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: This is explained for those who say this.🔽It has been explained that it is not tenable that the final moment of existence

original: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang // ma 'gags pa dag srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad do zhes mi bstan zin to //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang // ma 'gags pa dag srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad do zhes mi bstan zin to //
translated: ceases or does not cease and links with the first moment of existence.

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the final moment of existence that is ceasing links with the first moment of existence,

original: de la @209a * //
analyzed: de la @209a * //
translated: then in that case

original: yang rjes su dpag pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: yang rjes su dpag pa bstan zin to //
translated: it has been explained that it is illogical.

original: yang na srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ni srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: yang na srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ni srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: Or, the final moment of existence that is ceasing does not link with the first moment of existence

original: 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i sems tha ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is not ceasing, just like the final mind of an arhat.

original: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Therefore, in this way, as it has been explained,

original: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
translated: are not connected,

original: 'o na de cir 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na de cir 'gyur zhe na //
translated: then what?

original: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur pa //
analyzed: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur pa //
translated: In whatever component the death state occurs,

original: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: there the birth state would occur.

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba las skye bar 'dod na de dang / nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad par yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba las skye bar 'dod na de dang / nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'thad par yang bstan zin to //
translated: If you assert that the first birth state arises from the linking consciousness, then it has been demonstrated that linking is untenable.🔽Therefore, as explained,

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa'i dbang gis /
translated: Thus the continuum of existence

original: de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //🔽srid pa'i rgyun ni mi rigs na //🔽dus gsum dag tu gang med pa //
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang // srid pa'i rgyun ni mi rigs na // dus gsum dag tu gang med pa //
translated: is illogical in the three times.🔽How could that which does not exist

original: de ni ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
translated: in the three times be a continuum of existence?

original: zhes mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Thus the conclusion is that

original: de ltar srid pa tha ma srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar srid pa tha ma srid pa dang po dang / nyid mtshams sbyor ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: because the final existence and the first birth state and linking are untenable,

original: rgyun la chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tshig ni don dam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyun la chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tshig ni don dam pa ma yin la /
translated: the statement “The continuum of existence is not interrupted and is not permanent” is not ultimate.

original: khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it does not contradict what has been accepted.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows: In the first chapter, the opponent said, “Time definitely exists ultimately,🔽because it is the cause of origination and destruction.”

original: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas dus ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas dus ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the fault in the reason has been stated, time is not established.

original: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, origination and destruction are shown to be essenceless.

original: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti,

original: gzugs la 'chi ba'am skye ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs la 'chi ba'am skye ba med do //
translated: form is neither born nor does it die.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am skye ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am skye ba med do //
translated: Similarly, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are neither born nor do they die.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'chi ba 'am /
translated: Form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness are neither born🔽nor do they die.

original: skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //🔽slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: skye ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The statement “That which is non-arisen is the perfection of wisdom” and so on is established.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: The master Bhāviveka’s Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on Nāgārjuna’s Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is called “Examination of Becoming and Destruction.”

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-first chapter.

original: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas don dam @209b par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsal ba'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: // / da ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas don dam @209b par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsal ba'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu gnyis pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in order to refute the specific discordant aspects of emptiness, in order to remove the ultimate, the twenty-second chapter is begun.

original: mdo sde pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'dir smras pa /🔽don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dag gis 'dir smras pa / don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here the Sautrāntikas and Vaibhāṣikas say,🔽“Ultimately, things such as form do exist essentially,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bzhin no //
translated: because they are things, like, for example, the body of the Tathāgata.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sems kyi skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su skyes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku don dam pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sems kyi skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su skyes pa rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba'i ye shes kyi skad cig ma'o //
translated: The ultimate reality of the Tathāgata’s dharma body is the moment of transcendent wisdom called “the path of liberation,” which arises immediately after the mind’s moment of vajra-like concentration.

original: gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa yang de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku kun rdzob pa yang de'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And the conventional reality of the Tathāgata’s form body is its basis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the “Tathāgata’s body.”

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par gzugs la sogs pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the reason stated above, ultimately things such as form do indeed exist by their own intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo gros kyis dngos po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo gros kyis dngos po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar 'dod na ni grub pa la sgrub pa nyid yin no //
translated: If you assert that things and the Tathāgata exist by their own intrinsic reality by means of a cognition that belongs to the conventional level, then this is just a proof of what is already established for us.

original: 'on te don dam par na ni re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa nyid je dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te don dam par na ni re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa nyid je dpyad par bya ste /
translated: But if you assert this by means of a cognition that belongs to the ultimate level, then first of all, the Tathāgata himself must be investigated.

original: 'di la ye shes kyang phung po'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir phung po'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bkag pas de yang bkag par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la ye shes kyang phung po'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir phung po'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bkag pas de yang bkag par 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: Since consciousness is included among the aggregates, the Tathāgata who has the nature of the aggregates is refuted by this refutation, and thus:

original: sku min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sku min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is not the body, etc.

original: de la sku'i don ni phung po'i don to //
analyzed: de la sku'i don ni phung po'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning of “body” is the meaning of “aggregate.”

original: phung po rnams ci zhig ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: phung po rnams ci zhig ma yin zhe na /
translated: What are the aggregates not?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor brjod par bya ste /
translated: The term “Tathāgata” should be analyzed.

original: tshig gi don gsal bar 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //🔽phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig gi don gsal bar 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro // phung po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because it is a term that is asserted to clarify the meaning of the words.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The aggregates are not the Tathāgata means that they are not the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the statement of the thesis.

original: phung po rnams kyi chos ni phung po nyid dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang / byas pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi chos ni phung po nyid dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid dang / byas pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The properties of the aggregates are the aggregates themselves, the properties of origination and destruction, and the property of being produced, etc.

original: de ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: That is the reason.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so so'i skye bo'i phung po la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis so so'i skye bo'i phung po la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The example is the aggregates, etc., of ordinary people, by the power of that.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here the inference is: ultimately the aggregates are not the Tathagata,

original: phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na /🔽so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams bzhin nam /
analyzed: phung po nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na / so so'i skye bo'i phung po rnams bzhin nam /
translated: because they are aggregates, because they are the properties of origination and destruction,🔽just as, for example, the aggregates of an ordinary person are,

original: phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du byas @210a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa dag bzhin no // de bzhin du byas @210a * //
translated: or just as external earth, etc., are.

original: pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should say that it is because of the reasons of being produced, etc.🔽Or else, ultimately the aggregates are not the Tathagata,🔽because they are the aggregates,🔽because they are the properties of origination and destruction,🔽because they are the properties of being produced,

original: yang na don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par phung po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
