translated: because they are the properties of being compounded,🔽because they are the properties of being dependent originations,🔽because they are the properties of having causes,🔽because they are the properties of having conditions,🔽because they are the properties of being impermanent,🔽because they are the properties of being painful,🔽because they are the properties of being empty,🔽because they are the properties of being insubstantial,🔽because they are the properties of being internal,🔽because they are the properties of being external,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external phenomena,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external compounded phenomena,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external uncompounded phenomena,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external compounded and uncompounded phenomena,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external phenomena that are neither compounded nor uncompounded,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external phenomena that are neither compounded nor not compounded,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external phenomena that are neither compounded nor not compounded and neither uncompounded nor not uncompounded,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external phenomena that are neither compounded nor not compounded and neither uncompounded nor not uncompounded and neither compounded nor uncompounded,🔽because they are the properties of being internal and external phenomena that are neither compounded nor not compounded and neither uncompounded nor not uncompounded and neither compounded nor uncompounded and neither compounded nor uncompounded and neither compounded nor uncompounded and

original: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag gi rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa dag gi rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their production is refuted and because the substantial reality of form, etc. is refuted.

original: yang na ye shes 'ba' zhig phyogs su byas nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ye shes 'ba' zhig phyogs su byas nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Or else, making consciousness alone the subject, it should be said:

original: don dam par ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ye shes ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is not ultimately consciousness,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na so so'i skye bo'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because he is subject to origination and destruction and because he is a form of knowledge, just like the consciousness of an ordinary person.

original: mu stegs can dag ni phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par bsams nas /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag ni phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par bsams nas /
translated: The tīrthikas think that the Tathāgata is other than the aggregates,

original: bdag tu sgrub par 'dod pas de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /🔽sku las gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: bdag tu sgrub par 'dod pas de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de / sku las gzhan ma yin /
translated: and they want to prove a self. Therefore, this is explained for them:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is not other than the body,🔽because he is not perceived when the body is perceived.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag dgag pa bzhin du de yang bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / phung po rnams las gzhan pa'i bdag dgag pa bzhin du de yang bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no inference to prove the existence of a Tathāgata other than those aggregates, and because he is refuted in the same way that a self is refuted as being different from the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par ma grub pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan yin par ma grub pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: The Tathāgata is not established as being different from the aggregates.

original: de la sku med ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de la sku med ces gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said that he does not have a body.

original: ji ltar gangs la sman dag yod pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gangs la sman dag yod pa de ltar ro //
translated: Just as there is medicine in the snow mountains,

original: der de med /
analyzed: der de med /
translated: but there is no snow mountain in medicine.🔽Just as there is a lion in a forest with lions,

original: ji ltar shing ldon pa'i nags tshal dag la sing ge yod pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shing ldon pa'i nags tshal dag la sing ge yod pa de ltar ro //
translated: but there is no forest with lions in a lion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have a body.🔽Just as a rich man has wealth,

original: ji ltar nor can nor dang ldan pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nor can nor dang ldan pa de ltar ro //
translated: but wealth does not have a rich man.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa lngas yongs su brtags na gang mi srid pa'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam pa lngas yongs su brtags na gang mi srid pa'i /
translated: Therefore, when examined in these five ways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: what Tathāgata is there?

original: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis yongs su brtags na /
analyzed: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis yongs su brtags na /
translated: When examined by the proofs that have been taught,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to /
translated: The meaning of the words is that the so-called Tathagata does not exist.

original: dper na chom rkun pa nyid la mngon par brtson pa dag la yongs su brtags pa na gang yang de yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir chom rkun pa gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no //🔽yang dper na phung po rnams ma gcogs  par skyes bu'am /
analyzed: dper na chom rkun pa nyid la mngon par brtson pa dag la yongs su brtags pa na gang yang de yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir chom rkun pa gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no // yang dper na phung po rnams ma gcogs  par skyes bu'am /
translated: For example, when one examines those who are engaged in banditry, it is not tenable that any of them is a bandit, so it is said, “What is a bandit?”

original: dbang phyug cis bya ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug cis bya ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Again, for example, it is said, “What is a person or a lord without the aggregates?”

original: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma grub pas sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ma grub pas sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod do //
translated: So, since the Tathagata is not established in that way, the example is faulty in that it does not correspond to the probandum.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas grub pa'i phyir /
translated: “The Tathagata is established in dependence on the aggregates.

original: kho bo cag la sgrub pa des mi gnod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag la sgrub pa des mi gnod do //
translated: Therefore that proof does not undermine us.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
translated: Here we say:🔽If you assert that the Buddha

original: brten @210b nas gdags par 'dod na /
analyzed: brten @210b nas gdags par 'dod na /
translated: Is imputed in dependence on the aggregates,

original: 'o na de lta na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na /
translated: Then in that case,

original: ngo bo nyid las med /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las med /
translated: It does not exist by intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not exist by intrinsic reality, and he does not exist substantially.

original: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: phyogs kyi chos ni khong na yod do //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos ni khong na yod do //
translated: The property of the position is implicit.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis mgal me'i 'khor lo dang bum pa dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis mgal me'i 'khor lo dang bum pa dag bzhin no //
translated: The example is like a firebrand wheel and a pot, respectively, by the power of that.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni /
translated: Here is the inference:

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata does not exist by intrinsic reality and does not exist substantially in the ultimate,

original: gdags par bya ba'i phyir dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin nam /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba'i phyir dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin nam /
translated: because he is an object of designation, like a firebrand wheel,

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: or because he does not exist substantially, like a pot.

original: mi mkhas pa kha cig 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa kha cig 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some unwise person might say:

original: gal te re zhig mtshan nyid las //
analyzed: gal te re zhig mtshan nyid las //
translated: If, on the one hand, the Tathāgata

original: gang zhig blo gzhan sel ba la //
analyzed: gang zhig blo gzhan sel ba la //
translated: is the exclusion of another cognition,

original: de yi blo med bum chu bzhin //
analyzed: de yi blo med bum chu bzhin //
translated: then he is not a cognition, like a pot or water.

original: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //
translated: He exists conventionally.

original: don dam yod pa don gzhan no //
analyzed: don dam yod pa don gzhan no //
translated: Ultimate existence is different.

original: zhes 'byung ba des rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni de kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba des rdzas su yod pa nyid 'gog par byed na ni de kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
translated: If this passage refutes substantial existence, it does not contradict us.

original: 'di ltar bum pa zhig pa dang / blo gzhan sel ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa zhig pa dang / blo gzhan sel ba na /
translated: For when a pot is destroyed or when another cognition is eliminated,

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs dag la de dag gi blo yod pas /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i gzugs dag la de dag gi blo yod pas /
translated: the cognition of those things exists in relation to other forms.

original: de dag rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rdzas su yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore those things are substantially existent.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: rdzas su yod pa la mtshan nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa la mtshan nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because substantial existence is undermined by its definition.

original: gang zhig pa de rdzas su yod pa la gnod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig pa de rdzas su yod pa la gnod pa nyid do //
translated: That which is destroyed undermines substantial existence.

original: de'i blo med pa zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir gang ma zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med do //
analyzed: de'i blo med pa zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir gang ma zhig pa de la yang de'i blo med do //
translated: Because it is ascertained that the cognition of that does not exist, the cognition of that does not exist in that which is not destroyed.

original: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gzhan dag sel ba la gzhan sel ba zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa gzhan dag sel ba la gzhan sel ba zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is asserted that the elimination of other things that possess appropriation is the elimination of other.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: don dam par bum pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bum pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: A pot is substantially existent ultimately.

original: shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin te /
analyzed: shes bya yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs bzhin te /
translated: Because it is an object of knowledge, like form.

original: shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes par bya ba yin pas rdzas de shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The object to be known is the object of knowledge, which is synonymous with the object of understanding.

original: mtshan nyid las shes par bya ba'i skad kyi byings dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las shes par bya ba'i skad kyi byings dag ni rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the verbal roots that signify the object of knowledge are derived from the verbal root for understanding.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag kyang rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub pas /
translated: And it is established that such things as pots exist substantially.

original: bum pa dang / chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khungs kyang med do //
analyzed: bum pa dang / chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i khungs kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no source for the statement, “Like pots and water, they exist conventionally.”

original: de ni dbang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dbang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not a sense faculty,

original: don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs rdzas su yod pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir dpe med do //
translated: because form is not established as existing substantially ultimately, so there is no example.

original: tha snyad du ni mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad btags par yod pa nyid yin yang /🔽gang zhig kyang de'i blo mi 'jig pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha snyad du ni mtshan nyid ji skad smras pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad btags par yod pa nyid yin yang / gang zhig kyang de'i blo mi 'jig pa de ni rdzas su yod pa yin la /
translated: Conventionally, all things are imputedly existent, just as their characteristics are described.🔽However, that which does not destroy the conception of that thing is substantially existent.

original: gang zhig pa na de'i blo med pa de @211a * //
analyzed: gang zhig pa na de'i blo med pa de @211a * //
translated: That which does destroy the conception of that thing is

original: ni btags par yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ni btags par yod pa yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and the Tathāgata is posited as imputedly existent.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis shes bya yin yang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis shes bya yin yang /
translated: Although the nonexistent is an object of knowledge in the manner of nonexistence,

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: since it does not exist substantially, it is not ascertained.

original: de rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtog na ni grags pa dang / lung gis gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no /🔽// / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu drug pa /
analyzed: de rdzas su yod pa nyid du rtog na ni grags pa dang / lung gis gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no / // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu drug pa /
translated: If you imagine it to exist substantially, then it would be undermined by what is renowned and scripture, so that is not correct.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: phung po lnga ni gdags par bya ba yin yang ngo bo nyid yod pa yin la /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni gdags par bya ba yin yang ngo bo nyid yod pa yin la /
translated: Although the five aggregates are to be imputed, they exist intrinsically.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa'i brjod par bya ba yin pas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa de'i ngo bo nyid bcos ma ma yin pa gang yin pa blo la nges par bzhag nas /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa'i brjod par bya ba yin pas / de bzhin gshegs pa de'i ngo bo nyid bcos ma ma yin pa gang yin pa blo la nges par bzhag nas /
translated: Moreover, since the Tathāgata is the object of imputation,🔽having ascertained in the mind that the intrinsic reality of the Tathāgata is unfabricated,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med do zhes sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: if you prove that the Tathāgata is intrinsically natureless, then that is proving what is already established.

original: phung po rnams byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates are produced.

original: 'on te gzhan las byung ba'i dngos po rgyu dang / rkyen gzhan dag las byung zhing /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan las byung ba'i dngos po rgyu dang / rkyen gzhan dag las byung zhing /
translated: But if you refute the entity that arises from another, which arises from other causes and conditions,

original: skyes pa bdag nyid thob pa gang yin pa 'gog par byed na ni /
analyzed: skyes pa bdag nyid thob pa gang yin pa 'gog par byed na ni /
translated: and which is obtained by itself when it arises,🔽then there is no example, because all entities have an essence that has the characteristic of arising from another.

original: 'o na des na dpe med de dngos po thams cad ni gzhan las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa yin pas 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo'i gzugs la sogs pa /
analyzed: 'o na des na dpe med de dngos po thams cad ni gzhan las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa yin pas 'di ltar kho bo cag ni mgal me'i 'khor lo'i gzugs la sogs pa /
translated: Thus, we maintain that the form of a fire wheel, etc.,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gang dag yin pa de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa kho na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gang dag yin pa de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa kho na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: which are the objects of the nonconceptual eye consciousness, definitely have an essence.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: 'dir mgal me'i 'khor lo nyid ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir mgal me'i 'khor lo nyid ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: because here the fire wheel itself is mistaken.

original: ngos dang steng dang / 'og ni nam mkha'i cha dang / mgal me la 'khor lo'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang / mgal me'i gzugs la sogs pa dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: ngos dang steng dang / 'og ni nam mkha'i cha dang / mgal me la 'khor lo'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dang / mgal me'i gzugs la sogs pa dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The arising of the form of a firebrand and so on is refuted, and substantial existence is refuted.

original: de de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang /
analyzed: de de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang /
translated: In the same way, the objects of eye consciousness and so on, such as form,

original: mig gi lta ba dgag pa bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi lta ba dgag pa bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are refuted in the same way that seeing with the eye is refuted.🔽How can that which does not exist

original: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //
translated: through its own intrinsic reality

original: de gzhan dngos las ga la yod //
analyzed: de gzhan dngos las ga la yod //
translated: exist as another?

original: bdag gi dngos po'i dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that the existence of one thing as another is established in dependence on the other.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:🔽That which is imputed in dependence on

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
translated: another

original: gdags pa'o // de bdag nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gdags pa'o // de bdag nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: is not tenable as itself.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because it is to be imputed in dependence on other things,

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin te /
translated: like an illusory person.🔽That is to say, it has no essence, it is essenceless.

original: @211b de ni bdag nyid med de ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ltar / gang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
analyzed: @211b de ni bdag nyid med de ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar / gang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
translated: Thus, it says:🔽How could that which has no essence

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
translated: Become a tathagata?

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i dpe zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par sgrub pa'i dpe zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the example that proves that things exist essentially is incomplete.

original: de'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon de nyid yod do //
translated: Therefore, the error of the example being incomplete still applies.

original: yang na pha rol po dag 'di skad ces ngo bo nyid las ma grub tu zin kyang /
analyzed: yang na pha rol po dag 'di skad ces ngo bo nyid las ma grub tu zin kyang /
translated: Or, the opponent might say that even though it is not established from its own nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po las grub pas dpe nyid grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar grub bo zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po las grub pas dpe nyid grub pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar grub bo zhes zer ba la /
translated: since it is established from the nature of something else, the example is established, and so it is established that things exist essentially.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, it may be explained as follows:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If it has no essence,

original: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it exist in another?

original: ngo bo nyid ma grub pa kho na'i phyir gzhan du 'dod pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma grub pa kho na'i phyir gzhan du 'dod pa rgyu dang rkyen rnams med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not intrinsically exist, otherness is not asserted, because causes and conditions do not exist.

original: de dag las byung ba'i gzhan gyi dngos po can de yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i gzhan gyi dngos po can de yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, that which is other than them, which is produced from them, does not exist.

original: de'i phyir dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe'i skyon de nyid yod do //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the example still exists.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin kyang /
translated: Even though the intrinsic reality of the Tathāgata is not ascertained,

original: yod yod pa'i phyir dpe grub pas skyon med do //
analyzed: yod yod pa'i phyir dpe grub pas skyon med do //
translated: the example is established because it exists. Therefore there is no fault.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here the reply is:

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs de bzhin gshegs te gang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs de bzhin gshegs te gang //
translated: Apart from intrinsic reality and otherness, what is the Tathāgata?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: That does not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni don dam par yod pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: Because apart from intrinsic reality and otherness, an entity that ultimately exists is not established. Therefore there is a fault.

original: gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is to be designated in dependence on the aggregates.

original: de ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: He is not to be described as identical with or different from them. Therefore, he is not the intrinsic reality of the aggregates,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor is he the intrinsic reality of something else.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa grub pas rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa grub pas rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the Tathāgata is established, things are not established as lacking intrinsic reality by the inference that you have presented.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: In the ultimate, is the Tathāgata or

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na /
translated: that which is not the Tathāgata to be designated in dependence on the aggregates of the Tathāgata?

original: de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: If the Tathāgata is the Tathāgata, then it is meaningless that he depends on them.🔽But if the Tathāgata is not the Tathāgata,

original: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na ni de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na ni de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case,

original: gal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: If the Tathāgata does not depend on the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //🔽snga rol na bdag nyid gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na // snga rol na bdag nyid gzhan gyis so //
translated: If there were any Tathāgata,🔽he would be prior to them.

original: de ni de gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni de gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
translated: But he would be dependent on them,🔽and he would be derived from them.

original: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag / gal te de ltar 'gyur zhe @212a * //🔽na ; / phung po rnams la ma brten par //
analyzed: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag / gal te de ltar 'gyur zhe @212a * // na ; / phung po rnams la ma brten par //
translated: If you think that he would be like that,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
translated: there is no Tathāgata at all🔽who is not dependent on the aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without appropriation, the Tathāgata is not established.

original: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
translated: He who does not exist without that

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: is not the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur//
analyzed: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur//
translated: How could he appropriate it?

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: He does not appropriate the aggregates of the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because he is not the Tathāgata, just like anyone else.

original: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pas /
translated: But if he is not the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams nye bar blangs nas /
translated: how could he appropriate the aggregates of the Tathāgata?

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing ;
translated: and “I will become a Tathāgata.”

original: 'di skad ces /🔽gal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: 'di skad ces / gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: And they say,🔽If the Tathāgata does not depend on the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //🔽de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med // de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
translated: Then he does not exist at all.🔽He would be dependent later,

original: brten nas de la 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes kyang zer na /
analyzed: brten nas de la 'gyur ba yin // zhes kyang zer na /
translated: And he would come to depend on that.

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To them it should be said:

original: ci ste de phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste de phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: If the Tathāgata is the entity of the aggregates,

original: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: or if he is the entity of something else,

original: de la gal te phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni phyogs de'i lan btab zin to //
analyzed: de la gal te phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni phyogs de'i lan btab zin to //
translated: if he is the entity of the aggregates, then the response to that position has already been given.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ni de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if he is the entity of something else, then he does not exist,

original: phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: phung po'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because he is not the entity of the aggregates, just like, for example,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: the horn of a donkey.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
translated: That which does not exist without depending on the aggregates

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: is not the characteristic of the aggregates.

original: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
translated: How could it be the appropriator?

original: des nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: des nye bar len par mi byed pa nyid de /
translated: It does not appropriate because it does not exist,

original: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: like a sky flower.

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa dag nye bar len par mi byed de /
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i snga rol na med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye bar len pa dag nye bar len par mi byed de /
translated: The Tathāgata does not appropriate the appropriated aggregates prior to his arising because he does not exist prior to his arising.

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: He does not exist prior to his arising,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //🔽gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir snga phyi mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa bzhin no // gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir snga phyi mi 'thad pas /
translated: like a non-Tathāgata.

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason “because he does not exist prior to his arising” is not established, because it is untenable that the Tathāgata existed prior to his arising, since samsara has no beginning or end and the Tathāgata cannot be said to be either the same as or different from that,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes par bya ste 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i snga rol na med pa nyid do zhes bya bar shes par bya ste 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: That is not good. It should be understood that the Tathāgata who is the object of a mind that belongs to the conventional truth does not exist prior to arising, because he is conditioned, like a pot, for example.

original: de ltar tha snyad du med par grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i phyir @212b dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams kyi snga rol na yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba'i phyir de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad du med par grub pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i phyir @212b dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams kyi snga rol na yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba'i phyir de ni ma grub pa ltar snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since the reason that proves that he does not exist conventionally is stated, it is difficult to demonstrate that the Tathāgata exists prior to the aggregates of the Tathāgata. Therefore, that reason is not established.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
translated: Moreover,🔽How could appropriation

original: nye bar len pa ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: exist without the appropriator?

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How could it exist?

original: nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa nyid nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa nyid nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The appropriated itself would be appropriation by the appropriator.

original: nye bar len pa med pa yi //🔽nye bar len pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa yi //🔽nye bar len pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Without appropriation,🔽the appropriator would not exist.

original: nye bar len pa po ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar len pa po ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “not the appropriator” is the same as “not the Tathāgata.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
translated: The Tathāgata does not exist.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa yang bsdu ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar len pa yang bsdu ba'i don te /
translated: The word “also” includes the appropriator and the appropriated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that the Tathāgata does not exist in the Tathāgata.

original: de la 'dir tshig gi don gsal ba'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni phung po lnga la gang zag med de /
analyzed: de la 'dir tshig gi don gsal ba'i dbang gis rjes su dpag pa ni phung po lnga la gang zag med de /
translated: Here, the inference is stated by the power of the meaning of the words. The person does not exist in the five aggregates,

original: byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are produced, like a pot.

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / log pa ba dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i yul nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang / yang dag pa dang / log pa ba dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i yul nyid dang / dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang /
translated: In the same way, it is stated that the person does not exist in the aggregates because they are dependently arisen, impermanent, real and unreal, the object of doubtful knowledge, the cause of pleasure and pain, and the cause of defilement and purification.

original: bden par gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //🔽gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag yang phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: bden par gtogs pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o // gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag yang phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: and because of the reasonings such as “because of belonging to the truth.”

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The Vatsiputrīya say, “The Tathāgata exists ultimately

original: de bzhin gshegs pas med do zhes lung ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas med do zhes lung ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Tathāgata did not declare, ‘He does not exist.’

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin na de ni de bzhin gshegs pas med par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin na de ni de bzhin gshegs pas med par gsungs te /
translated: Here, the Tathāgata declared, ‘He does not exist,’ in regard to what does not exist,

original: dper na mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the self that is imputed by tīrthikas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa med par ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa med par ma gsungs te /
translated: The Tathāgata did not declare, ‘He does not exist.’

original: gzhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das phan chad med dam zhes zhus pa na de ni lung ma bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i tshig des de dgag pa yang gsungs pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das phan chad med dam zhes zhus pa na de ni lung ma bstan to zhes gsungs pa'i tshig des de dgag pa yang gsungs pas /
translated: When asked, ‘Does the Tathāgata exist after attaining nirvana or not?’ he did not declare, ‘He does not exist.’

original: de'i phyir don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore the Tathāgata exists ultimately.

original: de'i phyir de ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa yin pas /
translated: Therefore, this is an autonomous inference.

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also the fault of the reason being contradictory and nonerroneously related.

original: bshad pa / de bzhin gshegs pas khang pa brtsegs ma'i nang nas skyes pa'i shing aa mra'i 'bras bu'i ro'i bye brag tu lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa dag gis gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i @213a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / de bzhin gshegs pas khang pa brtsegs ma'i nang nas skyes pa'i shing aa mra'i 'bras bu'i ro'i bye brag tu lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa dag gis gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i @213a * //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The Tathāgata’s statement in the Heap of Jewels that the taste of the mango fruit that grows in the forest is indeterminate and so on is an example of a reason that is contradictory.
